H55hzj2SeDMboAjf9lUvRA.text: I had a $25 Groupon about to expire, so we stopped here for dinner on the way to Town Square.  I had the Choo-Chee shrimp spiciness 3 out of 5.  My wife had the Garlic Garlic stir fry with chicken, 0 spiciness.  We had an order of fried egg rolls for a starter.  The meal was excellent.  I could have ordered a level 4 spiciness, but now I have an idea of their index of heat.  Andrea was thrilled with the amount of garlic with her chicken and the rich brown sauce with the chicken.  We ended the meal splitting the molten chocolate cake which was warmed.  I am really glad Groupon helped me find another good Thai restaurant and I know I'll be doing take out from here for the Garlic garlic chicken in the future.

So I tried to look by the servers and get their attention and they did look at me, but kept doing whatever they were doing which was nothing at all. It wasn't even that busy, maybe 5 tables and 3 servers. It's sad because I actually really like their food also my guy and I live right down the street so it was convenient for us, but man the service just straight sucks here. I'm a server as well so I know how these things work. I couldn't imagine doing this to anybody.   The food is great we always love coming here, or did anyway. However this happens almost every single time.. We just kept giving them the benefit of the doubt and chance after chance.. Even the people next to us, just 2 people, warned us how they've been waiting almost an hour for their food.. That's absurd.   We left and went to Archis Thai Bistro on Rainbow & 215. Always great service and we were in and out of there in less than 30 minutes.

LsgwBk0pIkQdwQDznOYGvg.text: Another Thai restaurant experience - lunch specials are the way to go I tell you! First off, Panna Thai Restaurant looks a bit more upscale than your average Thai joint, which I think reflects in the price as well. We walked in to a relatively empty restaurant on a weekday. As the waiter brought us to our table, he immediately asked if we had any coupons (before we even sat down). We did not, but apparently they do have a lot floating around and are a bit restrictive about how they are used. I think they are also on restaurant.com too. Lunch specials are available everyday from 11 am to 4 pm. They all include a fried wonton, fresh salad, steamed rice, and soup of the day. (You can substitute fried rice or brown rice for $1 more.) Started off with miso soup. Interesting choice. I went for the Yellow Curry Lunch Special with Tofu "Thai yellow curry and Thai herbs served with Jasmine rice." ($6.95). Fried tofu and potatoes were the main components of my dish. Raw bell peppers decorated the top. I wished they cooked the veggies with the curry though. The fried wonton had peas and carrots in it - a bit different than what you normally find inside one of those things. The biggest problem I had was with the rice. It was mushy - too much water in the cooker! It's never a good sign when the rice gets messed up! The Husband tried out their Garlic Short Ribs Lunch Special "Deep fried short ribs sauteed with garlic and black pepper sauce served with Jasmine rice." ($6.95) It was a tasty dish and lots of flavor, but then again it's deep fried and it sounds like it would be tasty. Overall, we found Panna Thai to be just an okay experience. There are definitely a few other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood that has a foot up on selection, taste, and price.

hJzeQ0_ewgjs6r24RsqJ8w.text: Iwas feeling so sick with allergy season and spirits way down and stopped in for sweet chile basil salmon (soooo freakin good ) perfect with the sauvignon blanc!!! Happy place excellent service from fon

g9X-83vOSlUq3cwD6dGggw.text: All you can drink Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee?!? You can't get that kind of hookup nowadays. This is my spot!   My Thai iced coffee was strong and sweet, just the way I like my men -and- coffee. Ha. I swear they topped off my large glass about 4 times while I was there. I even left with a large cup to-go! You bet I was wired off my ass by the end of the night. No regrets!   Polite and helpful service with generous portions of flavorful Thai food - and the price is fair?! I'm seriously loving this place. Here's what we tried:  * Chicken pad Thai ($8.95) - extremely moist chicken with juicy noodles! It was super flavorful and a heaping size! 5/5  * Beef pad see ew ($8.95) - fat, phat, noodles done right! Everything was moist, seasoned well and the beef was also super tender. 5/5  * Chicken and beef satay with peanut sauce, egg fried rice and cucumber salad ($12.95) - we were able to get a mix of 3 beef & 3 chicken tender skewers. Great flavor. I also loved the peanut dipping sauce!  Get extra. So good. 5/5  * Bang bang shrimp appetizer ($8.95) - this was my least favorite dish. The curry sauce was a little lackluster, watered down and the shrimp flavor was off. My party enjoyed this appetizer, but then again they aren't as critical as I am. 3/5  * Coconut sticky rice with mango (mango sticky rice)($6.95) - a perfect end to an amazing dinner! I always feel like you need a special occasion to eat this, but man, I'll make an exception to have this every time I dine here! They make it exceptionally yummy! 5/5  I love the fact that they offer free refills on the drinks! That alone made me a strong believer. It's just a huge bonus that their food is also tasty and juicy! Panna Thai, put that on your radar. ;)

She told me my order had already been picked up and on the way. 45 mins later my order showed up not fixed (we live 10 mins away). We usually eat here once a week and this will be our last due to terrible customer service.

kKPdlOyI9PSr0oL2DksgCQ.text: I took the family here for lunch today since we were in the area. I normally eat Thai once a week (at least) and I'm pretty picky Thai eater. I have my favorite Thai restaurant in town (Lucki Thai) but I decided to give Panna Thai a try. Let me tell you that we were glad we did since the food and service were excellent!! We had Beef Sa-Te (Satay), Chicken Tom Kha, Thai beef salad, and sweet basil chili chicken. I like spicy so they made it extra spicy for me and the sweet basil dish was outstanding!! Rich sauce and bold flavors and best of all, they used fresh red Thai chilies! Enough to say that It was spicy enough!! The soup was great as well, one of the best we have had in town and/or out of state. Our server (Apple) was cordial, attentive, and checked on us throughout the meal. We got to try also their fried banana dessert (on the house!) and it was delicious! I would definitely make the drive again to enjoy other dishes from their menu. I highly recommend this place to anybody looking for affordable, yet high quality Thai food. Can't wait to go again!!

1cbt7iNei6rzSBlIVk6Vsg.text: My wife and I went there for supper last night. This place is close to where we live. It was my birthday and I just finished doing a 12 hours shift. Tired and hungry, wouldn't really care less driving to other Thai restaurants in the Chinatown area. It took a while for the two of us to get seated. No one was waiting in line, but the one hostess/server was busy serving the tables and taking take out orders. Hence the wait for a table. We ordered wings of angel which was boneless chicken wings stuffed with a combination of minced pork and clear noodle, green curry chicken, pad thai, and duck noodle soup. The stuff chicken wings were excellent with just a perfect blend of seasonings in the minced pork and rice noodle. The duck noodle was also delightful. The soup had very nice flavor to complement the duck. The spicy green curry (even though we ordered it mild) was a little bit too hot for me. The pad thai was bland. Couldn't figure out why the pad thai (a staple in all Thai restaurants) was so tasteless. It wasn't until I got the bill that I found out the waitress put the order down with special instructions that said "no spice". No wonder it was bland. I would definitely come back and try some more of their other dishes like the yellow and green curry. Well worth the money, especially since we had the restuarants.com coupon. When we arrived there wasn't too many tables seated, but when we were about leave the restaurant was quite full. Pretty good business for a Wednesday night. I deducted one star for the pad thai.

Anyway, this place is must try for Thai food in Vegas!

R2hbOJeNOtPNCXaOwUtXDQ.text: My family has been going to Thai BBQ for years & we recently found out this was their sister restaurant so we decided to give it a try!  The server was very accommodating to my bf & I who were the only vegans in the table and helped make our entrees vegan friendly - we got the Spicy Basil Fried Rice (no eggs) with steamed tofu, Pad Thai with fried tofu, a small order of Tom Kha soup with steamed tofu (big enough for the both of us to share) and all were mild spice. I also ordered a Thai iced coffee and my sister ordered a Thai tea which both have non-dairy creamer in it. We loved how it's refillable - just like their Thai BBQ locations!   The food was pretty good and tasted exactly like their counterpart restaurant but none of our dishes had the spice level we asked for. We were really looking for that spicy kick to our food but had to ask for the hot sauce spice rack to add it in ourselves. Heads up that their "mild" is probably considered a 1 or 2, not like your usual mild at a Thai place which is usually at a level of 3 or 4.  My family enjoyed their dishes which included the shrimp Panang penne, pork jerky, BBQ chicken with fried rice, chicken pad Thai, crab fried rice and pork BBQ ribs. The only comment they had was the crab fried rice barely had any crab in it but overall they had a good experience.   Service was good and the restaurant definitely had a fancy ambiance.

oklLag6PDEbTBD8Zog5QEg.text: Try the duck noodle soup. It's so rich in flavor, the bok choy is still crispy and fresh. The duck is tender. Try the soup with egg noodles. The portion is so big you could share with another person or have some for leftovers

gC1ifl1hXCqREd7x7mG1ow.text: So far the best Thai food in southwest region of Las Vegas. Love it here. Everything I've had here has been very tasty. The sa te and peanut sauce is delicious. The bbq chicken is incredible. The egg fried rice is yummy. This place reminds me of the delicious Thai food I ate when I was growing up. The only reason why I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the inconsistency of the quality. Some days the chicken is dry and soup is over powered with fish sauce. Other than that I would definitely recommend this place.

MfIX_fn5iTm_1nKKmf92WA.text: I ordered the Panang curry and it's good but there's a lot of meat. I'd prefer to have an equal amount of vegetables and meat

5ZZVdhfqZlVwP8n_3fZlJw.text: Decided to give it a try, since I was in that plaza.  Nope! Don't trust the reviews.  The pad Thai was not good and the steamed dumplings were dried up to the point where I couldn't even bite through them.  There are much better and cheaper places near by.

loKQDBC-D5B0d2GtvBofCQ.text: Out of three Thai places near my house this one is the best. They have many great seafood dishes, like soft shell crab and crab fried rice. Very good service, very nicely decorated and prices are reasonable. Will definitely return frequently as I love Thai food!

gYUd1WaZDW8k27xHqX5-MQ.text: Nice atmosphere, great service & good food. Ordered the chicken curry fettuccine and shrimp panang curry. I felt our meal was just average, didn't really stand out to me. I was pretty disappointed because the curry was like soup! I like mine a little bit thicker consistency so i thought maybe this is just how they make theirs? But the flavor was definitely there. I like that their menu is very presentable and has many of the common Thai dishes i enjoy, that i would like to try next time. Probably pass on the curry. As for the thai tea, i saw on a "tip" for Panna Thai that it is unlimited thai tea and thai coffee..which sold me because no place ever does refill on thai tea. It has been a few yrs since that was posted but they may want to change that. Instead it is limited to 2 refills, still better than none!

fTp9gB7U9WYgCnvVC_vuew.text: Made a stop here for lunch today after checking out the reviews.  Lunch hour wasn't that busy and I was seated rather promptly.  The server was polite and provided the lunch specials as well as the full menu.    Their menu has the classics along with some unique dishes  (ie. Salmon nuggets, Chicken curry fettuccine).  After some delay I ordered the cucumber salad as a starter and the Sweet Basil Chicken with steamed broccoli (they offer sliced or ground chicken options which is nice.  Overall assessment was that the staff was attentive, flavors of the main dish needed some work (ie. Soggy and cold egg roll, watered down sauce for the Sweet Basil Chicken - some "sliced" pieces were stringy and varied in size, and the veggie soup that comes with the special is mainly cabbage while still bland). Thai restaurants run rampant here in the city, so I was hoping it would compete well amongst Gata Thai, Naga Thai, Weera and even Pin Kaow. A 3-star rating is a fair grade. I'll continue to save my Thai cravings for the Henderson area.

I also get takeout pretty frequently, and my order is always ready within 30 minutes, usually even less! The prices are beyond reasonable, and the portions usually last me a couple meals. I feel so lucky to live so close to this gem of a restaurant!

3KS2nBZGwCZEFxeRD8xAcA.text: It's a nice place to get Thai food! Usually delicious without a doubt but the service sometimes is hit or miss. I've had dining occasions where everything came out perfectly timed and had a flawless experience. I've also had experienced where the boyfriends entree came out before the appetizer. Then his pre dinner soup 5 min later then the appetizer 5 min later. THEN 10 min later MY entree showed up and my boyfriend was already done eating. They gave a 10% discount off the whole bill which was a nice recovery. She was also extremely apologetic which helped. Hopefully she learns from this mistake because this is a huge no no in food and bev.

YnE0GkxrzadiIXg1cb5bsw.text: I tried this place out 3 times, but only because I was working across the street.    1 Star Because the food is EXCELLENT - I tried there BBQ Rib lunch special and it was amazing.  There Egg Noodle Soup is also very very good.  The duck noodle soup is good also.  The food is not super high quality but they make it work.  1 Star Because the service is very good and nice.  They know every person that comes in by first name and provide a friendly atmosphere  1 Star Because the Thai Tea is very good.  Any that restaurant for me should have excellent Thai Tea.  The portion is a bit small but standard.  1 Star Because the parking is easy and the spot is big enough to fit everyone and you are seated immediately.  -1 Star due to the food taking a very long time.  A lunch is 1 hour standard for most people.  I work across the street and cannot get my food in time.  It takes at least 40 min for the food to come out and i made it back late to work.  every time.  I even left early to go eat at panna thai and i was still late.  One time, every single person in the restaurant did not have food.  Total: 3 Stars = Eat on weekends and nighttime if you are local.  Not a place to drive far to eat or if you are rushed on time.

wNC9RsBmevaab8n4UOsQ7w.text: Love that place.  Good food for great price ! My favorite is Padthai noodles with tofu.  Just one day the cook must have been different because my noddles were very hard to chew.  Other than that it's perfect.

CZgGCnDiclhc5Vy-8l897w.text: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Las Vegas.  I drive over 30 miles each way to this restaurant.   Service: Is always on par  Food: I love that they've added tapas style plates. I get to gave several of my favorite things at once.  Be careful when ordering a spicy dish. We ordered most of our food medium or a #8 and it was really hot.  I drank more water and ate less food.   Atmosphere: It's a typical table and booth dinning, nothing special.  There is a television for those guys who want to stay up to date on their games.

N-qMNeCYjejP_NH1lAYikw.text: Ive only ordered delivery from this restaurant, never actually been inside... but twice now I've been very impressed!  Food is delicious!  And even the take out has good presentation. Portions are reasonable... not huge shareable size like many places. Some people may not like that. But I thought it was perfect. Warning... I ordered Spicy on my pad thai and it was REALLY spicy!  Lol. But I like things hot. The tuna taretare was really light with a unique tangy flavor that I loved. And the roasted vegetables were delicious, also served with a yummy tangy dressing. Will be ordering from here a lot!

-ZTKUdsCsfEq5KjkRDIq-g.text: So this is the 2nd time we have been here and I have to write how great our experience was this time!! Our waitress was apple she showed great hospitality and really made us feel welcome. Great part about it was that she used to work at arawan one of our favorite places before so we remembered each other. Ok so onto the food. Me and the wife started off our appetizers with the divine scallops man was it good!! Very well harmonized taste. It was a little spicy with an herbal Thai kind of taste to it. But wow we really enjoyed ourselves!! We also had the steamed dumplings mmm it was delicious. I thought it would have just been a basic dumpling taste but boy was I wrong it had so many delicious taste to it. So onto our entrees my wife got the seafood eggplant. The seafood eggplant was such a well portioned delicious meal. Came with eggplant, shrimp, fish, squid, muscles, bell peppers, & onions. I got the bbq spare ribs. Bbq spare ribs was fall off the bone good! Literally the meat was so tender!! Overall my experience has made me very happy with our dinner tonight. So please come here it's great and such a chill place to eat at!!

L_-dXjDa_pDAx1Ra2E7VwQ.text: I'm reviewing solely on their delivery service (and food). I've ordered from here through Eat24 a couple of times and both times they have been on schedule. My recent order included Panang Curry, Steamed Dumplings, and Tasty Ginger (with shrimp).  The curry was delicious. I ordered a mild but it came with a kick. Not sure if they got it wrong, or my tolerance is very low. It was creamy and very coconutty. The chicken was also nice and tender. I didn't really care for the dumplings. They were good, but they had an off taste that I couldn't quite figure out. The dipping sauce that came with the dumplings was a bit too strong in flavor. The tasty ginger with shrimp was my favorite. It had just the right amount of ginger and spices and the shrimp (peeled) was perfectly cooked. Their Thai tea is also very good (pretty generous with the cream, which I like).  If you're ordering through Yelp Eat24, the entrees come with rice. The menu doesn't state that. I wish I knew beforehand because I ordered 2 servings of rice and it came with 4.

iAn65i03YaoDpsg5SW9OHw.text: Not your typical Thai Restaurant. We tried the Bang Bang Shrimp and the Scallops for dinner and they were amazing. The shrimp was in a curry sauce. For my entree, I had the yellow curry with Scallops. I was actually pretty amazing by the quality of Scallops. They were not the small ones, they were the bigger - good quality ones. It was a bit spicy but it was perfect and complimented the side of rice that came with our order. I also tried their skewers and they were also really good. The place is really clean and modern unlike a lot of Thai places that I've been to. I honestly thought that this was just going to be "another Thai restaurant" but it definitely went beyond my expectations. Try this if you're craving for good and authentic Thai food.

HC4Z6Hzw4ZEImhG3GClEMA.text: We visited this place to day for the first time.  We were really expecting to like this place based on all the reviews we have seen, but we were very disappointed. The place has a nice interior and were greeted immediately and seated.  No one explained the menu, but we asked many questions.  We ordered the lunch special of Pad Thai, salad, soup and egg rolls.  Items came out rather quickly.  The soup first and it was probably the most tasty thing we had.  The main orders came next and they had forgotten my egg roll, but they showed up with them in just a minute or so after advising them.  They stuck an extra in there for the mistake.  The egg rolls were fairly tasty.  Our main entrees however were basically bland, no spice, no taste at all.  I could tell I was chewing something, but you really could not tell what. My wife also agreed that it was tasteless.

KPUBPmcgUtVHC9uY3Nw_ag.text: Lots of excellent Thai food restaurants in Vegas, thankfully. The food here is good but the service really bad compared to other Thai restaurants in the area. They charge a lot for delivery and for extra additions to their rather bare dishes. They were extremely rude to my wife on the phone with our last order and hung up on her after getting our order wrong.   A few times I've gone in to pick up orders with a massive queue of other disgruntled take out customers waiting for their food for over 45 minutes. And they expect you to say sorry for being upset with them! I rarely ever leave negative reviews but this is a classic example of the mixed bag of service you get in the city which should take customer service more seriously since it's the only industry keeping the city afloat.

wzFp5-wXxg6ygCt63mupMA.text: Really good pineapple fried rice, crying tiger and lychee sake. The crying tiger is melt in your mouth and the sauce was fantastic!! Good portion with reasonable prices and great service:D

iAKrRptIl4hJAng2DkFlbA.text: Panna Thai is the sister company of Thai BBQ, which my family and I been coming to since I was a kid!  So knowing that, their menu is pretty similar and the ambiance is great. It's more of a modern twist with Thai vibes.   I celebrated my best friend's birthday here with her family and we ordered a whole bunch of items to share from bbq chicken to pad Thai, salad and fried rice and you can't forget The unlimited refills for Thai Iced Tea, AMAZING!  Definitely a neighborhood friendly spot and great menu to choose from!

ng8zKFHwJxJzv61jG0ACqA.text: Went here to celebrate my parents' anniversary with a large group of family. We reserved 8 tables in a section of the restaurant and had a dedicated server. The food was served one by one like a numbered course meal, and each dish was fresh. All the food tasted good, and the mango sticky rice dessert was shaped like a heart!  The server was pretty attentive, and we got our refills at good intervals. Free refills on Thai tea!

3lU-ophYW11jV-s4cFtfww.text: It is difficult to find a Thai restaurant with bad food, but to find one that is also cool and modern is just what we needed.  Plus: The food, the services and the location is amazing. Plenty of easy parking space available as well.  Cons: None that I could find so far other that they asked me like 25 times I wanted more Chai tea.

_9DyL-U-Te20f5EuPxnZuA.text: Was looking for new Thai place close to home.  We found this place.  The service was great! The food super tasty.  My daughter met us here and she's pretty picky.  She loved  the food too.  The fried Wontons were perfect and bang bang shrimp super tasty.  Must try!

VRIYZ3sM2wdl1x0_4KkF9A.text: The food is not only excellent the portions are large too. The staff and service is also Top notch!

4pBeUC9PqF3B5Xqi_G4qQA.text: I love the Thai ice tea here!  I recommend this place I also loved the bbq chicken they serve big portions which I love!

6kY2za7v-MsGdDXL2x3VUA.text: I am so happy to have a good tasting Thai restaurant literally just 2 minutes away from me!!! From my most recent visit here, I got the papaya salad and the beef pad see ew. From my pictures it looks like the portions are small but those two were enough to really fill me up (and I eat a lot). For the papaya salad, I got to choose a spicy level from 1-10 and I got a 6 and it was actually pretty spicy which I appreciate, but my favorite was my pad see ew. The beef was so tender and it was actually thick slices of beef which makes it so much more better. The noodles were not dry, they were perfectly soft. They also have a lunch deal as well so if you just want something small for a good price, ask about it!

iksGbmwlxyaOiqmC9XB7iQ.text: Ordered through door dash and estimated time of 30 minutes. Placed order and it said an hour - ok. Got a message saying it would be 20 minutes past that. So delivery was completely disappointing. we ordered pad see ew, massaman and fried rice - all level 8. They must have completely ignored that request as everything was zero spice. The three entrees we ordered came with a tiny serving of rice too... normally you get rice per entree. The massaman curry was the most pathetic thing I have ever seen - maybe three pieces of chicken and one potato chunk. All of the to go items were in different packaging and unorganized. So disappointed for the price definitely not worth it !!!

ewUEJJyssnHYhGh4q0n1Zw.text: Clean restaurant and delicious lunch special! Free thai tea if you leave review here on yelp :) yumm!

BuJfLEx4jMwdK5nDQCZLdw.text: Garbage! Never ordering from here again. Surrang right down the street is way better! Ordered from here to try them out and literally took a few bites and threw out the food.

VbdIROCei7f0mCPamqQI4g.text: Every single time I have eaten here, I have only ordered the Beef Salad & the Monster (Shrimp Salad) every time!  I'm addicted to the sauce & the vegetables in the salad are fresh!  The fried tofu is the only appetizer I get cause it to comes w/ an amazing & addicting sauce.    One day I may or may not ever try something new cause for me, it's just that type of restaurant.  I love these two salads... strange, but a must-try!  Especially if you want to eat alil healthy.!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The MONSTER shrimp salad soo good!  The best!

61yBSiWIzZNvn06mWy1pGw.text: I usually don't like or prefer Thai food but I really enjoyed the pepper steak! Cooked perfectly and packed with flavor. It was pretty spicy but to me it was perfect. My family was also happy with their meals. The Thai tea was delicious as well. The best part for me was the service. Our server was super attentive and friendly. Will definitely be back :)!

GKz5Zk9btLmP5iiIU2pKCw.text: I have been to Panna Thai a handful of times over the years. It's never busy, but it's never empty every time I have been.  It's simple to call & order pick-up, which would be ready in 15 min. However, I suggest to never order Thai Tea if it's pick-up. It's great when you dine-in & you can get unlimited refills, but as for pick-up, it's never as good. I'm going to assume that they make the Thai Tea when you call, which in time, will sit & be watered down by the time you pick-up. I also suggest to pass on adding boba. I never find it fresh.  Other than that, their food is good & their portion sizes are good. I have always liked all the food I tried. My go-to is the Spicy Crab Noodle, which is made with legit crab & large enough to share with another person. Panna Thai is a good option to eat at with a family & share different items on the menu. You can end your meal with a Mango Sticky Rice for dessert!

4wO9IqLC3S-EajRLXw4P8A.text: We have ordered food here about 20 times. We usually have it delivered and had had nothing but great experiences. The food is SO good, arrives steaming hot and delicious. This is our go to Thai restaurant. I LOVE their curries. I've had masaman, yellow, red, pineapple with chicken and tofu with added vegetables. We always get the crab wontons too. My husband gets noodle or soup. Always delicious!  Update, 3/30/18 I still love this place. I just picked up food to go. So delicious!!!!! Just everything...so perfect. I'm a fan.

jJ7XMgdkajy27Xmu_XOvNw.text: The best MANGO CHICKEN!!! Very authentic and fresh thai food!! Everytime we order an entree we notice that they're not stingy when it comes to putting any meats & main dishes unlike other restaurants. Great service & a must try JASMINE GREAT TEA to wash off the whole meal.

qL4r7WSm9fsXN3oHA17hiA.text: Ordered delivery a few times with good success, but they've gotten worse and worse for delivery.  Last 'attempt' was over 2 hours before cancelling.  Use to love them, but too many strikes lately to be willing to try'm again.

qrlJ9SpKFxnSchosg8NdsA.text: Since we moved to this area almost 2 mos ago, every place we try here seems to be amazing! Honestly, Panna Thai might be the best Thai food that I have ever had! I lived in LA and San Fran as well, so I know my Asian cuisine! :) And they participate in the Yelp Order Online feature?!?!? I am so happy to live less than 1 mi from this restaurant n other tasty spots!!!!

ilqKLVvnlG4ZfbYv3km_DA.text: This thai place is very good but ordered it too much over a period time.   But recommend it if you live in the area or craving thai. They deliver and the inside of the restaurant is clean and welcoming.  Recommend their chicken panang curry, beef pad thai, shrimp tom yum soup and my absolute favorite their crab cream cheese rangoon's.  If you have a sweet tooth their mango & sticky rice is pretty good and the mango is already sliced in slices for easy eat.

85F5m1-MwRb7X9J1AGjFEw.text: First of all, after waiting almost 20 minutes, I had to leave my table to ask for a glass of water. I ordered crab fried rice with no egg extra garlic. I also explained, I have a allergy to egg. When the plate arrived, it had lots of egg. I explained to Ann, the order was incorrect. Ann was so unbelievably rude. She tried to convince me that the egg needed to be in the plate even after I explained for the second time, I have an allergy to egg. Even after correcting my order, I waited  20 minutes after I was done eating for  the check  to arrive to my table.  Not once did they come by to pick up my plates so I just put it in the table next to me. Jump is the name of another employee there and honestly he was very professional and apologized then tried to encourage  me to come back. Unfortunately, first time impressions last forever and I will never come back.   Becomes of the nice guy named Jump I  gave a two star instead of one.

0k9Us_71Z5SnJgciss7Wng.text: Very good Thai food!  I like the atmosphere here...it's very clean and friendly.  The food prices were also good, especially during lunch time!  Most plates were around $7.  On to the food!  Basil Noodle ($8.50): "Pad Kee Mao", Pork, Stir Fried Thick Rice Noodles, Chili Basil, Scrambled Egg, Bell Pepper and Onion. This was not bad...not very hot though for a 10/10. I also found the pork to be a little thick and tougher than I am used to at other Thai restaurants.  THIS is one the dishes I compare all other Thai restaurants in town...and this one wasn't very noteworthy :(  Chili Basil ($6.95): "Pad Ka Pao" in Lunch Portion, Ground up Chicken, Sauteed with Sweet Basil, Onion, Bell Pepper, Fresh Chili, and Jasmine Rice. This was a great version of the staple! The most spicy out of all the dishes...it was still far from a 10/10 though!  It was good though, and better than most out there!  Panang Curry in Lunch Portion : Coconut Milk, Curry Paste, Thai Herbs, and Jasmine Rice. This was a great version as well, with just the right amount of spices, flavor and heat! I love Panang curry...and they have a great one here!  Again, better than most I've had out here!  Pad Thai in Lunch Portion : Chicken, Stir Fried Rice Noodles, Scrambled Egg, Shallot, Bean Sprouts, and Tamarind Sauce. This was Grandpa's order...it was good! A bit sweet, but good overall!  I'd say it would be on par with the others I've tried.  Thai Iced Tea ($3)...unlimited refills! It was a good rendition as well, but you can't beat free refills...yeeeee!  Great choice for Thai food if you are in the area!  Pics :

-8qGfznmWvayAU_1dmdlLw.text: Excellent food and great service. We had a company Christmas party at the restaurant with more than 30 people. The food came out on time with no delayed, presentation is really nice and taste good on all dishes. The service is also excellent, very friendly and attentive. I would recommend to reserved your table 2-3 weeks in advance for the party as they can get really busy. The item that I would recommend is Sa-tay, pad thai, pepper steak, spicy green curry, and the BBQ. I will go to Panna Thai every time I think of Thai food.

63uOKhqTivKMADhHlpIfSQ.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant! Best Thai food ever ! Highly recommended . The fried rice is really good .

mA4DNQ_J8xZM4sZZWSHqvw.text: I'm so in love with this menu!  MUST MUST TRY THE DUCK ROLL!!! Even if u don't like sushi - don't be fooled by its deceiving look of it- it's NOT sushi but Man is it AmaZeballs! Everything I've ordered both times has been fantastic & gets here quickly - friendly delivery drivers This place is s real stand out amongst the many Thai places available in vegas - LOVE IT!!!

HImnx-zMx7Z3B4liXhDclw.text: We were in town on vacation and wanted a quiet night in, so we had our dinner delivered. It was great. The Pad Thai was really good and the coconut ice cream was delish!

3L0bHJRSZkEWKz29J6YSWw.text: Great food, great prices. Everytime I order delivery always on time and accurate with my order. Food shows up hot and delicious. Panna is always my first choice for thai food. The Panang Curry is my favorite dish, if you get this get the combination you will love it. Wonton soup is some of the best soup I have ever had.  I always recommend Panna Thai over other restaurants in the area.

21AUdTH5_dSUiIlL_9PK0Q.text: The BF regularly orders from here when he's at work. I get leftovers when he overorders- which isn't all that often, actually. The thai jerky and the crab fried rice are consistently good options, but I especially like combining the two. The dipping sauce for the jerky is awesome! They do have a $20 minimum for delivery.

BPW32pQv-NOwdFeoyOdWug.text: It's small, food is excellent! Polite courteous service.  Well... the Panang is still excellent, but the noodle dish was dry noodles with dry pork, tasteless and useless. They didn't add the chicken I paid extra for either.

zKnFPxnd6E-FwH3h3xtI3Q.text: Every time I call they look up my number by my phone number and they have a history of my order. So easy and efficient. They're super friendly and they offer great customer service! Thank you!

tXXrA4WWjWGUHnvDpEZxTg.text: I have tried panna thai a few times and I've never been blown away by anything I have ordered. I normally do pick up and they are pretty quick (ready in about 10-15 minutes)  The chicken pad Thai ($8.50) is pretty bland flavor wise but the spice level is pretty spot on (I typically order a 4 or 5 spice level). I have also tried the yellow chicken curry ($8.95) which is just OK. All of the items range from about $5-$18 apps to chef specialities and the portion size is pretty good especially for the price point.  I'm not in any big rush to come back but overall food was decent at a good price.

76oLXcm0EIhQyurVfz0vbw.text: Ordered take out which was ready promptly at the promised time. We had pad see ew & egg rolls, noodles were alright, a big mushy & didn't have a ton of flavor. My husband & I both commented that it was "just ok." The egg rolls fell into that same category. Had very high hopes due to the positive reviews but this just fell a bit flat for us. Maybe it's better when it's eaten in the restaurant?

vo2rDtESeWJaoXAqUgj9OQ.text: We tried many different Thai restaurants after moving to Las Vegas and continued to be disappointed until we hit the jackpot by finding PANNA THAI.  It is a real winner in every sense....the location, the service, the atmosphere, and oh yes, the food!!  The food is absolutely delicious and served hot and fresh.  The service personnel are excellent and Apple remembers us each and every time we walk in. She is the best!!  We highly recommend this for people who truly enjoy authentic Thai at its very best!!!!

OXad_lmrqv1PjH5cK81N4A.text: Some of the best thai food I've had. Tried Massaman curry with beef and pad thai w/ squid. Both great.

xe3DOhgcbSKZzS7p7rkcLg.text: Great Thai food ! Their vegetable chow mein and fried rice are very good. Would recommend!

cpVEOJv8hsjkEM7aSkFrYg.text: Ordered this last night with Postmates.  It was horrible.  The food was so spicy, even at their lowest setting, that we couldn't even eat it.  I spent $80 for three people to not eat the food.  Awful.  I do not recommend this unless you like food that is so hot and spicy that you can't eat it.

JUbUafryqp_8HIG8S4N8gw.text: The food here is a definite must have if you're adventurous and looking to try new things. Their service is incredible and there's a calming ambiance throughout the restaurant. My go-to dish is the BBQ pork noodle soup, but there's something for everyone there.

FA__mH3ZHM1QIisSL4KODQ.text: Clean restaurant, solid service, DELICIOUS food and awesome lunch specials. If you come in for lunch they get you out so you can be back in the office in the hour. Will be back, thank you guys!

pUKvv8RxJ-n4nFmTninjtA.text: Excellent Thai food I will always order from here. I highly recommend this location if you're looking for good food near Rhodes Ranch.

mFXg0yjxFDQgWEBfDUbfOA.text: Excellent food and fantastic service.  Try the spicy crab noodle, it was the bomb. And the bang bang shrimp.

MR0DFZN61amF_lEDjld2sw.text: Fairly typical Thai dishes, well done with lots of veggie choices. One of the few thai restaurants that gives you refills of thai iced tea which should be the standard for a $4 drink. Nice atmosphere and friendly service. Hard to quibble with that.

zIBVLHgp02I_y7UAR8p0Nw.text: Our first time eating here. It's near where we live which is a bonus. The food is great! We tried the steam dumplings, roasted duck and duck salad, all were great. Only drawback is service being slow, only checked on us once and had to get up to ask for refill.

qPzXXhQI34r4Oj7uh5EHEg.text: This place was delicious even at the end of the night! The food was fresh and hot! I tried the chicken pad Thai and it was absolutely delicious, I also tried the cups which were SO good! The mushroom and chicken Tomyum soup was yummy as well.

jF9n2c0uu53f3KAeKcacPA.text: It's the 2nd time we ate here. First time we came was based off Yelp reviews and the fact that we just live down the road next to Wet n Wild. My husband and I are vegetarians but not strict enough to worry about fish sauce or similar stuff like that. We mostly just order the food with tofu instead of meat or seafood. This place does it well. Very much comparable to our favourite Thai place which is just a little further from home - Archi's on Rainbow.  The first time we came, I ordered the lunch special - both of us agreed that the soup that came with it was so tasty! I had the Pad Thai and he had the tofu Panang Curry. Both delicious!!  Today we tried the Summer Rolls with peanut sauce!! OMG YUM! Will definitely order it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer Rolls! Vegetarian friendly and so tasty!

-ToKpSICN3_cB7HFo0vhZQ.text: I've been to several Thai restaurants in our area and stumbled on to Panna. One word...amazing!! The Bang Bang shrimp with crab curry is out of this world! The garlic beef was filled with unlimited flavor. Best of all, our server Apple was so hospitable and gave us a complimentary dessert. The ambience is chill and the restaurant is very well kept. We plan on being regulars at Panna. Till next time!

v-JcM_RnNEEwdVZR1CrWTA.text: Ordered from here and was told it would be to my home within 45 mins...  An hour and a half later I got a call from the restaurant asking if they had the correct address, I informed them of the correct address and was told they would be to my home ASAP... 30 mins later I called the restaurant and was told a lie that they didn't know what to do with the food and was told another story by not only the manager but the original driver who contacted me. noEVFIK7VcqXjEarg9CEDA.text: I was eating at Panna Thai restaurant last night with my wife. The experience was a very good one. The food was great and the atmosphere wasn't bad either. I had the bbq chicken and it was juicy. My wife had the sate skewers. Both of us enjoyed the meals. We had the spring rolls and the beef Thai salad. That salad I can eat all day long. It was very flavorful and I wanted another one but didn't want to be a pig. Everyone should try that salad. It is a salad I can have every day and wouldn't tire of it. Overall a very good place to have dinner at. Also try the fried banana with coconut. That was a real treat. Thank you for the wait staff that gave the fried banana coconut dessert it was wonderful. They were friendly from the start and your drinks were always refilled quick. Thank you again for a pleasant atmosphere

f0iIJ9zrdTNekLwnyDspUQ.text: This is our first time visiting Panna Thai restaurant. The restaurant is very close to IKEA on the southwest side of town. The staff are very friendly and attentive. Joe was our server and he take his times to explain the food on the menu. He even give us a complimentary larb for father's day special which is excellent. Larb chicken was served on a lettuce wedge and it taste like chicken salad with lime vinaigrette dressing wrap with lettuce. We start our course with Steamed dumpling,  Scallop tamarind and Golden cup. We love all the appetizers that we ordered,  and their Steamed dumpling is totally caught me by surprise.  A lot of Thai and Chinese restaurant that I'd been to usually use the dumpling that are available in most of the Asian supermarket but Panna dumpling is different, they made their own dumpling fresh from start. The Scallop tamarind is excellent, the scallop is huge and fresh with sweet tamarind sauce,  a perfect combination. We had Beef satay dinner,  Crispy duck,  and Seafood eggplants for our main dish and everything are excellent. They serve their Seafood eggplants on the hot sizzling plate and it can be very very hot, please watch out for the sizzling plate for parents with young children. Joe said customer can request the servers to serve it on regular plate. Up to this point we are so stuff with all the foods that we order but we really want to try their Mango sticky rice.  We order that for takeout since we're so full but I will definitely go back for more. The server said they will have new menu coming out in the next few months. Last but not least,  the price is very decent and all the customer looks like they had a food coma after they finished their food.  Save some space and try their dessert,  fried bananas with icecream and young coconut with icecream and sticky is already on my wish list!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free !father day Lettuce Larb

HizroAZFxJkQePM-Wzj85A.text: I absolutely love this restaurant and I'm always treated wonderfully here. I've been going for several years now and it's definitely my favorite Thai restaurant. One of my favorite things is that you can get the lunch specials with fried rice because most Thai restaurants in Las Vegas will only give you white rice, when you order for just one person.   I love the dishes and some of my favorites are the pad see ew, bbq spare ribs, salmon, beef and chicken skewers. I also highly recommend you try substituting Chinese broccoli instead of regular broccoli on many of the dishes and soups.  Last but not least, the waitresses are so beautiful and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Thai Flautas and Butterfly Pea Flower drink.

ez4Ij5w1s8dCejrWL8uWQw.text: That jasmine rice alone is something special!! I love the ribs, chicken on a stick & the cucumber salad!!!! The food is always presented so neat & beautiful.  I'm convinced this place just might be addicting...

ExHzLmriVGiXwkOLq2NJ6w.text: The food was 5 stars all the way! Tuna tartar appetizer is a must....egg rolls and dumplings are great too! Service was extra slow! There were only two young ladies working the dining room doing everything...I felt bad for them but this made our experience slow and long. We will eat here again....I think we will just order take out and enjoy at home!

uQ1MwX5SN1MEFg7lnVFpsw.text: My boyfriend and I dine in occasionally, but most of the time we take advantage of their delivery service. Sure, it's just a couple of minutes down the road, but you know how it is when you get lazy.  Our few experiences at the restaurant have been pleasant. We've never had to wait for seating. The service is always prompt. We've had the same waitress during each visit and she always has a smile on her face.  We've come to like their Chicken Pad See-Ew with Chinese broccoli and their Beef Satay dinner. It's more than enough for the two of us. The satay is always tender and well seasoned and the fried rice that accompanies it is quite flavorful. The Pad See-Ew, though it is one of our favorites, can be off sometimes. Most of the time it's spot on (the chicken is tender and the noodles are al dente), but there have been a couple of occasions where it has been bland or too peppery. But again, it's not all the time and that's why we continue to get it.   We have, also, tried their Garlic Short Ribs, Wings of Angel, Shrimp Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Tom Yum Soup. Everything has been good, so far, so we'll continue to enjoy our friendly neighborhood Thai restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Short Ribs Lunch Special
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite dish... the pad see ew! Mmm...

bZ29A1_FjxxQRK232FBp-g.text: Food was satisfying, service was good, and dessert was delightful!   I have to say though... I've had same dessert twice, Sweet Sticky Rice w/ Homemade Coconut Ice Cream & the quality/ taste the 2nd time was not as great.  My Favorites: Fried Calamari - Parmesan cheese?! Yup & it was goood. Chili Basil (Beef) - Savory Pad See-Ew - Good Yellow Curry - Full of Flavor & Spices

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

6c4YQgwHu66sYoi2Wz-y1g.text: Probably the best Thai restaurant I've been to. Been here a few times & nothing has changed.  Interior is exquisite, classy ambiance, super clean, friendly servers, good relaxing music & most importantly, delicious food!  My favorites are Yellow Curry, Chicken Sa-Te, Garlic Short Ribs, Pepper Steak & of course, Pad Thai!  The best part? THAI TEA is fresh, authentic & REFILLABLE. I know, I know. It's crazy. They were even so nice to pour me a to-go Thai Tea for the road.  I LOVE PANNA THAI!

4b4q-BbRNGIOCQPR4ksIWA.text: After several lunches, I have found this place has grown on me.  The flavors, the service, the ambience, and yes, even the price, are always on point.  Even the simple cup of soup served with the lunch special is delicious and comforting.  How does one make broth with vegetables taste like that? The next time I'm sick, I'm going to call in an order just for the soup.  The chili basil chicken with brown rice is my go-to menu item for lunch.  I like that brown rice is an option.  I also like the free refills on Thai iced tea.  I leave feeling satisfied and happy.

451xl_bdDL3lnVx84hPR4Q.text: I've been going to Panna Thai since it first opened and it's still my favorite Thai restaurant in the valley. I used to always eat at their first restaurant (Thai BBQ on Jones) when I was in high school and when they opened Panna my family would come here almost every other week for dinner since it was closer to home. I love their Thai Tea and I've yet to find any place that beats theirs. It's pretty sweet, but very refreshing and creamy. Their service is always great and their takeout business seems very lively.   Now for the food, I'll throw out a lot of recommendations but keep in mind I always eat in so I'm not sure how well things keep for delivery or takeout. For noodles, their Pad See-ew and Pad Thai are consistently delicious. I typically go for Beef Pad See-ew or Chicken Pad Thai. For curries, I almost always get a Beef Panang Curry because it's probably my favorite thing on the menu. You can adjust the spiciness to whatever you want too. If Panang isn't your style, I'd recommend the Green Curry with chicken. Other amazing things include: Herbal Fish Salad, which is a bunch of strips of crispy white fish with a unique vinaigrette on greens. Tom Kha soup with chicken, which is like a sour soup with coconut milk and mushrooms.   They have affordable lunch specials here too. I usually go for the Beef Sate (~$8) or the Garlic Short Ribs (~$7). The short ribs are packed with a lot of flavor in a garlic sauce and the beef sate is like three skewers of meat with good egg fried rice.  All in all, I've been to Panna a bunch of times and have never had a bad experience. They're very consistent and they make good Thai food as well as some specialty fusion dishes. It's a great place to go for large groups too. They serve beer and wine and have a TV if there's a certain game you need to watch. But seriously, get the Thai Tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pad Seew

nTv4nRIjKQUgQx6tGbse8A.text: I hate to leave a bad review, because the food is good, the pricing is fair and I've been a customer of theirs for quite some time. The lack of customer service today was terrible. I ordered food from this location about 2 to 3 weeks ago, they had messed up my order as I ordered Pad see Ew and they gave me chicken PAN TAI I found out later when I had already got home, So rather than be upset, I called and gave them a chance to do the right thing and offer me something. They offered me a free pad see ew and said they would notate a record in their system. I called today to place an order for takeout, And asked if they Honor the free Pad See Ew. I spoke to one lady she seemed puzzled and asked to speak to someone else. Then, I spoke to a gentleman that also seemed puzzled, but he did check whatever he checked and said there was no record on file.    I am the type of person that lives by his word and since they could not live up to their's, I will no longer support any of their locations as I am about honor and they have proved they are not.

MHBhYQ9-pVd9zvS82QO3rA.text: We were celebrating our anniversary on New Years night and thought this restaurant was the perfect spot. I was wrong.   We entered the restaurant with no issue as we were seated right away. And that's when everything went wrong. The waitress took a long while to get our order,  and when we were ready, my girlfriend asked if we can have all our orders delivered at the same time. This is because her main dish was tom kha kai which tends to come in first because they're served as an appetizer. She also ordered pineapple fried rice with that because that's how she enjoys the soup. Back to the order, when she asked the waitress if all our food be delivered at the same time, the rep retorted a not-so-reassuring, "Uhm... I hope so." She chuckled and walked away. Experiencing was displeasing as if they weren't even going to try and make it happen.  We waited a while for our food to come in, and guess what? They all came in separately. First, it was the chicken satay which we ate pretty quickly. Then we got the soup and my noodle entree. My girlfriend tried waiting for the fried rice when she realized that her soup was getting cold. Very displeasing to see her not eat with me. At that point, she started eating the soup and thinking twice about the other order that was still late. So she went up to another server to tell them that she didn't want that order anymore.   The food was very basic. Nothing about it stood in mind. My noodles lacked a little bit of sauce as it appeared dry. The satay was rubbery and the peanut sauce that went along with it was bland. My girlfriend liked her soup but was not impressed about the mushroom used with it. Still, it hit the spot.   Overall, would we come back for a second round? No. The restaurant was courteous enough to give us a 10% off discount for the trouble, which was surprising because it didn't really seem like they cared from the beginning. Anyway, we're too paranoid for repeated offender so I think we'll pass this restaurant and go somewhere else.
