My other favorites here are pad Thai, coconut soup, pad seew, and papaya salad. If you need extra spice, just ask! The waitresses really go above and beyond here. Never had the opportunity to thank the chefs, so thank you! Thanks everyone!

nUFDBWEp5FtfPUx0H3R38Q.text: I think without Panna and their lunch specials -- awesome food if I may add, half of the nurses at work would starve. Just saying. :D  So thank you Panna for delivering your delicious, inexpensive, and convenient food to us!

vN97gojEfyGLbERBMk94RA.text: Terrible place for Thai food all frozen our Appetizers we're cold we sent them back 2nd the Shrimp  pad Thai was cold and shrimp tasted fishy we decided to pass on them remaking our original  Appetizers the server insisted that they'll be better even after we told her we'd pass on it we were ok with just the chicken satee but she brought them back out  told us the chef made them all over again we didn't want to argue with the server so we said fine snd again tasted freezer burnt dry nasty bland We just wanted the check she kept asking if we wanted desert we replied No. Thank you just the check ! Very irritating  once again we Won't be back The whole experience was so bad from the beginning when the server kept coming back every 2 seconds we hadn't even looked through the menu we'd let her know 3 different times that alone should of been the first sign to the end !

ADy82F8wW-wir6rwHHBb3A.text: The food is delicious and the service is great.  The Panang Curry is phenomenal if you like a bit of spice.

mFoY32kGGZl_cG5S-yCXuw.text: It's not the best Thai I've ever had but it is fantastic for the price. I love when places like this have pictures of almost every dish in the menu so you can see what you're ordering even if you don't know how to pronounce it. The crab Rangoon is a great app shared among friends. I've tried a few of the interesting soups and the Chicken Pad Thai.  The staff is always friendly though their English isn't the best. I haven't taken advantage of their delivery services yet but it's nice to know they deliver since they're only a couple of minutes from my house.

6WeshU3HWQB9Ll7oQDGJDA.text: The pineapple curry was great!  I asked for Spicy and that's what I got!   I will definitely visit again.

WHQ16VpYigcnptdT4LNBIQ.text: We had an awesom Thai place in Japan that we loved, Sawadee. This place is a great replacement now that we're back in LV. We had Wings of Angel, Yum Woon Sen Salad, Chicken Yellow Curry and Basil Noodle w/chicken. All was very good and large portions. Enough for us 2 to be full on dinner and probably 3 lunches worth left over. We enjoyed free refills on the Thai Ice tea too; I mean where else do you get that? All for about $42. So dinner and 3 lunches for 42 bucks. Super Yummy, lots of flavor, big portions, cheery staff and very reasonable prices, what more can you ask? Get down there!

vjfs_u4tIah4KC2UE3EWUg.text: I have been going to this place for the past 4 years and they do not disappoint me. This is my go to thai restaurant. Great ambiance and great service. Good pricing as well.... i love their refillable thai tea, beef panang, glass noodles, tom yum soup, beef spare ribs, yellow chicken (?) and fried tofu! Everytime i have visitors in town, i always bring them here because this restaurant delivers good food and service.

_iUoXWngjTIQ6ZzveTSUdQ.text: I spent an evening two weeks ago with my sister-in-law and some friends planning a surprise engagement party. My sister-in-laws friend said she ordered some Thai food that was going to be delivered soon. When it got there I was blown away. I am a lover of all Thai food but there has been some that has been less than par, but this food was so delicious and fresh tasting I had to know where she ordered it, and she said "Panna Thai."   Fast forward to the present day, I am currently enjoying some egg rolls, shrimp pad Thai, with a Thai tea on the side and its as good as I remembered! I would definitely recommend trying them out!

DFA_hJSQUuBcmgbNNy0IRA.text: This place used to be a staple of mine but not anymore. I have been coming here for approximately 3 years and the quality has steadily declined.  It used to be so good I would frequently drive 30+ minutes just to get it. The beef Pad Thai used to be the absolute best in the city--tender beef, perfectly cooked noodles and full of flavor. For about the last year I have been getting anything but that. I kept coming back thinking that the flavor and dish that I loved so much would be revived. Well, after receiving these extremely dry, bland noodles and beef today I will never come back here. Please don't waste your time and money eating here. Find some place other than Panna if you are craving really delicious Pad Thai because I'm sure you will be as disappointed as I have been over this last year.

arygfkyhhTbxHMSju9LwfQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant on the Southwest side. My family and I eat here almost weekly and are never disappointed. Every time we come we have excellent customer service and food. Their Pad Thai is the best and vegan friendly!! Very consistent + yummy.

Qa7xGwmttOIovTlADPhBWA.text: The server recommended Crispy Tofu & Eggplant... AMAZING! Curry was also good, but the Tom Ka Soup was PERFECT! Great job Chef

MQJX1Eh-92mb9kxgtL3WGw.text: Wow! Let me just saw how nice these ladies were. Ordered papaya salad. It's delicious. Ladies were very friendly and accommodating. I will be back again.

OMXqbw7m7iMRyClHlD5kaA.text: I work at the salon next to Panni Thai so I have had them for lunch for myself and for catering lunch for the salon many times. They have delious food (love the Thai pepper steak!) and the golden cup appetizer.   They are very sweet and always take great care of us! I highly suggest giving this place a shot, you will be very happy you did!

SUv8YG3x7d_38AEZ5aGRIA.text: my first visit using a restaurant.com coupon- the food was tasty and favor-ful, but I must agree the portions are a bit small.. The service was top snotch and attentive. I would go back, maybe try the lunch special, yummy...

41SkZOjJqtVKO9Dg0gFJdw.text: Delicious food, great dining experience.  One of the better in the southwest!  I frequent the many Thai establishments in this area...and there are several.  Of the choices around, I give this place top marks.  Even before I look at the menu, Panna merits high marks for a great dining room and customer service.  The food is always good and they put a little extra into presentation.  Not that I care much about that at Thai restaurants if the food is good, but it's a nice change.    This is a good spot for a business lunch, or if you fancy Thai on a social outing but are looking for a little bit more upscale setting.

OAGTxnzqO7zVb8OupAQghg.text: Food was delicious and delivery was 15 minutes earlier than original quoted time! Thanks!!

ZuyVBOTiC0sF8LizwR9Nlw.text: I generally always stick with Pin Kaow 2 as my go-to spot for thai craving in Summerlin....but Panna Thai has given PK2 a run for its money!  This restaurant is very clean and the decor looks brand new. Our waitress was new, a trainee, but she was very pleasant, conscientious, and a lead server or manager was basically over her shoulder the entire time making sure she was on point. Excellent service.  We ordered: -Riesling -Cucumber salad -Summer rolls (non fried) -Chicken pad thai -Masaman curry  The cucumber salad was my favorite of everything, and all of it was delicious. The vegetables were so fresh and the dressing was very light (rice wine vinegar and something else I can't quite put my finger on). I was in crunchy, cucumber heaven.  I will definitely be back to Panna Thai!

BmfP-x8GRq_VJg6R5J497Q.text: I have been here a couple of time and really like to try more. The atmosphere was nice, clean, good decorated 5/5. Service was great! 5/5. Menu is amazing having pictures so help me to picture the food would like like 5/5. There is interesting appertizers. I had shrimp cake and it was good! 4/5. Groud pork Basil was great 4/5 Tom ka kai has 2 sides small and big which the small one is big enough for 2-3, taste was great, not disappointed 5/5. BBQ pork ribs fried rice is my favorite for lunch, very big, delicious and reasonable price!  5/5. Some are a little pricey if comparing with other restaurants 3/5.  But I would come back and try again!

DJ4CcD399ZRd0iXQY2tU3g.text: This is one of my go to spots for awesome Thai food.  They are located near my old house and we frequented it at least 2 times a month. I am a huge fan of all of their appetizers, but their entrees make this place shine. I have tried many Thai restaurants in town, but this one still beats them all by food quality and price.  I love their pad see ew, it's hard for me to stray from that, but all of the other dishes I have tried are amazing as well. Ranging from their beef/chicken satey, crab noodle, fried rices, and soups, I can't find a single negative thing to say.  Definitely recommend if you're in the neighborhood, and if you're not, make the drive and see for yourself. Also need to mention, their prices are unbeatable.  Most plates are all under $10, you can't find that quality of food at that price anywhere in town!

TeR9SkN1sr9ENyY_OOEAdQ.text: Nice little shop, decent decor and ambiance. Yellow curry was creamy and tasty, one of the few places I have been too where you get more chicken than potatoes. Rib soup is tangy and tasty. Basil chicken is decent, pad Thai a little on the sweet side but still palatable. Giant glass of Thai ice tea. We will be back.

J0CGWxqNHgJT8n-x5vLexQ.text: Tried this place out because it was near our house and our favorite spot is across town. The service was great and the restaurant looked very clean.   The non-spicy pad Thai was a little spicy for my girlfriends taste but still tasted good.   The fried rice however had me sick all day the following day.   Looks like we will be sticking to our favorite spot across town.

wcxQyEKWQKFuW_XhrAzTNQ.text: This place is great! I have food allergies but love eating out. They always take care of me and keep the "can't haves" away from my food. I love their chicken pad Thai! If I had the money I would eat here everyday! The best part about this place is the fast delivery and you can order online/in app. That's right, I love this place so much I downloaded their app! Lol. We dine in every now and then but with a new baby delivery is just better if the baby is fussy. Great place with great staff. Would (and do) recommend to friends.

-fEynJC_Hix3WUwqOl5Kzw.text: I hate giving bad reviews to small businesses,  especially restaurants.   But this place consistently has the worst service I've experienced.   Have been several times but the most recent experience is what now leads me to say something.   The wait staff is horrible.   I walked in to place a to go order.  It was not busy at all.   No one at the host stand.   I looked at the menu (which i grabbed myself) and when ready to place order,  was waiting forever for one of the staff to take my order.  No one came over.   I finally just walked out and drove over to nearby Thai restaurant.    I've dined in a few times as well and the service is just as bad then too.  I hope they see this review and make some changes.  I'm sure I'm not the only one to have experienced this.

dP29TW6_UwAeRBn3pR541w.text: Great food. Good atmosphere.   I got the yellow curry with chicken and it was great. Lots of chicken.

3xDfnG_ruVDXDkXb1Nchkg.text: Great selection on the menu. The food is consistently good. The staff is always friendly.

pIQfYJ5Zon0iYNaptcDyAw.text: I'm not a picky person. But this irritates me. I ordered a lunch special that comes with salad and an egg roll.  Well they stuffed the salad, egg roll and rice all in one side. I appreciate that they don't use Styrofoam containers.  But the egg roll and salad were super soggy. The food is tasty, but the soggy salad and egg roll sucked! I would appreciate my egg roll and salad being separated next time.

VPGDMb1XZvwH1kebAMGErg.text: I was in Vegas for my anniversary and decided to try this place. Overall, I had a great experience here. The food was awesome! I was on a mission to find the best Thai Beef Salad and I think I found it here! The service was phenomenal.   If you ever go to Las Vegas and want to dine away from Strip, this is the place to go.

alZZW4zUzwJLuf5nMhLVyg.text: Excellent food and service. Wish I knew about this place sooner. Started with the egg rolls then ordered the pork BBQ noodle soup. So delicious and a huge portion That I had enough to take home and have for lunch the next day.

LlJRlYnyObq6FTAx6qk1rg.text: The atmosphere at this restaurant is a bit more upscale than most Thai restaurants while menu prices are more than reasonable given the quality of the food.  On this evening over  1/2 the restaurant was set up for a large party, but our karma was good as we were able to order before most of the guests arrived. We began with yum-wood-sen, glass noodles with ground meat and shrimp with Thai spice and lime juice on lettuce.  For entrees we shared orders of scallop tamarind and spicy eggplant.  All three dishes made our taste buds jump for joy.  Our bill came in a few cents short of the minimum purchase requirement so I had to order a soda for takeout.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop tamarind
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy eggplant
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room set up for a party

QGZGiwIfAX8enM23HvcT1w.text: I was in town for the weekend and got invited to a birthday celebration there. There were about 20 of us and yet the service was excellent! We ordered a plethora of appetizers and dishes as well as various drinks and honestly nothing was left out.  What was really shocking was that they gave out free refills for the Thai iced teas! We asked if this was complimentary but they informed us that they usually only do it for regular customers like us. Talk about getting on their good side!  Overall this was a great place to go for both food and service, the restaurant itself was very clean and tidy and even had a flat screen tv so we could watch the NBA finals. How did we end the night? Fried coconut covered bananas. YUM :D

7AOALdStW7S-kTpbos4SOw.text: I used to be a fan until today. First of all I know what chicken tastes like.  what I was served today was not chicken.  The server today no comments. My order was all jacked up.

XRE5Z3dcezo2gQs2pMvD3g.text: Sometimes they have good Pad Thai and sometimes they don't.  I hate when a restaurant is inconsistent!!  The service is decent and I like that they deliver when I'm to tired to go out.  The lemon chicken is good.  Haven't tried much else.  It's okay...

kCTIJ_ZsnxofKRSvbULDSQ.text: I love the food, I love the service, and I love the prices. I use Restaurant.com to get a discount to this place. The Pad Thai is decent, The Panang is Awesome! The Pad See Ewe is good too. That is pretty much all I ever order, so I have no opinion on other dishes. It is not the best I ever had, but it is darn good and with the friendly and fast service, and great price, you can't go wrong!

vsOdFvgerQ512ISOaCGjVg.text: food awful, very spicy, waitress didnt speak english. ordered dish made me choke. they made me pay for it.  stay away dont go here. i will tell many, many people.  bad food, bad service,  may 22, 2015.

XATUSkqB5BrnGLYxhhtF8w.text: This is a great resturant, the food is good and so are the prices. I ordered the garlic ribs and pad thai or whatever it's called and it came out to be under $25, so it's a cheap dinner place for 2. Friendly staff aswell.

958HcoTB3_1Ph6ADwT9UrA.text: Outline: Very slow service, iffy food.  Ok, I gave it 4 tries. This time it really did it.   I would give three stars for food. Here is why: I don't think it's anything great, but it's not too bad either. Although yesterday my husband refused to finish any of the dishes and my 3 year old is literally throwing up as I write this. Last night he had fried rice and soup (she hadn't eaten anything else for dinner - very slim chance of a coincidence).  All four times I've been there, it takes 40 minutes to an hour + to get done. And we are usually "fast" eaters. We sit down, we know what we want, we eat, and we're out. We go out every day and don't have time to sit around and talk like some people do.  Ok, I can understand that also, but when it takes 10 minutes between asking for a check and actually getting one there is something wrong here. My husband had already left by then as my 3 year old had enough of sitting there that long. Good thing I paid with cash or I wouldn't be able to wait for another 10 minutes for them to run a card.  As much as I want to like it, I can't, and I won't be going back.

eLkGuy_Q9QvtIw_L-5IA1Q.text: Really yummy I would have the calamari and the the soup was delicious. The music is very relaxing and the bathrooms are really clean.  Also love the mango salad.

P57V4NSjVRSVXfvcNmi5-g.text: Americanized. Everything is very sweet. Ordered the Pad See-Ew, Tom Yum soup, and the Beef salad. Decent price, although I have to compliment their interior. Very modern and clean.

rewWsTmCwHfwLYGFKPZtyQ.text: LOVE PANNA THAI.  I used to Live in Thailand and sometimes feel like a Thai food snob.  This is authentic--they actually speak Thai there.  They are truly Thai style restauranteurs and people.  The beef salad is delicious if you want something healthy.  Best Thom Kar ever!!  My BFs mom from Texas still talks about it.  The staples are great Panang, veggies, Thom Yum, everything really.  The decor inside is warm but modern.  Often we just get it delivered.  I would def recommend.

tI-D4pUkg9wo9_IligwVig.text: Ordered for delivery.  Food showed up 30 min late, was cold and they refused to address the problem and then blamed us and told us they said they were going to be late.  Are you kidding me?

5D34xQb1sTNsLfCfwifHJQ.text: This is the worst thai restaurant I've ever been! we were there today for lunch and ordered lunch special , which is the mango chicken and it comes with a vegetable soup. I should say it was a mistake of mine not to pay attention from the very start, i thought it was a big piece of napa cabbage in my soup,  i did not really care about it, just sipping the hot soup and at the end, i found out that it wasn't  a napa cabbage but a big piece of TISSUE!I called the waiter and showed him whats in my soup, and his response was did you drop your tissue!!??????he thinks that I am a scammer trying to have a free lunch!!!!!##@#@@#@he does not seem to be apologetic and said i will come back and when he  returned he asked me, would you like another soup??#$@##@# The mango chicken was a disgrace. Please people, save your money and don't even try this restaurant at all! there are other much better Thais Restaurant in Vegas.!

BsvKWo4dnNH1-uIHFDmttA.text: We love Panna Thai! My husband and I eat here at least once per month, sometimes more we love certain dishes but also branch out. Sme of our favorites include the panang curry, spicy eggplant, and the coconut soup. I have spent three weeks in Thailand and know that their favors at Panna Thai are close to the real deal. We order it with lots of heat and they do sometimes under-deliver but I'd rather have it not spicy enough the way too spicy. The service is always great, the dining room is always clean, and the food is always fresh and hot. One thing we'd like to change is to have fountain sodas instead of the can... But oh well. We definitely keep going back and keep telling our friends and coworkers, too.

vuBMLlLsAMs3eLBQIAlrlA.text: If you're in the mood for good thai food, stop by. They  have a great Tom Yum Chicken soup, and my daughter loves the skewers. My favorite is the beef salad xtra spicy. The staff is VERY friendly and you get served rather quickly. They even deliver if you do not feel like going out.. This is our favorite place after soccer practice. I highly encourage you to give em a try

bf8UY4bJsxD1rgCzWEVZng.text: Really great Thai food. High quality ingredients.

iuMnzwK7m__71lVHqLep2w.text: We got recommended by a friend so we gave it a shot  It is a bit further from Vegas Strips but it's worth driving and try. The interior is clean and chic. Service is warm welcome. Price is reasonable compared to the portion and the quality of food. Most importantly the taste is very good and considered authentic. I love the Beef sa-te, Spicy Crab noodle, fried banana. We definitely will go back and try more dishes. Sooooo yummy!!!

BdJU0k5efJt6QyEUUj3S1w.text: I went here tonight for the first time because I had a restaurant.com certificate and was feeling like the comfort food goodness that is Thai cuisine. When I walked in, the atmosphere was pleasant and quiet and the server was friendly. I ordered the egg rolls, the tom yum goong, the pad see ew, and the red curry. Everything was really tasty. While it wasn't THE best Thai food I've ever had, it was easily one of the best places I've been to outside of China Town (though this place is sort of on the cusp). My only (minor) complaint is that they didn't have the type of egg rolls I liked. Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area.

yZDZg3Hp2-Tvi7lI3vKNsA.text: We visited Panna last night.  I was a little aprrehensive since the online coupons have brought us to pretty run down places.  The moment we walked into Panna, I was pleased.  The lighting was dining room  perfect, the colors and decor were chic and welcoming, no typical greasy smell associated with asian restaurants.  The food was very impressive too.  good quality and fresh seafood and veggies and flavorful ingredience...and very appetizing but not too over the top presentation. We ordered the saute shrimp and egglant dish that came on a sizzling plate.  all veggies and seafoods cooked to perfection.  the basil & garlic dish with pork was excellent.  Kids got Chicken Satay, Angel wings, steamed dumpling, Pad Thai and  Pad na...all were good.  Maybe only the steamed dumplings lost a little steam.  Service was impeccable.  We are bringing our employees back to the restaurant again...tonight!

Eq7Iv8Wz6D3WnyEJEy4Qfg.text: The best Thai food I've ever tasted. Friendly attentive staff, service is top notch!

CPV1kaBduzKlbBhkKLH_Mg.text: its ok.  visited on a tuesday night.  had the chicken fried rice... chicken dry.  egg rolls were good with the right amount of spice but the rest of the family's meal which was a bit of everything was all in all nothing different or unique than any Thai take out joints.  just ok.  service just ok.  price average.  lets just say not memorable.

YFrE1mW_g-eTweqJaX1YPg.text: I decided to give this place a try and I was pleasantly surprised.  I've been back several times since.  I love the pineapple curry chicken and my friend loves pad thai.  His favorite part is that they bring you a tray with fresh peppers, red pepper flakes, and other fixings so you can adjust the heat of the dish to your taste.  We also mentioned on our first visit that we would have like some cilantro and they've remembered that request every time we've visited since.  Great staff, friendly service, wonderful food!

Nh43HrWkMQb3Mth3iWF9hA.text: Wow curry was great just wish they were a little more friendly!

khH3uvb-4cALY4zbyWX9SQ.text: This is a nice place on that side of town. I really enjoy the atmosphere with high ceilings and a quiet ambiance. Try the desert - it's great.

Jia2aFTmp0Ix1suCxNyj4w.text: We got two lunch pad thai's for pick up and all the food stayed warm which was awesome! The salad was the only downfall. It was just a handful of lettuce with some sesame seeds and carrots. Other than that though, the pad Thai was great and a good amount for the price!

BwAP7P-i2-oEg0nkx8TTsg.text: Been eating here for years. Great service and great food. The lunch specials are pretty inexpensive and the service is fast. Great place for a lunch break. Always friendly and clean.  Awesome desserts too.

83eAuso89_n5k2QDTge7ww.text: Easily best Thai food in Vegas. We had the bang bang shrimp (perfectly spicy), the duck noodle soup (wonderful tender meat), and the massaman curry (stewed beef is amazing). I've eaten their pad Thai and several other dishes and I LOVE all of it!

wMBtjo0RTHiiiTD4WleZSQ.text: Love this place.. Especially the curries they serve.. I love em all though, from spicy basil chicken to the spicy/ garlic eggplant. Hmm! The best thai food in town. I think.Will recommend. Staff is so Nice and courteous!

JdAOoLl6Rxf4p3bD1bFtEQ.text: Panna Thai is just up the road from my office and is a convenient lunch spot.   The food here is good - very good - and the service is always friendly.   I'm not an overly adventurous eater of Thai food, so I stick with pad thai, pad see ew or curry dishes.   All of those dishes are well made and flavorful at Panna Thai.   The wait time for food can be a little longer than I would expect at times, depending on busy they are, but nothing too terrible.

BC2PGobrwEu4zR3HWlYuQg.text: This place has new owners and the food is now terrible. I don't know why people keep eating here there are so many good Thai restaurants around here... I guess people are just stupid, or they're all smokers who have killed their taste buds and can't tell the difference.  I used to go here all the time but now I will avoid it like the plague!

ayvxZMvJ6n56F4Z9e4nU3w.text: Date night with hubs.    Panna Thai is very cute inside.  Much nicer ambiance than your average Thai restaurant.    In addition, they have a selection of wine and beer.  Also, exceeded my expectations for a Thai place.  We had San Miguel.  Dark and tasty.  No cold glasses though. Boo.  Started with two apps: Wings of angel and royal duck.  The names are a bit whimsical.  The wings are stuffed with glass noodles, and ground pork then fried ultra light and crispy. Very good!  The royal duck was a really pretty presentation.  It was rolled in a tortilla/crepe thing and served with a way to sweet BBQish sauce.  We just thought it needed salt and spice.  Also, the duck was tough.   Ordered two entrees: Choo-chee shrimp and Pad see-ew noodles with beef.  The shrimp were in a flavorful spicy red curry sauce with keffir leaves, served with rice.  They were good.  The noodles were chow- fun esque.  We ordered a 6 for the spice and they were HOT! We were sweatin' but it hurts so good!  The portions were generous and the prices fair.  We had 3 beers, 2 apps, and 2 entrees....bill was $55.  A lovely dinner. We will go again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Royal duck
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings of angel app

xo38LD_TgCmGKVDryya-Dg.text: Just great food.  The curry dishes are to die for!  Good service and attentive staff.  Highly recommend.

ArD197gr1eF2zuk3ksj37w.text: Used to love this place. This time I ordered delivery and I'm a vegetarian. I get pineapple in place of meat and they charged extra??? So ridiculous. Then the delivery girl shows up with no chopsticks. The meal had a pretty strong plastic flavor. And I FOUND CHICKEN in my vegetarian entree. A small piece of really old chicken. So gross I had to throw it away. Makes me wonder how sanitary their kitchen is if old meat is laying around. I would call to complain but they wouldn't understand me  hard time just taking the order.

daBFc0cbawQiKhJLJqS_Ag.text: Very nice customer service and delicious food. I wont tell why but you have to come and try it and youll see what im talking about! Trust me it is the best thai restaurant i have ever eaten!

6F0GLwQCfarNoq8SrUkaEw.text: I went with a friend to get some Padthai, I got a level of spicy on my food, never again. It was so spicy I can feel it in my throat for 30 minutes. But I have to say, when its regular the food is DELICIOUS. Will return again.

7GKvebD-S5ExrOk9oGyvgA.text: I've been to a few Thai restaurants in Vegas (yeah even Lotus of Siam... Which has great food but the ambiance of a bus depot)... This is hands down our favorite Thai restaurant.  Nice ambiance, great pricing, and the dishes are amazing. I usually stick to the Crab Wantons and Pad Thai but they have a new tapas menu that is insane. Everything we tried was a winner.   Hidden Thai jewel in the southwest. I promise you.

qQNn3K11R0GmV5afa2vfPQ.text: My second time visiting here was last night.  Always order my favorite:  Chicken Satay $7.95 - These are HUGE. Feels like you almost get a full chicken breast with every piece and the peanut sauce is good!  Crab Wonton $5.95 - Not something I always order when out eating thai but I did here and they were cooked perfectly. I know they are fairly easy to make but I think everyone's had some pretty horribly cooked (burned, no filling, ect.. I know you're thinking of those bad one's right now) CW's and these are not the case here.  Pad Thai $8.50 - 5 spice & tastes like 5 spice. Comes with sprouts, carrot shreds, lime & peanuts on the side for flavoring as desired.  All three of these are plenty of food for two people (this evening it was me -starving & my preggo buddy & there were leftovers!).  The restaurant itself is beautiful. Large in size compared to most others & with a modern decor. I'd say pretty good choice if you're looking to impress someone & not break the bank here. Not to mention service is awesome.  Overall my favorite Thai place right now with service, price & food added up makes it well worthy of 5 stars.

0Koox4x9G1mVBU3HuYmxqQ.text: Very tasty food. I will say that Pan Asian is my favorite but this place is a real close second to them! It's less than a half mile from my house so it will be a place I grab some to-go for. I had the spicy basil rice. Very very good. Lots and I mean LOTS of veggies, ton's of broccoli. Mushrooms and bean sprouts and fried egg and red peppers. I really enjoyed this. The portion size is tremendous. 4 people could have eaten this plate. My friend got the spicy tofu with pork. I was a bad girl and tried a carrot to see the flavor (she ordered a 10 on spice and I was worried), but it was real tasty too. Hers should have been hotter temperature wise. My came out steaming hot. We shared a cucumber salad and that was delicious. Chopped red onions and red peppers on top of cucumbers in a sugary dressing. YUM! Definitely coming back here. Service was eh. Nothing great, nothing horrible, but I do like a friendly waitress. Always rounds out the meal. But great food, huge portions make me a very very happy girl!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Thai basil rice with crab Rangoon appetizers

tJnGBXoCYu-bKs9QiaQF5g.text: Ordered pepper steak  from lunch special thai spicy. Disappointed .....no effort was made to cook it spicy at any level. I could have made the same meal w a Thai cookbook or DVD..Mediocre! Server offered to bring sauces to the rescue the meal but Thai is best cooked w spices. Service is their strength!

M2QTgPJgCMImQH7pqtOcNw.text: I was a little surprised by my fried rice which was on the sweet side. I didn't really like it. Otherwise the curry was good.

vHD1BOWsNUY0WXKG-_othw.text: This place is great! the atmosphere and decor makes you feel very comfortable. When I first walked in, they greeted me and sat me right away. The waitress was very attentive and outgoing. She tried to spark a conversation as well as made sure our drinks were always full. I was very pleased with the service of this staff.   I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and was craving rice but did not want to order another entree since I wouldn't be able to finish it. A convenient feature they have on their menu is that you can order a single serving of rice which was what I was craving for! I ordered the egg fried rice single serving. My boyfriend ordered the pepper steak. We both ordered the crab rangoon for a appetizer.  The appetizer came out very shortly after we ordered and tasted very fresh. There wasn't a lot of stuffing in the crab rangoons, which didn't bother us since we ordered so much food. The only thing I thought was weird was they didn't ask for the spice level I wanted for my Pad Thai which came out not spicy at all. I would compare it to a 0 spice level from 1-10 scale. I prefer mine to have some spice but it didn't bother me because I could make it as spicy as I wanted.  The pepper steak came out with a generous amount of steak. We couldn't finish everything! We had plenty of left overs to take home!  They took our dirty plates as well as replace each dirty plate with a clean plate after each entree. I loved that they took that into detail in their customer service/server training because I feel, it makes me feel more catered to. The service made my first time experience here fantastic and I will be back again. I would highly recommend this place!

Qk7Nr2P8udU7L3rAKlCN-g.text: This place is really good! When we go here we usually get their delightful noodles, crab wanton and chicken panang.  Their delightful noodles are so amazing it has thin rice noodles with tomatoes, green onions and amazingness. It is perfect if your looking for something light and not something very spicy. There crab wanton are one of my ultimate favorites. They are so crisp and always made to perfection. There chicken panang is good too but I sometimes feel it is a bit watery and should be a little thicker.  Every time we go here we always get the best service and the people that work there are very nice and take very good care of you.  If you like Thai food try this place out, you won't be disappointed.

yeUOwRoXeiK5K6mIHKc35w.text: I eat here once or twice a week. This is partially because I hate cooking, but mostly because their food is so good. It's also really reasonably priced.

LYQRl0gQgVHFM4JH0lNlYQ.text: Their dishes are delicious and they give you a good amount of serving. They give you refills on Thai Tea as well.  Panna Thai also have a great crew.

PLGpQSPSs1Uhmv92htSmmQ.text: 1st Time Trying Panna Thai Restaurant & Horrible! Just to order was a headache being hung up on, should have known then but had decent reviews. Ordered Penang Curry Lunch Special with curry being Not Spicy as it was my daughters lunch. Well Insanely Spicy - receipt says Not Spicy! Then Egg Roll has a hair in it & called them just to be put on hold and hung up on! SAVE YOUR MONEY AND TIME STAY AWAY

i1v_rcm4giTSECOyn_9Wkw.text: Great food and fast service. Superb selection! Dessert was on point-even came with cute little umbrellas! Highly recommended the coconut Mille crepe!! Definitely coming back!!

0nM2HZ62VxjdyU2o2JtPNw.text: Absolutely amazing. I am definitely give 10 stars if I can.. Everything sooooo delicious. Fun dining experience..  will definitely go back again and again.

dlkqAfGzUMYd_IYZT-RG2Q.text: FAVORITE THAI FOOD!!! Omg! Where do I even start?!  Food- Awesome and Flavorful! We typically ordered spicy crab noodles and chicken panang curry! The spiciness is good and it's just bomb. Food comes out hot and fresh. We also get Thai coffee and tea. TIP: they have unlimited refills for Thai tea and coffee if you dine in  Service- Great and very personable. They get a lot of to go orders so just be patient with them. They are attentive. There's always just about 2-3 people on the floor so between them, phone orders and dine in it gets a bit backed up but it's a good sign since you know how much people likes their food.  Definitely always going to come back! Best Thai food in town. Highly recommended!

YhjxYTKOKZ2GvIWlgBGVcw.text: I've been ordering here for the past 3 years. I've dined both in restaurant and ordered from YELP's Eat 24! The restaurant is simply beautiful and elegant. The staff here are always friendly and welcoming. It is very clean in here which is a +++. Their Thai tea here is freaking bomb. Not too sweet, not too bitter and watered down. I also love that this place is literally down the street from my house.  I definitely recommend their satay (chicken/beef), fried rice, duck rolls, summer rolls, pad thai, tom kha gai soup, sticky rice &mango and their egg rolls! The staff here know me by name because they deliver to my house so much LOL. Sorry guys! ;)  The food here is freaking phenomenal. Who doesn't like amazing quality, reasonably priced thai food?! It is always made in a timely manner and great presentation. I've never gotten a bad dish here which is a surprise.   Thanks Panna thai for taking all of my money, but keeping my tummy happy! 5/5 and customer for liiiife!

NeLyK6P8rgFYH8uXDdr5Nw.text: My new favorite Thai place in Las Vegas. I got the Basil Chicken Chow Mein spicy, it was amazingly good. The wife ate the Mango sticky rice and loved it. We will definitely be back!

FUP_7BXYKFikVXvEMeNA6A.text: Suggested by a friend, the food was very good. I got the chili cashew with chicken dish. It had a strong delicious flavor, the chicken was tender, and the vegetables perfectly cooked. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, great experience, will def come back.

SjhJACkeOhee0NKoAzdkjw.text: ALL YOU CAN DRINK Thai Iced Tea!!   To be honest... that is one of the main reasons as to why I decided to try this place. I saw a review that said they had free refills on thai iced tea which I had never heard of at any other resteraunt... hahaha  Service was good although we had a girl that was still new I guess... she was a little hesitant but she held through very well. I'm sure she just needed a little more training on little nit pick information. We were greeted right away & seated in a half booth table. The decor was clean & not so cluttered with high ceilings which gave the place a very spacious feel.   The food was overall delicious & they have the pickled Serrano chili peppers which is always a plus for me when it comes to thai places =]  THAI ICED TEA $3 - FREE REFILLS!!!! when you dine in that is... i would have to say it is a little bit sweeter than what i am used too... but that may be because its free refills. ahahha you can seriously only take down 2 glasses worth otherwise expect a tummy ache!  PEPPER STEAK LUNCH $6.95 - I was definitely expecting cubed steak pieces but they were more thin slices... but the flavor was still good. Served w/ rice,  small salad, & an egg roll.  ROYAL DUCK $7.95 - this was actually very DERICIOUS. Its duck w/ cream cheese & veggies wrapped in a soft tortilla.   SATE BEEF or CHICKEN $7.95 - on the lunch menu... we got both for extra charge. Served w/ cucumber salad, egg fried rice, & DERICIOUS peanut sauce which i also used to eat my pad thai as well!!  DUMPLING APPETIZER $6.95 - steamed dumplings in the shape of a bag so it's definitely cute I would say. Served w/ soy sauce & 5 pieces.  DUCK NOODLE SOUP $9.95 - hubby got this & he got it w/ egg noodles... I never seen him eat hot soup so FAST   SHRIMP PAD THAI $9.95 - when I ask for spicy... I get it! Noodles are perfect & the peanuts come on the side of the dish. Even though it is spicy you can still taste the flavors.   MANGO W/ STICKY RICE $6.95 - ummm this dessert is like a piece of ARTWORK!! Seriously it is so pretty that you don't want to eat it! The rice was also a PERFECT consistency of STICKY & chewy.

oh4VEkdh5CAAvzwE88giXg.text: After one of my favorite Thai place shut down a long time ago, I have been on the hunt for another good Thai restaurant. I think it is safe to say that Panna Thai has been put on my list as one of my favorite Thai restaurants that I have discovered. Options are great and I like to eat really spicy foods and to be able to adjust the levels is great, in which you can ask for no spicy to really spicy.   The restaurant has dim lighting, yet very classic and elegant. It looks clean, organized, and the noise level is more on the quiet to the moderate side for the most part. The employees there are very nice as well! A big bonus, in my personal opinion, is the refillable thai tea!    A few of my favorite things to order:  - Appetizer: Sa-te chicken/beef with their sauce on the side  - Spicy fish cha cha - Pad see ew  - Pad thai (I prefer the pad see ew more, depending)  - Papaya salad - Their curry is quite good (red, green, panang, or yellow)      Unfortunately, I don't recall which one I ordered but might be one of      those!  - Dessert: Mango sticky rice

FwBbu1R_XXyVUgegEYPVZg.text: This was delicious! What a find. We had spring rolls, chicken satay, basil tuna, cashew chili beef, and Tom yum soup. Everything was glorious.   Next time we've got to try the pad Thai and Chinese broccoli.   The servers are very attentive and can recommend the right spice level.

8QHA246Ta5Z_8Pe2DLqr4A.text: Lunch Specials = amazing and delicious deal! Came here for lunch with coworkers.  I had the green salmon curry which was very tasty. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the menu items. Everyone seamed to enjoy their food. The service was great and fast. I would like to visit here again in the future!

0rkrautbNC24RR7qJeGvdg.text: I can't believe that it's been over 7 years since we've been to this restaurant! It's not close to home, and I forgot about it until it was spotlighted in the LVRJ recently.  An hour before closing, we were the only ones there. (Two women showed up a bit later.) They were already doing some cleaning up, which may account for the very bright lights that weren't in evidence on previous visits.  Surprisingly, there were two Rieslings available by the glass. Our adorable server, Fon, couldn't tell me how the domestic or German offerings differed in terms of dryness, so she offered to bring a sample. She returned with a tray of four tiny sake cups, for both of us to taste the two wines. My husband was a little embarrassed, because he wasn't planning on drinking anything, but the wines were already poured. Very elegant presentation!  We ordered the grilled veggies as an appetizer. The zucchini and eggplant were wrapped with a wide slice of red pepper and topped with a drizzle of lime-infused oil. Delicious.  For our main courses, we chose Massaman Lamb Curry and Mango Tango Salmon. I made sure to say that I wanted the salmon cooked medium. Though her English was very limited, Fon repeated our order verbatim. While the curry was very good (though not the best ever), with lean lamb, as we requested, the salmon dish was a huge disappointment. It looked beautiful, with lots of basil, cashews, some mango, and a few flecks of red pepper. But not only was the salmon a tiny portion, it was thin, with one end not more than a millimeter in thickness. You can't possibly cook it medium when it's that thin. It was so dry and overcooked that we had no choice but to send it back. In its place, we ordered the Thai Pepper Steak.   While we waited for our replacement, Fon brought us a couple of complimentary cream cheese wontons. It's something that I would never order, since I try to avoid fried foods, but they were fabulous, and it was a really classy thing to do.  The beef dish was very good, with nicely tenderized beef, though not as exotic or spicy as I would have liked. While it was well-executed, it's probably my fault for not choosing something more adventurous.  Overall, we enjoyed our dinner at Panna Thai - with kudos to our server for making things right!

We had a fried rice night ordering crab, pineapple, and chicken fried rice along with pork dumplings. I am a huge fan of crab fried rice and it was delicious and fresh. hV4kynx1BJEZMlYIb2WnLA.text: Came here on Sunday night. Restaurant is pretty slow. We sat down immediately and waited solid 10 mins for server to stop by and say drop water and take orders. Food is on the oily side as my flat noodle is literally soak in oil. Chinese broccoli takes funny and fried tofu is difficult to chew. Curry is too spicy for me as I order 3 out of 5. Also, take another solid 10-15 mins to ask for check and pay. I am already annoyed by the slow service in a empty restaurant. Worst of worst was, next day, both my partner and I had a diarrhea, I tossed the left over food and won't go back to this place again as there are so many other choices around the city

046nN2CcA3ARREqyLOOgJA.text: How-be-it I did not get the privilege of experiencing the restaurant and had to create my own ambiance at home, lol, I also ordered a meal that could be eaten over two days...I thoroughly enjoyed the Mango ( salsa) Salmon the first night. There was a lovely freshness about it and a surprising portion of salmon fillet! I could not nearly finish the meal. The next day I enjoyed a Grilled Shrimp Salad with a house vinegarette, which did not disappoint. Though it, of course, was not fresh, it too was made with real, wholesome ingredients. My only critique is, there was an overabundance of Iceberg Lettuce... Which, in my opinion, took away from the meal, the element of fine, Thai dining... as I consider ( over)use of Iceberg Lettuce to be fodder! For the price, the salad was a disappointment, the Salmon entire exceeded my expectations.

vlx-_5QAKRvcINLjBOXvDw.text: My to go spot for thai food! When im craving some good thai food, this is the place to go. The flavors are always consistent unlike other thai places.   My recent order pad see ew, asparagus with beef, and bbq ribs.  The Pad see ew uses large egg noodles. Very soft. More sou sauce based unlike the pad thai. But very delicious. They offer choices between regular broccoli or the chinese broccoli for the dish.   Asparagus and beef stir fry. It was seasoned perfectly. Not too salty, asparagus had a crisp to each bite and not overly cooked.   Bbq ribs. Gives you 3 large ribs marinated with a soy sauce asian bbq sauce. It was great as well. It came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce and fried rice with it as well. The meat was very tender, and came right off the bones. It's a musy try!   Overall, a great thai restaurant. You can never go wrong here!

RgcPQCnVQy5R86dixwZ2Dg.text: I love Thai food, so it's a comfort to me knowing that I have a solid option so close to where I live. My boyfriend and I have stable orders we always end up getting. gOEYe3K4Pe47ZKgXTw4uiw.text: Indeed, you're correct!  Thai places are a dime a dozen, but Panna may just be what you're craving.  Do you have a hankering for spicy eggplant, wait dumplings did I hear you whisper?!  Something extra spicy aka hellaciously hot is what you wish for- go ahead and let them know when you order:)  Please opt for a fried rice, yes I do always opt for the pineapple fried rice.  Hell, if it's not broke don't fix it! Insert wink emoji here please! I add snow peas into one. Panna is the spot on place for to devour bowls of curry! So hurry!

z0wPIvGbT3bQ3UkC7IRm5Q.text: Our family of 5 went for a special occasion on a Tuesday night after deciding we were in the mood for thai food and reading several reviews off yelp.   I don't think I've ever been more disappointed in other reviews as I was that night.   Entering, this place was empty...like uncomfortable empty. There was another couple with a child, and even though the atmosphere was great (the ambiance earned them the two stars!) it was just too empty for 9pm at night.   We order several dishes including papaya salad, pad see eu, pineapple curry, masaman curry, and pineapple rice (which was actually never brought out to us, but after tasting some of the other stuff, we were pretty ecstatic that we wouldn't have to waste more of our money). We also ordered thai tea (one with boba) - which was decent and we weren't charged for refills (which is a plus compared to other places). However, the boba was rock hard -- this might be because it was late at night and they just wanted to get rid of leftovers, but that's not OK at all.   Out of all the dishes, I ONLY enjoyed the papaya salad and the pad see eu. I felt as if the pineapple curry and the masaman curry were the EXACT same - the only difference was that the pineapple curry had pineapple. The curry was also too watered down.   All in all, the atmosphere is what's given them my two stars. Service was also on par, no one was rude.   However, I noticed that a tip was added on to my initial check. So beware of that.   I'll be trying out plenty of other thai places before I give this place a second chance.

o-O5lCWjWwJzzGU6berywg.text: Satay is something rather ubiquitous in my home country of Australia. Being situated close to South East Asia we have quality Asian restaurants in the same way the South Western United States enjoys incredible Mexican food. Satay dishes are so commonplace that in Australia they appear on the menu at regular Chinese restaurants.  Living in Vegas now I've missed satay and even though Malaysian satay (my preference) can be hard to find, Thai satay is an acceptable alternative. Panna Thai takes that alternative and makes it in the best possible way.  Every time we go here I order the Satay Chicken as a dinner portion and both sauce and chicken are incredible. It comes served with egg fried rice and the standard little cucumber salad and is delicious from first bite to last. The chicken is exquisitely basted and marinaded and the peanut sauce perfection itself.  When my wife and I go here we usually enjoy the vegetable summer rolls as a pleasant, fresh appetizer to share and she raves about her vegetarian pad thai with fried tofu.   I've also ordered the BBQ pork noodle soup which is similarly tasty, but overkill when you're ordering a big plate of Satay.  Service is always attentive and friendly.  My only real gripe with Panna Thai is their lack of a fountain drinks machine and the requirement to buy cans of Coke (or whatever) if you want something non-alcoholic other than filtered tap water. This, of course, means no soda refills.  Overall though, Panna Thai is a great option. Their menu might not be as extensive as some, but they have more than enough to satisfy everyone.

IFiAAh4-8y0OyGDJYjd1Ew.text: I got a certificate off of restaurant.com for this place, so I decided to use it last night with my boyfriend and my brother. We were greeted and seated when we came in. I handed the man the certificate and he looked at it and said okay. We got our water and looked over the menus. We ordered chicken panang curry, bbq spare ribs, beef pad see ew, and beef pad Thai. Each dish was a medium in spicyness. When we ordered, my boyfriend asked the waitress if it all comes with rice and she said that the ribs and curry did, so he asked her if it was enough for all of us or if we should order more rice. She said that we don't need more rice because we have the pad thai and the pad see ew and that's what you eat with the dishes. EXCUSE ME!? Who are you to tell us what we eat with our dishes? We're Filipino, we eat EVERYTHING with rice, even noodles! So of course we were a little embarrassed to even order anymore rice. The food came after about 10 minutes. My favorite dish was the panang, sooo good! The ribs were really good also, so soft and soo flavorful. The pad see ew and pad thai were average. The reason why I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4 is because of their service. No one EVER smiled, asked us how we were doing, or initiated any type of conversation. I saw some other customers come in after us and the servers started talking to them, smiling, and even laughing, so they're obviously capable of doing so, they just didn't with us. I guess it's just one of those places that already have their favorite customers and don't do anything to try and get people to come back. Good food, poor attitudes = 3 stars

YHEFzjcQS6aWkh_DTAgDWw.text: Delish! Coconut soup medium and garlic short ribs at least 1x/week! They are great for take-out and dining in. Always friendly - always good!

aAwKFvj5855Sf8W1Ovrlag.text: We're waiting 15mins for the table,but inside have a lot table was empty,we order water with lemon,but no lemon,soup is too sour and put a lot cream,taste notgood,high chair was shake,it's not safe for the baby

ju6Euqzk1PilijiBmBebKw.text: Best Thai food around the southwest area. The satay beef or chicken is to died for. Also, larb with sticky rice is my all time fav.

zx53r0OAFwRy4EuA7VvDkg.text: This review is going to sound harsh, so let me preface by saying that I tend to review Thai restaurants based on my own opinion of the flavors in the food.  This means that quality of service, atmosphere, etc. are not necessarily going to sway my review much.  With that said, this place had GREAT service.  Even though I came in with a coupon for $25, I felt like a regular customer within minutes!  The atmosphere is very upscale, and easy jazz music fills the dining area.  Oh, and they do have good Thai tea.  Now on to the food!  I ordered the tom kha soup with chicken (khi), the papaya salad, and the green curry with beef.  None of these were very memorable or impressive, unfortunately.  I also think that they Americanize a few dishes to some degree, but not as much as some other Thai restaurants.  The Tom kha was sweet with no lemongrass or galanga root.  The over all flavor was quite Americanized, in my opinion, and there wasn't anything that really stood out here.  The papaya salad was vinegary in flavor, and otherwise not notable.  The papaya was very crunchy though.  The green curry was suggested by my waitress as her favorite curry, although she didn't seem very enthusiastic about her own choice.  The green curry was a bit thicker than a lot other places, however it was rather light in the flavor department.  It seemed more like a stew with coconut juice mixed in.  On the plus side, it wasn't overly sweet.  The beef was a little tough though. I asked the waitress if the sweet sticky rice with custard was extremely sweet, or just a little sweet... she said that it was too sweet for her, so I passed on the dessert.    Overall, I would say that it would be very easy to fall in love with this place if I lived in the area, and I didn't have a particular taste when it comes to Thai food.  However, I can't say that I can squeeze in that extra star for Panna Thai due to my picky, snobby opinions.  Sorry, Panna!

P2ilT4Kgp-SW5W54-ZaMRQ.text: We like coming here as it is close to the house.  Whenever I crave Pad Thai and Papaya salad this is where I need to be.  They know we're regulars so they alway serve us well and give us complimentary desserts.  Sometimes they already know what we want to order. LOL!

c5aERnWMpx7dTCX99tUwiA.text: I love this place! I have almost tried everything on their menu and have loved everything. My favorite is the Chicken Saute. Everyone who works there is great, food is great, and it's clean!

6qIbaaJZXN6JNSo0PbnlEA.text: First time writing a review. Here goes nothing.. I ended up ordering the Pad See-Ew (Medium Spiciness) and my friends ordered the Sweet N Sour Beef, Choo-Chee Shrimp (Hot spiciness) and Calamari for starters with a couple Thai Iced Teas. It was pretty slow in there so we got our food pretty quick. The Choo-Chee shrimp was really spicy. I would not recommend the Sweet N Sour BEEF, Stick with PORK! Pad See-Ew was a little on the sweeter side even when I ordered medium spiciness. Calamari was one of the highlights though, it just melted in your mouth and the breading was perfect on it. Overall, The inside of the restaurant was very clean and the service was great! With all that food it came out to $50, which is a little on the high side but well worth it.   Until next time.. Stay Hungry!

RmDaWgte1WiKWUDcUVJc1w.text: i dont even know where to start. THE SERVICE OR THE FOOD!!! OMG, service sucked and the food was disgusting. I walked through the front door and the chef and servers were just staring at me for 2 minutes before i even got greeted with a hello or how may i help you? Then we get seated and it was another 5 minutes before someone came and asked for our drink order. NOT TO MENTION..... this was during SLOW HOURS... it was 4:30pm in the afternoon.... the only customers at the restaurant besides us was another table of 2 sitting 3 tables down from me. We finally got a chance to order after 8-10 minutes. I ordered the chicken satay & green curry with beef and vegetables. The chicken satay lacked flavor and marinate but the peanut dipping sauce that came with it was actually decent... but they only gave you a tablespoon amount for 4 skewers of chicken. The beef green curry arrived and i was disappointed by the flavor. It was watery and it lacked curry flavor... and the veggies weren't even cooked completely.  ....anyways... i wont be coming back. the food was too pricey for the crappy service and poor quality food. I'll rather go to Archi's or Thai noodle house down the street!!

BxkeGO3hkFg_uXLBAPm4vg.text: I am in LOVE! We ordered; Lunch Specials  BBQ Spare Ribs= Lots of tender meat with delicious tastey sauce. Comes with brown fried rice and wonton cripsy (this is so delicate, pretty and very tasty not greasy) Sweet & Sour Shrimp=It's not thick & overwhelmingly sweet, just perfect, served along with BIG shrimp, cooked to perfection plump & juicy with bell peppers, onions (i hate onions but I ate these!). White rice  All the specials were under $8 and came with soup of the day.  THIS IS THE BEST SOUP I HAVE EVER HAD! It's vegetable soup which had some bok choy, baby corn and sprinkles of heave because this is the most delicious non-meat broth I have ever tasted !   Don't hesistate to go, it's delicious and everyone is so friendly. This will be a weekly visit for us

hz_oUvTUnXLmNVrR3zC3qg.text: Had lunch here with a friend.. The food, service n establishment awesome!! The lunch specials were not only tasty but plated nicely and big portions. Oh and prices are so affordable that I took a second look at the bill when the server gave it to us.  The lunch special selection is so extensive that my friend n I could not decide bc of too many great choices. Well we will be coming back again n again to try everything;)

_MZMunJgCC-G7YQABknK0Q.text: I ordered the shrimp curry. It had the right amount of spiciness. It was fantastic.  So was the service! I love this place.  It's a hidden gem.

I3mWODM4BLAXQ4dLSNDpbw.text: The food is decent, but with the handful of times I've been there...worst customer service, EVER.

VV7qXMIhjWH2Sh-gR80KWA.text: The Yellow Curry that i ordered was AMAZING, very flavorful and just spicy enough to keep every bite interesting.  My only complaint is the amount of rice given... they only give 1 bowl of rice per order, and that is not nearly enough for an avid rice fan like me... (it also costs $1.50 for another small bowl)  Also tried the Fried Banana as  the dessert and the presentation was ELEGANT, the fried banana was coated in coconut and it tasted GOOD with the lemony type sauce it came with.  Great food and the price is definitely do-able.  Would go back there again simply for their Curry.

nhSV1KiWga0BBVs68BIq2Q.text: Since our dine in experience - we've order both to-go and delivery and have still yet to be disappointed - always on point!!  All of the curries and the crab fried rice are still our favorites!

pkKvgqnvcOVlAqWvK1RPJw.text: Let me start out by saying, the food here is really good. The service is terrible. The first time I ordered I had it delivered. The delivery time I was given was 30 minutes. The food showed up an hour later and the driver forgot the Thai ice tea. The driver told me they would adjust the bill and credit my card back. That never happened. Because the food is so good I decided to give them another chance, bad idea. This time I decided to pick up the food so 1 I wouldn't have to wait as long and 2 they couldn't forget anything this time. Wrong again! Ordered online and paid for it. The time given was 10-35 minutes. 20 minutes after I ordered I got a call telling me it would be an hour at best. Really an hour?!?! So I said sure it was already paid for and I figured if I cancelled it now I wouldn't get my money back. 10 minutes after the first call I get another call confirming my order. Then a third call asking how I wanted my tofu cooked when I had already told them how I wanted it cooked when I ordered and then again in the first call. I feel like I've given this place a chance and they have failed. If they could get the service together this would be a 5 star review.

QVcvim7txVzZJoleDDMhWA.text: Worst customer service ever. We waited for 15 minutes for water and our glasses were never full the entire dinner. There were two other tables so it wasn't a busy night. When the check came we paid and then they brought back a receipt with another amount. When we asked the waiter he said he had forgotten to add a few things an just ran it up instead of bringing back the revised bill. It's a shame the entire serving staff was so bad because the food was good. Ill stick to Archis.

aHIIb-09-rf8AN8B6nUCyA.text: Picked up food to go for an evening in.  When I arrived, the food was ready and warm.  The Yellow Curry is by far the best I've had in Las Vegas.  The beef Sa-te is also delicious.  I'll have to come back to try out their other dishes and service!

cyQ56N1B2zpeubn3fi79rA.text: One of my favorite Thai food spots in town. I've dined in and ordered out and always had a great experience. The food is authentic & the servings are generous.

GPcw9qP_sXXtY5qF-KojtA.text: Not really worth it. Food not that great, service is very slow, they charge over the price in the menu, so be carefull when they bring your check. Not going there twice.

iGbDymUO5Wsr8KQN0URCfw.text: After my perinatal visit I decided I was really hungry. I wasn't sure what I was craving, but I knew this side of town had a vast amount of restaurants that I had been wanting to try. I consulted with Yelp and settled on Thai food.   The restaurant was very spacious and clean and the host was welcoming. There was only one other table occupied as I came in at a weird "limbo" time of about 4pm. I ordered Thai coffee and Basil Noodles with seafood ($13.25) spicy level medium. I gotta say, pregnancy seems to have made me into a wuss when it comes to spicy food. Either that, or subconsciously I was not looking forward to the punishment that is severe heartburn. The portion was extremely generous, I would say enough for two people to share. I had them box up about half of it and had it for dinner little bit later. It may appear pricey to some, but it was an entree big enough to share. My total with tip was a little over $20..so not exactly cheap for one person, but as I said before, the portion and the quality justify the price. They did not skimp on the variety of seafood either.   Their menu has a tapas section with many appetizing options. I am only giving them a four star because I want to try more of their menu before I decide it is emergerd the best thai food eva!  There are enough items on their menu that I still want to try, so I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil noodle with seafood

ANjJISwgZXXl7ztkJZ3lJQ.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is welcoming and relaxing, the service is friendly and the food is delicious. It's hard to stray from the curry or pad Thai since they're my favorites, but any time I've tried something new it was great.

FRW4KXffjLA2xJ-WKHv2Mg.text: When looking for quality Thai food and friendly customer service, Panna Thai is at the top of the list. Some of our favorites: Veggie soup and Wonton soup (add spicy chile sauce for a kick), Summer vegetable rolls (chile sauce is terrific on these, too), Yum-Woon-Sen salad (lime dressing is refreshingly tart & tangy), Bang Bang Shrimp (delicious with a surprise addition of crab meat), Chicken Sa-Te (best in town), Red Curry, Yellow Curry, Green Curry, Panang Curry, and Massaman (curry dishes are divine!), House Special Fried Rice with chicken/shrimp, and last but not least the sweet-factor: Fried Banana coated in coconut flakes. We enjoy the warm welcome the moment we walk in the door, and the personal attention our servers always display (especially: Apple, Valentine & Nila) which makes dining @ Panna a real delight.

Fkc2KNT9f7VrzF2cw8jR6w.text: Great food and service. Always consistent. Love the atmosphere and prices. Thai Tea and duck soup, delicious!!!

dqSvODCiFEGo_FZ8wuJM9g.text: Panna Thai is my  favorite Thai restaurant in Southwest Vegas. Been to many of them in China Town and this one ranks right up there for quality of food and prices not too bad. Like it better than the popular and pricier Archie's Bistro. Panna Thai's atmosphere  is very nice and service is very good. Understanding English is a little bit of an issue with one or two of the servers but they try hard and are very nice.   Only small gripes is that the appetizer comes out at same time, or even later than the main course. Only pick from mild, medium and hot. Medium not very spicy.   On the dinner receipt, if u spend enough they print a 20% off coupon for next dinner. It expires in 30 days and don't be a day late though, they won't take it...

b1tP1DtaGpkeZu5bRTHD5Q.text: My first time ordering delivery from Panna Thai was exceptional! My sister and I ordered Thai Beef Jerky, Summer Rolls, Papaya Salad, and the Pineapple Fried Rice. I was shocked that even with take-out, our food was presented beautifully. As far as the taste, everything was phenomenal.   I am half Laotian, so I grew up eating the same cuisine and this has blown me away with both taste and service. It stays True to authenticity yet remains unique with a modern flavor profile. Definitely will be a return customer!

q7TFVUu6rO20UimtOSyaAQ.text: This a lovely comfortable setting with amazing curry. Really nice people great service and knowledgeable. And of course the Coconut fried banana is to die for!!!!

G_rmhQn5fe3dc5hvep7wsQ.text: Love this place especially for dinner. Nice ambience, good food and presentation of the platters. The ladies are very nice, very polite and attentive to your needs.

S4Y74cHFmgyuw9DdckKHNg.text: Our favorite thai Restaurant! The food is really delicious and the service is excellent! Ambiance is great. The staff are very nice. Our Server Apple is very accomodating and very friendly.

fBpQ01SdQnbHCceNAUD31w.text: Favorite Thai restaurant on the SW side of town! Cozy atmosphere for groups of 2-6 people / extensive menu / cheap prices (most dishes start at $8.95) / and great service.  TIPS: If you usually order pad thai, opt for the Spicy Crab Noodle instead (stir-fried rice noodle with crab, egg, and green onion). If you usually order yellow curry, opt for the Panang Curry instead. I've tried the yellow curry before and it's too thin for my liking. The Panang Curry is just like yellow, but thicker and more flavorful.

RH4rQiZ-x7eckju3njopEQ.text: Panna always has the best flavor and fresh food. Their customer service is always great every time we go in or order delivery. We were so excited when we discovered our new home was so close and could order delivery from them! Definitely will stay our Thai restaurant, it's hard to cheat after how amazing their food and service is!

jBKl26CBmrVxFr9q6sdPiQ.text: As usual. The food was great and the customer service excellent. Panna Thai is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas

LitSTiCQG3RmWXzAmdZ_3w.text: Very impressed by not only the food but the vegan options! Ordered the pineapple curry with fried tofu, no fish sauce added vegetables and the yellow curry which were both very flavorful and delicious! We also got the first actually good pad Thai since going vegan that didn't end up showing up with egg and fish sauce in it! Everything was very delicious and extremely pleased our order came at the established time and exactly how we ordered it! Will definitely only be ordering from this Thai place from now on!

oYt8OXleQ2DGUMEZQj1UFw.text: Thai food can be found all over town but this place has some best I've had in Vegas.  Thai soup is excellent & combination fried rice is awesome.

nYmNoFngbX_orfNCWgnoAQ.text: We were craving some Thai food but wanted to be "adventurous" and try something besides or usual neighborhood goto so I quickly browsed my bookmarked list and found Panna. I was hesitant at first because I heard their food was pretty Americanized but I'm glad we gave them a try. Called in and placed an order for pick up:  Chicken satay entree: comes with 6 nicely sized skewers of seasoned chicken, fried rice, salad and peanut sauce. Really good and nicely priced at around $12 a great shareable dish!  Beef and asparagus: YUMMM the beef was so tender and the asparagus still had a nice crunch to it! Good brown sauce that was not too salty and MUSHROOMS!!! Mmmm  Chicken Pad Thai: Meh. This was not good.. The noodles were way too soft and overcooked... the dish overall was too sweet.   The 2 yummy dishes made us forget about the 1 meh dish.. Portion sizes and prices are good...We will definitely be back!  Hot Tip: Togo containers are the plastic reusable kinds... WoopWoop!

SkKQYa1i9mfKYNATUmc6iQ.text: Amazing food and great prices, love the pad Thai and the fried banana is so good. Location is awesome and wasn't packed on a Sunday for dinner' Anna is an amazing server!

cVuk7dfB1Wr-QUkPBdQwHg.text: By far my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas I eat here at least once a week! The crab Ragu own is amazing and the papaya salad is probably my favorite thing on the menu! I love that they have whole coconuts and of course that they deliver!

AmCqUSGpnkMTIRI8cV2vDw.text: This place has finally won me over again! Despite of my last review I wanted to give this place another chance because it was one of my favorite places to get Thai food.   This time around I came to dine in during my lunch break. It wasn't busy which I appreciated because I was having a short lunch today. They had recently changed their menu so when I had ordered the "monster salad" the waiter looked at me clueless. It's now called the "grilled shrimp salad".  My salad came out as quick as I devoured it!  It was so delicious. It had just the right amount of spiciness where you can still eat it and not kill your taste buds. They were not cheap with the shrimp either. They put so much shrimp I finished the veggies and I still had shrimp left over. Writing this review makes my mouth water.. I want more! I want more! Lol

sXvXI9XBsjqJbsmjOPtl7A.text: I've probably eaten at every Thai place in Vegas and this is definitely one of my my top three. The pad see-ew is amazing. The red is my favorite of the Curry's but the yellow, the green, the pumpkin and the Panang are all phenomenal!! I can go on and on about all of their amazing dish's but I'll you experience it for yourself.   Highly recommended!!

iZBnrXb3pzNfCnettUmluw.text: Aroi Mak! If my Thai is correct that means very delicious! There's not much more in the cuisine world that I like better than curry chicken, so when I say I was extremely happy to stumble upon this place so close to home, I really mean it.   Appetizers were delicious. The golden cups and the crab wontons were fantastic. Very flavorful and fresh.  Now on to the main prize, the curry chicken. The flavors were authentic, the chicken was tender, and the spice was just enough to give you that burning desire to continue taking bite after bite.   Definitely look forward to coming back!

BOmbQrAA7Kk9u6DkuIMEag.text: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants!   Regarding the food:   The Red & Green Thai Curries are incredibly delicious! They're very creamy and rich in flavor, I highly recommend them if you're looking for something new to try on the menu or if you're eating here for the first time.  Even if you're vegetarian, there are great options. Many of the dishes allow you to substitute meat with steamed/fried tofu. Unlike other restaurants where you're left with 1 or 2 items total to choose from, there's a decent selection.    About the service:   The waitresses here are nice. Nicky is especially kind, she always greets you with a smile, makes sure you're satisfied with your meal, and thoughtfully checks that your glass is filled.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you're looking for casual Thai dining.

f2PLwS2FP5jHUXI2JJncpQ.text: Gourmet Thai food dining experience off the strip.  Don't let the casual cheap faux decor fool you.  Decor wise they definitely went on a budget, but the food is for the lack of a better word, creative and tasty.  We ordered crab noodles ( really good compared to your normal pad Thai), crispy tofu appetizer, Tom khan soup, and tofu stir fry.  Thumbs up.  Download an app and get a free Thai ice tea, which was good too.  They have so much different choices compared to Archie's which was my personal favorite.   They definitely have more selection

6hUARb_E8MvoO-RbXyaJGg.text: Such a delicious hidden restaurant!  I always used to be around this area and never knew they had a Thai spot.  Everything tasted authentic and freshly made.   Service was nice and made sure we were always doing ok.  My daughter loved her satay!  The pad Thai and curry were delicious!  I got a side Tom yum soup and crab ragoons to start.  We just had to try it all  And of course for dessert, we had to get the mango sticky rice which was beautifully plated.    Definitely recommend this place!

ctF7qE1BF0rwrkuVj0hl6A.text: The food was so good. I really loved the golden cups for an app. The entrees where delicious. The Chinese broccoli on the pad see-ew has a very strong flavor that I liked and had a nice refreshing flavor. The dessert was amazing. It had actual coconut inside the milli cake as well in the cream.   But the service....  It was 8pm at night and when we where sat there was 2 other parties dining in.  It started out great with our server explaining the menu to us and she was friendly.  But it went down hill. We didn't get our waters till our entrees came out and I had to remind our waitress for it.  It was weird because she dropped off our appetizer and couldn't tell we didn't have waters??   Once we where done I couldn't spot the  Server so it was a while till I could put in my dessert order. Now there is only us in the restaurant with 3 servers on the floor. We waited for who knows how long for our check and when we did get our check we waited again for our server to pick it back up.. .  I hate saying this but as a server myself if I have only one table, that one table is going to get my full attention and best service. They where so attentive busing and setting tables it was like they saw right past us.  It just fell short. Service needs some help for sure. The food was great but I sadly won't be coming back. :(

Uo1RvAbJqcU1jzeZ6phY2Q.text: I've been going here for years. It's my go to Thai restaurant near my area. I always get my oder to go and they're always on time and staff is friendly.

HkUciE-G-iN9qBNrmkJCPA.text: We have not been here a awhile. Last night we came for a light dinner.  Oh boy...I really miss this place. Our dinner was so delicious and our desert was out of this world. I had yum woon sen. My husband had Garlic Garlic crispy tofu. Taro crepe for desert.   The most important part for excellent food is all the ppl in the kitchen. I can tell they are working very hard to make the food taste good, look good and deliver to your table as fast as they can. Thank you!   Customer service is also efficient  and friendly. Without good customer service ppl will not come back. They work hard to earn their tips. I was in a food service industry before.   Now I can't wait to back again.   PS they makes the best thai ice tea, not too sweet or water down like some other places.

Cy19DfDh0xWOonbRpP201g.text: Ordered dinner via Postmates and I was crazy surprised how delicious, fresh, and well packaged dinner turned out to be!   I ordered: Pad See Ew with beef and chinese broccoli- I order this to go pretty often and when I can pull individual noodles, I'm a happy lady. Often times togo noddles are in one big clump. I like that chinese broc. was an option!!! Flavor wise it was delicious and spiiiicy!  Combo Satay- there was beef and chicken, garlic fried rice, cucumber salad, and peanut sauce. I ordered this non spicy for the kiddos and we loved this!! Their peanut sauce is different from any others I've tried, thicker, but tasty. The only item that remained uneaten was the cuke salad. Maybe because I'm used to acid or sweet when I see onion in my salad, I took one bite and decided to stop. I wasn't able to taste either of those flavors and I'm unable to describe what I did taste.   We did LOVE everything else and totally look forward to ordering and dropping by in the future!

wtrCe9zfek1D5CAWtKmkUQ.text: A higher but not too expensive part of the Thai food spectrum; this place is delicious! A lot of creativity with fusing pasta with Thai dishes, so it's enjoyable to try everything! We did a family style of the chicken curry fettuccini and just a pad Thai with beef. With it being a higher end, the portions will be smaller than your average spot. Give this place a try! It's a nice spot for dates!
