ZJMffZB49PuCmd4UH5LflA.text: I love the food over here. It's a sit down restaurant so be prepared to wait for your food. Time for waiting is not so bad so you won't be disappointed. Service varies but in most cases it's good. I recommend to everyone

1RwnWRHbzGbfgBxovvsamg.text: Panna Thai has been our go-to Thai restaurant for a while now. We usually get take out and our usual chicken pad Thai or other noodle based dish. This last time we dined in and decided to try out some of the other offerings because so many items look delicious. We ordered egg rolls (no pictures, ate them too fast!), massaman curry, crying tiger and jasmine tea.    The egg rolls were crunchy, yummy and as expected.  The Massaman curry was my highlight, it's cubes of tender lamb in a thick rich curry sauce with peanuts and potatoes. I've definitely found a new favorite dish here. The sauce was flavorful and the lamb was tender beyond belief.  I had a small sample of the crying tiger because my eating partner gobbled it up. It was the best crying tiger I've had ever.  Jasmine tea is my love, and the one from Panna hit the spot.  If you haven't ventured over here yet, please do!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying Tiger
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Massaman Lamb Curry

-OneQy8MwpoVAdGBI7Quhg.text: This is my favorite thai restaurant in Vegas. I'm so satisfied and happy every time I come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7xl-UcNrtzp4vtLBkoEAYw.text: If I could I would give them a 10 star!!! Clean and new... the food was delicious and the service was on point!  We tried the wontons and the bang bang shrimp and for entree we got the Tom kah soup and the basil noodle with Panang curry! Everything was great from start to end! Our server was Sarah and she was so sweet and kind!  She even brought us complementary dessert which was amazing! Our new favorite Thai place... we will be back !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XPt6SZNG4j3JM-Ey5SrsvA.text: Our fave local restaurant which is so close to home. We like everything on the menu! We especially like the crab fried rice and spicy eggplant. Servers are quite attentive as well. Best part is, most drinks are unlimited including the Thai iced tea. Don't forget to order the coconut dessert, it's yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_jE72q8uaDdDEoVh-q5j4w.text: This is my go-to if I am craving Thai food in the southwest. This review is only for their take out service, since I've never dined in.  I've ordered take out here almost more than 10 times already. And everytime I've ordered, I've gotten quality food. It's always on time and delicious. One thing I like about this place is that they make sure your order is properly wrapped so your food doesn't leak. My all time favorite is the yellow curry. They always wrap the curry in a separate plastic and tape it. Never do I ever have to worry about my curry spilling! I feel like this is one of the only few places that makes sure your food is carefully packaged, and that is plus for me!   I will need to dine in one of these days!

KjQSe4f2yGcqXGBPz4xvmg.text: Decent Thai food in the area -- there are better Thai restaurants in Vegas. The dishes seem to run more on the sweeter side, I get that for pad thai but for something like pad see ew it was a little weird. The "golden cup" appetizer was probably more favorite thing that we ordered.   Service was great at the beginning when we were one of the few patrons in the restaurant, but later on when it got busy (and with their delivery orders), service was really slow and indifferent. We were just about done with our food, and the chicken satay arrived really late. With all of the other Thai restaurants in Vegas, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad se ew w/ beef
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden cup

FsML6hhs1ty9FyrFRk25Vw.text: Some of the best Thai food I've  had. We order from this restaurant all the time because we live right next to it. So far we've had the yellow chicken curry, green chicken curry, and combo pad Thai. The curry is really good. The pad Thai is amazing though! The different flavors in the pad Thai are just phenomenal! I could eat it everyday!

EkleLrtaIlBekaNg2gLW6w.text: My husband took me to Panna Thai last night for my birthday.  The restaurant  is clean, the staff is kind and accomodating, and the decor is lovely.  We brought our three children, ages 6, 5, and 2, to dinner with us and the staff was so great with them. As far as the food goes, I thought that it was delicious!  I ordered the yellow curry chicken (medium spicy), my husband ordered the peppered steak dish, and our kids shared the sweet and sour chicken (not the fried Chinese dish, this was fresh and pan seared) and the chicken chow mein noodles.  Everything was tasted absolutely wonderful!  My kids really loved the soup that they brought out before our entrees arrived.  The broth had so much flavor. I would highly recommend Panna Thai.  I know that

bjBxPb-ZaqH6dsrAjn_YZQ.text: Okay so Thai food a dime a dozen, but this one really knocked it out of the park. I mean like...stop your search right now and just go here. I've tried just about every Thai restaurant in Vegas and this one is by far the best food you can get for your money. I would go as far to say its just as good as the places I had in Thailand, maybe even a little better. Get the beef satay / green chicken curry / pad thai as your staple and add other dishes as you wish. This will be my go to in Vegas from now on.

QEJCwAD7475O6cMyix9GlQ.text: After a long weekend in Vegas, we ordered take out from here and brought it to my friend's house.  The BBQ ribs were perfectly seasoned and tender. The wonton soup we had was chalk full of veggies.  Our only knock was the calamari - by the time we got home - wasn't crispy anymore.  Otherwise, it was fast, tasty and we will visit again.

Rkz2WQBb9XLdBzhin34XHw.text: Went here after a friend recommended it and we loved it. Took a restaurant.com certificate, which really saved some cash as well. We were 3 of us, and ordered chicken satay and 4 entrees, and with tip the bill was $29. The portions are larger than most other That restaurants in town, and the food was generally as good as Pin Kaow. The chicken satay was excellent. The pineapple curry was very good, as it had strips of shredded chicken, and a nice spicy bite to it. The pad se ew was good, although to be honest, I think Pin Kaows is better. That being said, it was still good. We also had a glass noodle dish called Beautiful Noodle, or something like that, which my wife really enjoyed. Overall, the service was good and friendly, the food was very good, and the price was phenomenal. I will definitely be going back.

QP6VRT5tRmZwCWFwyYk4IQ.text: I am a big fan of Thai food and Panna has the best Thai I food in Vegas (I think its even better than Lotus of Siam (which I thought was good but not great).   I had their tom yum soup which was delicious.   The restaurant itself has a great ambiance and it looks very clean.  The service is also great.

PZOV0OUKgdpBpZBFt1NR1w.text: I love Thai food. This place is one of my fav Thai restaurant in town. The people are always friendly. They have a more modern decoration with a touch of Asia, very soothing. We love the curry fried rice and the panang beef. The egg rolls were good not great, Pad kee maow was delicious (even though I've had better). They put good servings on your plate. Overall they have good food at a decent price.

fcRlSRyO7mEp-gXdqCt0ZQ.text: This IS our local neighborhood Thai restaurant.  We've been coming here since they opened years ago.  I'm surprised I didn't write a review as soon as I opened my yelp account. The summer rolls with peanut sauce are a great way to get your veggies in without thinking you're eating too healthy.  My favorite dish was the Thom Kha Ga soup, but now the Golden Cups appetizer takes that spot. The service is good & the food is prepared fresh and fairly quickly.  The atmosphere is great for a family gathering or meeting of friends. They are also great for take out. The best thing about this place is that they are willing to modify dishes to meet my husband's dietary restrictions due to allergies. Not many places will do that williningly.

39Sjw7NjDvY7PfJvNCI6kg.text: The lunch specials include a broad range for just about any taste preference.  Ground pork with basil & chili hit the spot with miso soup and a small salad.  The service team is polite, friendly and attentive.  As a newly arrived resident of the Las Vegas valley, Panna is the 'best' Thai restaurant I've tried so far.  With my office close by, my return is assured.

VYMCST0bSjYkH89i6XAnNw.text: I LOVE SPICY FOOD.....They have the best BEEF SALAD and the CHICKEN YELLOW CURRY I ever tasted in Thai Restaurants... Awesome place...I work in the same plaza, so we order there all the time for lunch... I'm always leave happy when I order from there...=)

9yBtGfVO3yGXxEQPeNNQkg.text: I have been here a few times so thought I should give a review. The food is very good and the staff is nice.

uvDU8F6W3LlaXyIN30jz9Q.text: If you are in the area, stop by for lunch or dinner.  The food and service is surprisingly good.  There is always room for improvement, but they are still new - so, keep an open mind.  The restaurant is very nicely decorated - modern, clean with authentic Thai touches.  Check it out.  Also, they are open to your suggestions.  Asked to speak to the owners if they are available.  I had their lunch special, Stir-Fried Basil and Chili with Ground Pork.  It was good.  Also, I had their Thai Beef Jerky - that too was good.  I look forward to visiting them again and trying their other specialty dishes.

-k7HezUrrxHBnzGcm45I3w.text: I like the decor, I like the people, I like the food.... but i wonder why no one ever visits it. Every time i go to the restaurant, My wife and I are the only ones there. SO I encourage everyone to try this place out. Its worth the money. If not, so the restaurant.com for a discount.

Qbe3uX5iJZw4wTzioNA_Uw.text: I love this place because not only does it have amazing authentic thai cuisine but it's not some hole in the wall with dirty bathrooms and horrible customer service. Which is all I seem to find when looking for a Thai food restaurant. The prices are fair and during the season they have delicious  sticky rice with mango. So worth the drive from the north side of town of which I live.

G5etVQLp6ahsejw8YbgHOg.text: Traveled here for dinner with a group of friends.  Restaurant has a nice, upscale interior.  Service was prompt and relatively attentive.  The table ordered chicken pad thai, chicken and beef sate, chicken panang curry and pork larb.  Although I did not taste it personally, the pad thai was described as "okay".  The pork larb was pretty tasty, although the requested "thai hot" it was not.  Sate was above average, with the beef outshining the chicken.  The panang curry was unremarkable.  Overall, a pleasant enough experience, but there are many other Thai restaurants that I would recommend ahead of Panna Thai.

YQiMzUaJ4IgIyETo-KX-ag.text: My friends and I went here last week.  They seemed really slow. Out of the group of 6, I received my food last for some reason. After reasonable times for appetizers, they served 2 people their meals, after a few minutes another person, then another few minutes 2 more people... then after a LONG time, they came out with my food.  I'm not a vegetarian or anything, but after eating In-N-Out all week, I decided to eat a "healthy" meal. So I ordered broccoli mushroom with tofu. That could be why my food took a long time. I found it odd since most places try to serve a group's meal within a few minutes of each other.  The food wasn't too impressive.

lDvTtuE7bl8Mhyz76cfNnA.text: Finally tried somewhere different than the usual few restaurants I usually go to in Summerlin. Driving way out to the southwest to try a new restaurant was a big adventure for me :)  Boy, was it worth it.  I go to Archi's very frequently, and I still love that place, but the Tom-Yum soup at Panna Thai was mind blowing.  This is the first time I've ever used that expression, BTW--"mind blowing."  Also loved the vegetable egg rolls and pad thai w/ tofu.  Service was top-notch.  Interior of restaurant was lovely.  I already can't wait to go again.

cdW15BABf_zbmiBl8ehe6Q.text: I was there a few days ago with a group of mostly asian friends, myself i would have never chosen to go here because I hate spicy food. The restaurant was very cute , nice atmosphere, the servers were efficien,but  to me the food was boring ( I guess because I had requested my food to be the least spicy as possible), however everyone in my group loved everything they had....

DT0Hx2DO1UYSCrHh1Wet5g.text: So far I've tried the ginger fish which is amazballs! Pad Thai, can't ever go wrong with that. BBQ spare ribs was good but nothing too special. Drunken noodles was kind of like pad Thai but a bit spicer. Spicy crab noodles was good. When I'm in the mood for Thai food I'll def will be back.

Ni_zST-mwwqZsMBbptUiqw.text: came in here for dinner tonight on a recommendation from a friend that was craving larb.  it was clean, service was friendly.  ordered the larb (obviously), i had the basil flat noodles, and my friend had the duck soup.  the food was surprisingly very good and satisfying.  the larb was flavorful and even though we got the spiciness of medium it definitely had a kick.  i had the basil noodle with squid with medium spicy and it definitely had some kick to it.  a great thing about this place is free refills with their thai iced tea.  overall it's a good place.  only downside is this place is a bit pricier than thai places nearby (aka thai noodle house) but the ambiance is more "date night" type rather than quick bite to eat stops.  you can't go wrong with trying this place.  you're gonna get a good meal especially if you live on this side of town and lotus of siam is a bit of a drive.

omOmNFeHali8gAx2RAi1HA.text: Customer service is terrible. Walked out of the restaurant after being sat at a table, and no one taking our food or drink order for 10 mins. The employees themselves were all sitting at another table talking to each other, barely making any eye contact at all. We were the only people in the restaurant.

00xgmJsiUFIUhDd824vNNw.text: I've been to many thai restaurants in Vegas, but this one is my favorite. Why? Because they have the best sticky rice and pork jerky! I can't get enough of that stuff. Reminds me of eating on the streets of Thailand. They also have a great beef sate, its hard to find good sate, a lot of times you'll end up with a rough, dried piece of meat on a stick but not here, its tender and delicious! But if you're in the mood for something simple, try the pad see-ew, really good, the noodles are cooked so perfectly. I love it when I eat pad see-ew and there's that frangrant smell of the stir-fried noodles, can't really explain it, but it smells soooo good!

zn5pcTAvT9FVtQuJpN-VRg.text: I found this place on Restaurant.com. I took my parents, my sister and nephew here when they came to visit me. We ordered several dishes to share and they were all pretty good. Mom really liked the Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce and Chicken Pad Thai. The prices are good for you and you get a lot of food for the price. The atmosphere is really nice and the waitresses were all super nice. If you drink half of your water or Thai tea the waitress comes around to quickly refill it. This is the first Thai place that I've been to that doesn't charge you for a Thai tea refill. I was very impressed with that. My dish came out cold but that was the only negative.

TZz_CAN7Lx97CS_WHmYVxw.text: Surprised this place has 4 stars! The food wasn't terrible but being next door to such amazing Thai places that set the bar so high (Surangs & Corner Thai), you've got a lot to live up to. We got   Pork Pad Thai- spice level 4 no complaints here, was good !  Papaya salad - spice level 4 but papaya was really soggy with the sauce and wasn't sliced the authentic way, which really changes the texture.  Vietnamese egg rolls - the neon orange sauce was way too sweet, no spice at all. Not home made  Sticky rice - even though it's only a $2 item it's what I look forward to almost the most. This seemed to be really old. The second we took it out of the bag it hardened up and was inedible. ;(

KUdKCp8_3C443cWmfO1kQA.text: Great lunch menu, everything was reasonably price and well prepared. My wife loves the wonton soup and summer rolls for carry out.

tvhlrCvWkXLSE3ULb9CJjA.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant but I am little reluctant to go back now. My friend was craving for thai food and I recommended to go this place.We had Tom yum soup , beef salad and Choo Chee soft shell crab. Tom yom soup, we added shrimp, tasted little salter than usual. beef salad , it was good but there was too much dressing which made the salad very salty. Finally Choo Chee soft shell crab came, it was fired soft shell crab with coconut curry and very very salty!! The curry on top was so salty that I felt like I was eating curry concentrate and my tongue was feeling numb from trying to eat  that stuff. I am not sure if they changed their chef, but food has been inconsistent from last few visits

lS_sRRDLXSPILvtZKVW3mg.text: Had dinner with the family here on Friday night. Have to say I was impressed. We had a restaurant.com certificate so ordered a few dishes. Had the Thai egg-rolls, which were delicious. Lighter and flakier than a Chinese egg-roll. Had the calamari appetizer and it was really good. Little salty but I like salty, plus the sweet chili sauce with it was yum. For dinner we had the Pad See Ew, Green Curry, and the Asparagus vegetable stir fry with Tofu. All 3 were amazing, especially the asparagus and tofu, it had shitake mushrooms in a brown sauce, that was just a great combo. Now Pad See Ew and Green Curry are a staple for me when I eat Thai, so I can use them to compare other places and I have to say this is one of the best places in town. Beats Archies hands down for sure. Proportions were big leaving plenty of left overs. To top it off it was really nice inside the place. Subtle lighting with dark woods and stone work, make for an excellent atmosphere. Could definitely bring a date here to impress at a cheap price.

N-wGn1YsJmYHPu4_63QMTA.text: So this is the 3rd restaurant we hit for my birthday dinner marathon.  =)  The food really deserved the 5 star rating, and I'd take 0.5 star off for the waitress failing to refill our water/tea.  Since I had to round it, 4 star it is.  The three of us ordered one appetizer, one salad, and two entrees.  Satay Combo - two beef and two chicken skewers grilled to perfection!  I'd say that Panna Thai delivered the juiciest beef Satay in town!  Yum-wun-sen (the silver noodle salad) - there were only 4 shrimps in this salad and no any other seafood.  I'd say this is seasoned to appeal to the locals since it did taste kind of  "americanized."  BBQ Spare Rib - Fork tender and falls right off the bone!  The sweet BBQ sauce wasn't just poured on, it was completely absorbed by the meat itself.  Sweety Duck -  I have to give this two thumbs up.  I'd say we eat duck pretty often since we visit the Cantonese restaurants in town all the time.  The Sweety Duck is up there with the tops, if not, even better!  The decor and atmosphere are WAY better than the Noodle House 2 that's only one block away.  We'd definitely come back again!  **special thanks to Julie C. who recommended this hidden gem that's very close to where I live**

N8wFE7AyHkr3mr98yaFwdA.text: I've tried many Thai places in Las Vegas, this one is hands down the best.

XhtBoELyfbvVidSjsYJTdA.text: Love, love, love this place! Its my to go thai joint. Food is yummy and service is an A+. Lunch prices are such a good deal and good sized portions. One of my fave's!

xh1NgDwGQx4Sl6P4_2IJGA.text: Hand's down the BEST Chicken Pad Thai I have ever eaten.  Ever.  Clean dining area.  Amazing.

S1aH1s66uLg2ATKeNbeGbA.text: Delivery took over an hour, the food was cold and low quality. Fried rice tasted like cardboard. Very disappointed

vfb_eHXbhmejaKxke1O7rg.text: I am not very adventerous with my Thai choices, and like mine Americanized, so no complaints there.  Beef Sa-Tay = So good.  Sweet, tender, with crispy grill marks.  The crispy burned pieces on meat makes me so happy.   Pepper Beef = Tender and a mild spice. My boyfriend likes this dish, but I am not fan of red/green peppers, so I just sneak a bite or two of just the meat. Pad Thai = Sweeter than other places, but always tasty. Pineapple Fried Rice = Comes with both Shrimp and Chicken which I like. I often ask for it to have a bit extra spice, but I think I like it better original.  There was a two large parties in there tonight, so the staff was busy with them - but we didn't feel abandoned.  I do have to say the ribs the table next to me ordered, looked delicious and might be the next thing I order!

3Wy_SwwQ2cTBDQZnD9PrZw.text: Just ate a paper towel that was in my soup! I thought it was cabbage. I just walked out without paying of course. The waitress chased me down to apologize, but I will never eat here again!

8duuAaFCDoaMr1Gs9M_zIg.text: Stay away from here if you're on your lunch break, sat and waited 40 damn minutes for our food that  never came and was never started. Terrible service

l0JgCQslQ9kOYzAY9KwiyQ.text: best chicken satay, best thai BBQ chicken in town. great price. fried rice is too sweet.

0SjpYW74eB0gZhi8yz3CSg.text: I've been to this restaurant 3 times recently with my boyfriend. I've had the chicken pad thai each time; he's had the curry chicken and cashew chicken. We've both enjoyed everything we've had there.   The restaurant has always been rather quiet, which makes it a pleasant place for conversation, and is pleasantly decorated.   Not 5 stars because the service is a bit slow and the spiciness levels seem to vary drastically ("medium' has meant both "just a hint of spiciness" and "so spicy it burns."  Overall, a solid restaurant and one that I'll probably return to regularly.

qvZfq0tXrH3qiUcXxSACfA.text: My friend and I like this place. I think this restaurant is one of favorite tai food places in Vegas. It was very easy to find. My company had a yellow curry and a pineapple fried rice last time. Still so yummy!!

AwLLjKD1Gf78ute3FjCQsA.text: Stopped here on my last visit to Vegas and was very satisfied. The food is delicious and the customer service excellent. You can order anything from typical Thai dishes to original creations, and can't go wrong. We had a large group so I was able to sample a lot of it, and loved it all.   Try the ribs for sure. The scallop appetizer is great, as well as the fried spring rolls with mango salsa. And don't forget to order their fried banana with coconut ice cream! It's not the typical fried banana dish. They chop it up and roll them into coconut covered balls, and the ice cream is something special too.  Overall a highly recommended place.

oNoMimCpZHhqhaVyPluSNQ.text: This place has really great yellow curry. Tom yum was not the greatest I've ever had. The vegetable spring rolls were amazing and fresh. Thai tea was good too. The ambiance in this place was great. It is a great Thai restaurant not in the strip area.

bMLkqwbziJvHPrukc0yrZA.text: Like using Ketchup on spaghetti.  After much consideration, and a coin flip, we decided on coming to Panna Thai for dinner last night.  The interior was clean and inviting.  I loved the giant golden elephant paintings on the wall and their Christmas tree made me feel all warm and fuzzy inside.    The service was fine as well.  The food is what deems Panna a 2 star joint.  We ordered the fried calamari and the pad thai with tofu.  Fried Calamari - Large rings of calamari were a bit tough and quite dry.  The breading had an interesting flavor that wasn't offensive, just not something I was eager to eat.  It was served on a plate of shredded lettuce, but much of the breading fell off, creating a swamp like pile of dusty breading, very unpleasing to the eye.  Pad Thai w/ tofu - The Pad Thai here uses a tamarind sauce, which tasted like Gochujang (Korean red pepper paste) and not much else.  This was like boiling spaghetti noodles, adding ketchup and calling it Italian.  The sauce was heavy, and slumped on my palate long after dinner.  Panna falls short of being good Americanized Thai food.  I prefer the authentic flavors found at other restaurants (where's the kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, galanga, etc...??)   Bottom Line: Panna Thai is clean and inviting with good service, but the food leaves a lot to be desired.

JXfklO7ipUXVqTTjGpGR4Q.text: TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE! The only reason I decided to eat here was because I received a special coupon from Restaurant.com -- it was not a coupon I purchased but a promotion Walgreens was running and I got a $25.00 gift certificate. During my lunch break, I met my boyfriend here and immediately saw an unprofessional sign which said they are no longer accepting the Restaurant.com coupon. I was instantly disappointed and I spoke to the waittress and said I had no idea it was no longer accepted and no where on the certificate does it say management may refuse to accept. Her manager cut in and told me she was no longer accepting the coupon. I said I didn't realize that but is there anything you can honor? She replied in a snooty attitude that she can't accept the coupon and it is not her fault and I can receive my money back from Restaurant.com. I told her I didn't purchase the coupon and so there's no money to be redeemed except for at this restaurant. I asked for her manager and she said the owner was not working today and I asked for his card so I can email him and she said she wasn't allowed to give out his contact information. I asked when he would be in so I can ask him about the coupon and she said he doesn't come in everyday and she has no idea when he'll be here. Throughout the whole time she was be very rude and pointing in my face and I told her that because of her lack of resourcefulness and inability to be polite, I could not eat here so she right away told me she can give me a coupon for $15 and I decided to take it and order some food. However, the coupon was $15 off a purchase of $50 and my boyfriend and I could not order enough food to equal $50. The food was good but I have had better thai food with definitely better service. I will not be returning here.

uB4pgrKW1EU66gI5wTPvCQ.text: I heard that this is the sister restaurant of my favorite Thai BBQ on Jones so I've bookmarked this place and looked forward to going here ever since. It took me a year until I finally paid this place a visit. All thanks to Restaurant.com certificate, I went here with my sweetheart for dinner. We had to order a lot though just to uphold the certificate. My bf got the Pineapple Curry with beef and I got their Masaman curry with chicken. For our appetizer, we opted for their chicken/beef sa-te (satay?) and for the first time ever, we also got dessert: fried banana (coated with coconut flakes and deep fried). All of them tasted good, really good. The service was attentive and friendly. The decor was nice and intimate. The only thing that bothered me was their very see-through glass wall. Whenever a car would pass by or park right in front, their lights would blind the ones inside. They need to tint it a little. At the end of our meal, we could barely breathe since we ate more than usual. I was impressed by their fried banana since I'm very picky with both banana and coconut, so I was surprised at how I did not hate it at all. I just bought another Restaurant.com gift certificate. It must mean I really like this place =)

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried banana
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Musaman curry
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple curry

jerADUbQi9AS5mP92j5jAA.text: Good food, good ambience, and fabulous service for a good price. We got panang curry (delicious), Thai steak (okay, a little salty), and sticky rice with mangoes (super cute and tasty). The serving size is big, so I think we would have been fine with just the curry. Looking forward to bringing guests here. I definitely recommend this place.

_vA3udjl6oNuuoWKBChy_Q.text: Decided to give them another go tonight. I've definitely experienced better, much better, and even from Panna Thai. The wife's pad kee mao didn't have the little corns, tomatoes and was just boring and not well thought out. My green curry with beef had a whopping 3 pieces of eggplant in it and they tried to make up for the lack of the beef's flavor with tons of heat when I asked for medium.  Enough is enough and we won't be going back. There are far too many other options in the area to continue going there for lackluster food.

M-Ht7X3VGUwxREtWObywDA.text: This is one of my new favorite Thai places in town.  First, I love the menu.  Lots of bright pictures to help you choose and overall great choices.  I tried the spicy crab noodles and while it smelled funny, it was delicious.  Tango salmon was another winner that I recommend.

AZiM1lYiMe3HF6nGnSq6hg.text: I really love this place.  I think the food is better than any of my other Thai food places...problem is it is far from me...probably a good thing because I would go there all of the time!  I think there dishes are very well done, tasty and to the point.  Servers are all very gracious and conscientious.  A nice place to go when you have a craving for Thai food!

7-IFwjH_v1ye6JWpY_RDZw.text: I normally get crab fried rice or spicy crab noodles, always awesome, food and service here is great, if your looking for Thai food definitely come to this place, like I said food is awesome. They're restaurant is very clean also, all the people that I have had or talked to here have been nice also.

g70eydXopgJhNRoxGUalWQ.text: This restaurant is has been my thai food craving go too. My husband and I enjoy their lunch specials. They have a big variety of creative appetizers as well. The thai tea is unlimited (seriously? Amazing) I have yet to try the thai coffee but I will next time! So far my favorite dishes are; soft shell crab, yellow and green curry, my husbands fave is noodle that has real crabmeat but I forget the name. I looooove ordering their fresh young coconut juice served straight from the coconut. All of their fried rice is really good. This place is clean with good service. Authentic thai food. I'm glad this place is close to home :)

rLobvIoCMt2WupdgREPCdQ.text: Super friendly, open late (til 10pm), amazing tofu pad Thai, and they cater to vegans. Happy girl! Glad it's so close to home.

XT7mG6p1ryHS7Dnn58xfjQ.text: This is my absolute favorite place to go every Sunday. People will ask me what Im doing for lunch and my response, "I've got a date with Panna." Seriously though, customer service is absolutely great. Last time I was there, the lady had forgotten I had said no onions and was utterly apologetic for it, which was unnecessary as accidents do happen, but then proceeded to extend the hospitality by bringing out a dessert as an apology. I mean, even though it was unnecessary and very generous, you just dont get customer service like that anymore.  Oh and fellas, this little restaurant is hiding some of the most beautiful women I have seen in the desert to date.   Enjoy, XO

GB47qZoHWdBvZ-VPh7ZCyw.text: sooooo good! The crab wontons are delicious and I usually get the spicy crab noodles. The portions are HUGE and everything is cooked fresh and hot. I only give it 4 stars because the staff isn't always very nice. Definitely a great take out place :)

_d2LgrLkYoojuxZ8LE6xhw.text: The food was ok. Got vegetable spring rolls, fried tofu, pineapple fried rice. It was nothing to write home about.   Ambience was nice enough and clean. The bathroom was a little dirty and you could tell it needed to be cleaned.   Where they really lost the stars was service. There was only three other parties in the joint and yet it felt like our servers were nowhere to be seen. I had some trouble understanding the waiter through his thick accent. They were very nice and friendly but I had to wait a while to have t water refilled and never got a refill on my ice tea.  I'm sure there are better Thai restaurants out here in the valley.

JAFJlZ2IMxLtCjzhgulOFA.text: Easily the best quality Thai food in Vegas. The servers are very welcoming and attentive. The price may be a little up there but their creative food selections are worth it. I love the fish salad, beef pad see eu, crab fried rice, pad Thai, and Thai iced tea. Be careful with the spice level (as with most Thai places I suppose). What's nice is that the flavors can stand alone with or without spice.

D79LyNnHemvhVIdBuc7S1Q.text: Good food but pretty terrible service. It took 15 minutes for the 1st course then another 40 minutes for the 1st entree to come out. Overall not a good experience, they didn't even ask how the meal was.

3BZ8jyXW2lmRf-2x1dR-Uw.text: Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (5 of 365)  I was pleasantly suprised by how flavorful and yummy everything we ordered was!  My friend and I came here over the weekend at around 3pm; so no one was in the restaurant.  We ordered: Pad See Ew Beef, Garlic Short Ribs, and Papaya Salad.  The salad was refreshing, the short ribs had a great crispy texture on it and wasn't too salty; just the right amount of garlic flavor, and the Pad See Ew was one of the best I've ever tasted!  It was full of flavor, had an abundance of egg which I love, and you get to choose whether you want american or Chinese broccoli.  Awesome!  The only downside was they didn't have any mango at the time we were there; and it's in season!  Not good.  I would have given it 5 stars if they had it!  But I'll be back for sure!

9TjY-hr-34fNlESEytng-w.text: I will update this as I try more from here but last night I just ordered one dish.  They are my corner thai joint so I'm sure I will go back more.    I ordered the cashew stir fry which has dried chile in it but I asked for it spicier and I asked for broccoli with it.  Super plus they were very accommodating and didn't charge me extra.  The pick up was quick and easy and the portion was very large.  It was definitely spicy and there was lots of broccoli, my one side complaint would be that it had a bit too much fish sauce for a non fish dish.  But I will just make sure to ask them to tone it down on the fish sauce next time.  Other than that it was delicious and I quit enjoyed my meal.

DiluvsMaATScJnzTNdGOCA.text: Awesome food. The ckn larb gia was fantastic. Nice and spicy. Full of flavor. It came out quick and hot.  The Thai tea was delicious.  The chicken pad thai was a little dry. Their jasmine rice is very fresh. Great atmosphere for a business meeting or an intimate dinner.  Would recommend to anyone

khAvBQxQmdISQ1p3uoevsg.text: Lunch specials are priced right, however, the meat dishes tend to be overcooked, hard and dry. Will not be returning.

lTvgdCA-9yuz6IE9DU1iow.text: Went in for lunch. They have amazing Thai tea, but the food doesn't hold much spice. Good if your looking for something mild, tho.

r6M9hCMcEjC6o40qepGmag.text: I don't review much, but since we eat here a lot and we're crazy about their Crispy Soft Shell Crab, the Seared Scallops, Yum Tuna, Minced Chicken & Shrimp with Curry and Crispy Duck Salad, (among other dishes), I felt it was time to say something nice. The dishes are original and super delicious, with no added MSG, and the service is exceptional. Every meal we've had has been off the charts good.  My wife and I used to eat at a lot of different Thai restaurants, in search for the best in town. And although it's a bit of a drive for me and there are dozens of other Thai restaurants closer to home (some pretty good), we can't eat anywhere else anymore.

XjcKmc5FfAOJyNu1qm8L8A.text: I ordered a bang bang shrimp and soft shell crab and those are wonderful!! Love it. Little suggestion, should have some noodle with a bang bang shrimp. It would be awesome.

847q6RSvIordEo8f7SRKqw.text: Great food and price :) thanks to nana our waitress, look for her..

FotIKApqtuytV4te7YbfWA.text: Wow. Really mixed reviews on this place,so I decided to check it out for myself. My wife was craving something spicy,so Thai seemed the perfect choice.  We ordered some pad Thai noodles with shrimp and a plate of medium spice curry with chicken.

1CnMA-r3TR48GRzBZ-AuNw.text: FREE refills on the thai tea!!!!! They have a lunch special everyday I believe. Between 11-3! I always get the Ginger Ginger Ginger dish! Also comes with a light vegetable soup, small eggroll, and a salad (salad is just shredded lettuce...no dressing or anything!!!!!)

WPYPplV5FyXuG4XvG8cMSw.text: This place is great. Portions are really the only thing keeping them from my 5 stars. But the food is delicious. They make it fairly quickly, and the service is about what you expect for an asian restaurant :)

WzkNt2nJGtmwzIC-mONeVQ.text: Value of lunch special was decent--for 6.95 you get your choice of meat, a soup and a small fried won ton.  We had garlic short rib and chicken satay special.  Satay was good, garlic sb ok sauce was a little too strong/salty.  We also ordered pork larb which was good...don't order fried egg rolls as these were frozen and not hand made...I wish I didn't order it.  Restaurant was hot...and there wasn't anyone else as far as patrons.  Service was good and restaurant was clean.  I'd go again but only if in the area...one good thing is lunch ends at 4 where as most places it is 3.  One bad they charge for more rice at 1.50 per bowl.

ceKleTs7hPyWIX4_KpHCZQ.text: Thai food is just delicious but Panna Thai makes it irresistible.   Food is scrumptious with good portions.   Ambiance is very private, mellow yet warm & friendly.   Prices are very reasonable (almost like Thai BBQ).  Overall ~ will be coming back for more!

TsL31q6t3jL8fNQTZ-9xJQ.text: I go easily twice a month and am in love with most of the food, it's close to home as well, adding convenience to it's charm!  I always order the monster which is a grilled shrimp salad, one that puts me in withdrawal after a week of not having it..     Stay away from the scallop tamarind dish and the steamed dumplings, two that I can recall that aren't stars on the menu..  Soo my issues come from the service, and yes I know that service may be lacking in a Thai restaurant.. 5 years ago!  I think it's an area that definitely needs attention and if their food wasn't as amazing as it is I wouldn't set foot in there again.      Tonight the server didn't greet us just walked up with a miserable expression saying "something to drink?", when did we give up on saying welcome, or how are you this evening or nice to see you again..  He took our order by pulling a piece of register paper out of his pocket, unwrinkled it and asked what we would like, leading to a deep sigh once I ordered two courses.  Mind you it's 8:45pm and the door says open until 10pm.     We finish eating our amazing dinner minus the steamed dumplings, not that they knew of us not liking them since no one asked us if our meal was good at any point.  Then that wonderful server came over dropped the check and reluctantly offered to box up some left over pineapple curry and rice.  I never asked for the check so when he came back I said "can we not get dessert?"  He said "the kitchen closed at 9:45" and I followed with "the door says you close at 10" it was 9:48.. his response "that's what time the restaurant closes"..     I was annoyed at this point and suggested they adjust their sign, or at least give their guests the option to order at 9:45..  Why let sales walk out the door?  I spent $50 on Thai food and undoubtably would have purchased two desserts!  Unfortunately we will probably skip this restaurant next time I crave Thai food and start a search for my next favorite.  It's a shame because the food really is delicious.

8L7p1IQEivRCiWFl_F78XQ.text: I tried the Pumpkin Curry Shrimp.   Loved It!   Best Thai Restaurant I have been to with excellent service, great atmosphere, great prices and absolutely delicious food.  Pad Thai was awesome too.   Going back again.

8cSqEwy1iu4Juvx3lHI_Ew.text: The food was delicious, the staff was accommodating and friendly, and when our waitress wrapped our food -- portions are large and we couldn't finish -- she slipped an order of sate in.  Icing on the cake, free refills on the Thai iced tea.  We will definitely be returning!

EoxKZRK34Ly9fjZdUV9vvg.text: I have really enjoyed this place the two times before we went awhile back but recently had a horrible expierence.  Not sure if they hired new folks but they were just rude.  My family and I a total of 6 of us with two little ones went in and the service was super poor.  There was only 2 other people in the restaurant.   When we went to order we just asked to have a chicken breast for my daughter and they said no whole meal...they were so focused on serviing whole plates they couldn't accomadate.  I even told them to charge us the full price but just a chicken breast is what I needed but they said no that they couldn't do it.  We asked for a side of broccoli and carrots and they said no.  It was ridiculous.  At that point I didn't care if they charged me $20 bucks for broccoli that is what we needed but they couldn't do it.  Finally my husband went to talk to the gentleman behind the counter and asked for the manager and he was very rude and said no manager here and there was nothing he could do.  My husband said we would leave so we all got up and went next door to the sushi place where they always treat us great.    The gentleman tried to make excuses saying it wasn't his fault and he didn't serve us and he was busy with the two other people in the restaurant.  They still charged us for food they never brought us and we were so frustrated that we gave them the money and left.  We will never go back ever and I would suggest if you want a stressfree meal not to go as well.

DxmqkJ5ArgoSa9Et0OcAtA.text: We've eaten here 3 times now, trying different items, and every meal has been wonderful. Friendly staff, comfortable decor, great service... Highly recommended.

yHMae7IqAPkUnGFXj_jNbg.text: We bumped into this place on a date night when we were going to play mini golf next door, and what a pleasant suprise. The food staff and service were amazing. We ordered a bottle of reisling which complimented our dishes very well. The food did take a little longer than expected but it was worth the wait. We will be back for seconds...and thirds...and so on

VLITz97CArXSy-oHCuurhw.text: My friend and I went to this restaurant on a Tuesday night. The ambience was very nice. We ordered the Pad See-ew with beef, Sweety Duck, yellow curry with pork, and coconut ice-cream. My favorite is the sweety duck, although it's a little fatty, but very delicious. the other dishes were tasty as well. We really liked their home-made coconut ice-cream. It has coconut shave and mango chunks in it, very creamy and coconutty. They also take the gift certificate from restaurant.com.

9x_JgHuqQq51_Vm6YK5t7g.text: the best thai food in vegas hands down!!! their pineapple fried rice is to die for!!

ijHDzgIKP52ElF_MEWrANg.text: Nice place. Very elegant decor.  Had a craving for Thai after studying for finals so i went during dinner time on a Monday night. Not exactly "A" material.  Pad Thai (Chicken) 7.50 For a togo order it was a bit...small. Other places fill the whole box up but one section was left empty for a wedge of lime and ground peanuts, that section could have had a few extra strands of rice noodle! Taste wise it was...sub standard. It was missing a lot of spicy and strong flavors associated with Thai food. Sugar must have been on sale, bit into a large piece of scrambled egg and tasted more sweet then egg, or sauce, or spicy for that matter.  Yellow Curry (Chicken) 8.75 Piggybacking on the Pad Thai, yeah sugar was on sale cause there was more sweetness then anything else in this curry. Had slices of chili but no heat. Very weak curry essence. Strong coconut milk presence.  If this place was an authentic Thai restaurant it would get Zero stars. But they advertise as an Americanized Thai restaurant so for that they get the job done.

CIuBzRXEgTe33KQ_jA5wRA.text: I've been here a number of times for both lunch and dinner.  The prices are very reasonable.  The food is good and is a good value.  The service staff is very friendly and I have found this a good place to take kids, at least kids that know how to behave in public.

FHf5if-cr3sBEtpoYo7alw.text: We had a restaurant.com gift certificate that needed using, so we headed down there. When we walked in the door we were greeted with smiles and shown to our table in a very nicely decorated restaurant with good atmosphere. To start with, we both had Thai iced teas that were fantastic and refilled before they were halfway empty. We shared a bowl of Tom Kha Gha, which was the best I've ever had. For entrees, we had the Red Curry with Chicken and Sweety Duck, both of which were fantastic. The duck was moist with a nice crispy skin and honey glaze, served with steamed broccoli. The curry had a generous amount of meat and the veggies were fresh and not overcooked. Dessert was the house specialty: Mango with Sticky Rice. Excellent, though it's seasonal, subject to ripe mangos, so take advantage in the springtime! Homemade Coconut Ice Cream is also on the menu, though we didn't get to try it because we were stuffed. As mentioned in other reviews, the portion size is generous. Neither my wife nor I were able to finish our entrees and it was packed up with extra rice to take home. Excellent, friendly service, good quality food at a reasonable price in a nice environment. Adds up to 5 stars to me! Oh, and they deliver.

wezdP9YginEd69LmFkREKg.text: Having lived in this area for almost 3 years & just now discovered this amazing Thai restaurant wants me to make me slap my forehead! Why do I keep on going to Thai BBQ all these years, ugh! I love Panna Thai! This is now my only & favorite Thai go to place. Restaurant is so clean & fresh, wait staff are so welcoming, attentive & friendly, big portions of food, very nice (food) presentation that they always served hot  & refillable thai iced tea! Woot-woot!!! I have seen Thai BBQ food & service quality go down the drain. One time, I got served with re-cooked chicken that looked & tasted nasty. They even get stingy with the thai iced tea refill so I stopped going there & with YELP's help - I discovered this place. My whole family eat here twice a week. Hopefully, they will try to excel more & keep everything consistent.

cOhZ-3MN--618mExzX_AxA.text: Mongolian Beef is where it's at. Best Thai food we have ever had. Probably the only restaurant we will ever rate 5 stars.

qmBa9w6qxqzeOmwI6R4Giw.text: Have dined in most of the Thai restaurants in Vegas and Panna stands out above the rest. Service is phenomenal, and the decor is extremely modern and well done. Now, I know some people enjoy the coconut type Thai food with the sweet tea, etc. etc, but I prefer the Tough Love from my Thai. Panna makes truly hot, spicy food that can easily bring a grown man to tears. I'm sweating a bit right now just thinking about it. So, if you like authentic hot spicy Thai food, Panna is definitely the way to go.

6L6g1po8ObQTcc_kEBS-lQ.text: My friend and I went there and the staff was quite welcoming ... We went there during the weekday in the evening after a long day of work. The place was clean, well decorated and thier presentation of the food was nice. Thing i didn't like was ... the wait on the food was a bit long. My friend brough her daughter so of course the little one was getting a bit ancy ... after the wait ... the food wasn't that bad ... i enjoy their salads!

zNlqnDGyKN2jozDYZbdhew.text: We had dinner for my cousins birthday last Friday and we had a great time! So many options for a meat free meal for Good Friday. Free refills on Thai iced tea was a added bonus. Great service from the ladies and even brought us a free dessert when they found out it was her birthday! Will definitely be returning!

JcZ3OP5D2QxMeHfNg9Y08Q.text: I rely heavily on Yelp reviews and this time around reviews failed me.    The restaurant setting is nice.  Service was so/so considering only 2 other tables and 4 servers.  Now, the food.  For Thai, this left me questioning where's the flavor!?!?  Ordered the garlic garlic shrimp and not only was the flavor lacking, so was the portion.  I wouldn't consider 8 pieces an entree by any means.  The chicken satay appetizer was decent but a bit tough/over cooked. On to the house fried rice...there was an odd sweetness and I couldn't pin it but based on the menu description I certainly didn't expect it.  At least there was a bigger portion with this dish.  Needless to say, this left me unsatisfied and wishing I had made the drive to my normal spot.  So much for finding a neighborhood Thai spot.

8Iz0VmXQXarQ0LGgXZlpXg.text: Excellent Thai food! Drive from Henderson to eat at this awesome restaurant.Amazing menu-recommend the Pad SeEw and TomKa soup!!

KfwYsMqTfUtIlSsiZ50OQQ.text: The food here is excellent. The staff is super friendly and the place is kept immaculately clean. We frequent this place after moving to Vegas recently.

-wre7PUraNTJc1Op3ZvAuQ.text: Had dinner with my friend here last night. Haven't really been a big fan of Thai food but really did like this place. Its a small, quaint place. We were welcomed right away and seated. They were not super busy but the place was adequately filled.    I had the duck salad very tasty. I love duck and had never seen it served as a salad so had to try it. It was served over a bed of spinach, not sure I loved that but the dressing was delicious.   I will have to try this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Tad2TplsXI5z1eG1aVUdw.text: This place is amazing. The food is great, and the staff is super friendly. We and my coworkers go here on a weekly basis. I would recommend this place to anybody.

TU_4VklMdFEIvwJYcfeiNw.text: This is my second time coming into this restaurant. I was very impress on my first visit but even more so on this second visit. Came in today to celebrate my husband birthday along with my family. The food was awesome from the appetizer,  to our meal ,and desserts. The Bang Bang Shrimp is definitely something everyone must try. We were all impress with every dish that we had ordered. Thank you to all the staff for your wonderful service and a special thanks to Apple. We look forward to coming back, especially for the Bang Bang shrimp.

dQxleX92aN_N6s4sNQp5wg.text: Really good food, friendly staff. Pad Thai was good med. wasnt spicy enough for me always afraid to ask for hot then its to hot at some places. I like the number system 1-10 better.... the glass noodle dish was nice too. Wings of an angel dish is a great ome for kids that like nuggets and such. Sate was pretty good seasoned well the peanut sauce was a little greasy. All in all great experience, we will be back for sure.

sA5386-xDUlQ848eyuyCLQ.text: The food and service is awesome!! My wife and I loved it!! We are so happy to have Panna Thai Restaurant close to the neighborhood!!

RdJc616lp0N-YzoAd1SHtg.text: This is our go to place for Pad thai and Pad see ew. The mango sticky rice is also a must try! Staff are attentive. The reason I gave this only 4 stars instead of perfect five is because of the dips/sauces they pair with some of their dishes. Some of it just doesn't go well with the dish. But overall still a great Thai Restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pad see ew. My husband&#39;s favorite!
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq ribs are good! Falls off the bone, perfect with the rice. The sweet and sour dip did not go well with the bbq ribs, too sweet! 4/5
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed dumplings. The sweet soy sauce did not go well with the dumplings. 2/5

541rOmKnqCdYo_gP5DOwtQ.text: Panama is our go-to Friday night delivery. The food is always excellent and the drivers are friendly, and personable!

qaz-dwiYWTOPZuSeLOm30A.text: It was really, really good. And really, really close to our place. Which is why they get...5 stars!   Came in toward the end of the night, party of 2. We were seated quick...the staff and Chef (see below) were great and attentive.  Ordered:  Yellow Curry Fettuccine Alfredo...I know! Fettuccine Alfredo in a Thai place?!? Thats what made me want to try it and it didnt disappoint. Though I had to order a side of steamed rice to help with the spice, cus no i didnt have an option of choosing a spice level. But, I would order it again.  Divine Scallops....4 scallops on the plate. God, they melted like butter in my mouth...but again. It was too spicy for my like. So I ate some rice with them. Lol it helps!   BBQ Chicken....it was about 3-4 pieces of chicken, comes with its own rice. What can I say? Its a classic. It was great.   For Dessert: We werent going to order any however the Chef happened to be taking a breather while we were having dinner and after a good 15-20 minute conversation about work and life, to our surprise he sent us some dessert, on the house! It was.....  Banana dipped in tempura and deep fried, on the plate came strawberry sauce and on the side a large scoop of fresh coconut ice cream. Wow it was delicious and next time ill order it.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried Banana and Coconut Ice cream
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Divine Scallops
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken

m101PvMs8ypapeaPMIBP0Q.text: Food is great. The ambiance is nice and romantic. The pumpkin curry is delicious and the staff are very kind.

VKbdvuxi1E2ApFP_IaIAqg.text: Was amazing until they got a new chef (Feb '17).  I had 2 or 3 very unsatisfactory deliveries and insisted the next time we go for dine in.  Last night we ordered a couple simple dishes and the were all terrible.  Soft shell crab wasn't crispy, the batter tasted like a mouth full of pepper and was soggy.  The flautas used to be my girlfriends favorite; now she won't even finish half an order.  The pork jerky was undercooked (I'm at a loss for how this is even possible).  We ordered the combo basil noodle last night and it was horrific. The thing with this type of dish is because there are so many components with different cooking temperature you really have to know what you're doing...this chef obviously doesn't. The pork component was well overcooked while the shrimp were half translucent still.  I don't mean to be harsh here but this was one of the best Thai restaurants in the US for a long time and now it's just....pesh.

9wQkjRdkt0CRQyJWWEHTcQ.text: The dishes here are the closest I've seen so far to the original Thai food flavors. Lots of well seasoned flavorful food. Many of the options available on the menu are not present in other Thai restaurants in town. The service is very good. Our waitress made a small mistake on our order, but immediately apologized and gave us a complimentary dessert to compensate for that, which was nice and very professional.  Will recommend this place as the best Thai in town so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tbhXkzvzfWTxSNAjvNt3Nw.text: If I could give a 0 I will but this yelp don't give you that option. My experience at this place was horrible I have ordered several plates for my family and I and it was missing salt, food was eatable but not great. Service was really BAD, place was with 2 people the time I came, no greeting, and this girls has attitude. I went and sat at the table and this young girl was going back and forth and I waited and waited to be acknowledged by her and then a raised my hand and I said hi and she responded " Don't you see I'm busy with them" this couple were eating already and she only left water so I thought she was done. She come after 5 minutes and said " what you want" really is that how they take order. Well I said Thai tea and I'm ready to order and she said to me " No" "wait for drink first and later you can order". I didn't want to be rude so I did as she said, well my family and I ate and left and this young girl runs behind me to my car and said "more tip" I gave you food and service. I was in shocked this girl had the nerve to follow me for more tip. I gave her $9 and she wanted more from 2 Thai tea, fried rice, salad, chicken with no flavor and egg rolls that were cold. That's just off. No words to this unhappy, unprofessional and rude people that has no customer service skills. Because all they said everyone we want to order or ask for water was "What you want" really. This place needs to teach their people how to talk to customers. If could give 0 I would. Don't go to this place they have no manners and the food is not as this Yelp reviews said.

QfVPIGDsU8upGLZMLAh0BA.text: We really don't try fancy Thai food places but this is right up the street and always catches our eyes. We gave it a shot and it was a fancier Thai restaurant. The items were over priced and the garlic spare ribs were hard and didn't have much flavor. The best part of the meal was the Thai tea!

Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MeoTaP0tCrpvj88VCLYpoA.text: I visit this location often. each time my colleagues & I are greeted by friendly staff. we receive quick service. the food is great, consistently good flavor. our fave is the bbq's ribs lunch.

l364L9mMdNl72Da6VT67Zg.text: Disclaimer: I have a slightly unnatural Thai food obsession. And now..on to the good stuff  Came in with a party of four on a Friday around 5:30. Place was full I open tables. We ordered bang bang shrimp and spring rolls as appetizers. My fellow dinner mates said the shrimp was on point and the summer rolls were fresh. We also had the wonton soup and tom kha with chicken. I do not eat meat but I tasted both broths and they were so so so YUMMYYY..tangy and lemony. As an entree I had the green curry with tofu, which I asked for "spicy." Seriously, they are not playing here, the curry definitely was spicy. My one complaint about the curry is that it was really lacking in the liquid department, which made it more like a tofu entree than a curry for me...still delicious though.   Service was just ok, the waitress seemed to be in a rush any time she came to our table.   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V4tIjwHWfMjkamQr2E9_wg.text: Love the foods here I'm a fan of Thai foods and I have been searching for the best Thai restaurant around Vegas for long period. Pad Thai is alway the dish that I order whenever I go to Thai restaurant. Still can't find a best Pad Thai in Vegas but Panna's pad thai  4/5 stars is what I give for my pad Thai ( less sauce will be better) . I ordered : bang bang shrimp ( not bad , very interesting ,curry style ) , beef salad (the beef is soft,yum ) pad thai ( first time see green onion on pad Thai but good), and Tom yum ( excellent ) . Love . Will visit soon of course .

8CvfMIvMG9tpK3F_6uWdaA.text: This place is delicious!! I've seen this place a few times and finally decided to stop in for dinner, I'm glad I did. The food is great and all of the staff and servers were super friendly! I had the crab wontons to start, the shrimp pad thai, boyfriend had the Bbq pork soup everything was delicious, can't wait to come back again and try more food!!

Vhh-WVafhuthaQzXJNGSWA.text: BEST Thai place. I frequent here or order to go quite often. Everything is always delicious and great service! The bbq spare ribs are the best I've had! I also love their delightful noodle, yellow curry, Tom Kai, and the golden cup appetizer! Also, they do free refills on Thai tea (that's a winner for me & keeps me always coming back!) and delicious sweet rice all year round! Always love the friendliness here and how fast they are!

cvtX2Fygw00Stj_35v0cuQ.text: Don't really leave reviews. This is actually my third and the first two were only because they were sooooooooo bad. But this place is absolutely terrific.  Ordered too much for 2 people but finished everything, because it was so good. The scallops were very tender and the sauce had a nice kick. The duck rolls were absolutely fantastic. Best I've ever had. Lots of duck, tender wrap, and the Julianne veges in it.. The chicken satay was cooked perfectly and sauce was nice. Had a squid basil noodles that was very very good. The squid was tender and the dish has a lot of basil. Finally had a chicken mushrooms and asparagus dish that again was fabulous. And a special shout out to Apple who served us. Friendly attentive and overall great service. Wish she didn't give us dessert on the house, which of course I finished.. Argh..  Can't say enough about this place, will be back again and again. 5 stars!!!!

jShQYf-qKgfKqgb8Y0x1hQ.text: Finally! Some descent Thai food. Been a few years since I was satisfied with descent Thai. Ordered deliverd. Will be back for some more serious dishes. All was good!

FuZxIDgKkeCJQ26VTeIqig.text: This restaurant is just a pretty face with zero substance. Similar to an Australian male stripper I once met. Really nice to look at, but once he opened his mouth I couldn't run away fast enough. On to crappy Thai food.  I walk in and am instantly taken back by how current and sharp this space is. They spent money in making it look appealing and it does! They were also playing some current American music which was unusual to me, but I liked it. Only one table was occupied by a couple when I placed my takeout order.   The order taking was slightly awkward as I mentioned to the guy (because I am always entirely too friendly and can't help it. Unless I used expensive, yet bad moisturizer that is making my f*n face stink and the smell is killing me!), I mentioned that I have been dying to try this place.. He asked if I have ever had Thai food before. I wanted to ask him if he had ever brushed his teeth before. Again, I was nice about it. I placed my order for Panang chicken no rice and he then said," Medium or Mild". I responded with,"HOT". He gave me the look, but than wrote down my order. I paid and he said it would be a few minutes.....  I don't mind waiting because I am in an especially good mood these days. The only couple in the restaurant pays and leaves. The music is turned off. The music never comes back on. I waited close to 30 minutes in silence for my order. I would have waited longer if I didn't get up and walk towards the kitchen. It had been sitting there for who knows how long. RUDE. I smile, grab my food and leave.   Immediately I open the container upon walking in the door since I'm ravenous for some spicy curry. First impression- Panang sauce is really watery..... Second impression- Panang Chicken has tons of Thai chiles, but zero flavor other than heat. No basil or kaffir lime leaves. No complexity or richness to the sauce. Only pure coconut milk taste or lack of. Dinner fail.   I really wanted to like this place and had hopes that this would be my new go to Thai spot for date night, but they just don't deliver on any level here. My suggestion is go anywhere else in the area for Thai unless you belong to a Coconut Milk Meetup Group or something. In that case knock yourself out. Literally.

Gax81wpFqFPsAUqSTEX3vw.text: Very clean place and food is delicious the only thing to work on would be service because it is pretty slow but I will go back for more

C5E-1vMkc_3dYNymMBBjFQ.text: The crab noodles are amazing!  The house wine is quite good.  Have had the pleasure of eating here several times and the service is great and all items on the menu so far were wonderful!

Ai9D0i5adhnFgP3pcpeAGQ.text: Wow!! Ordered delivery. They arrived right on time! Ahi tuna salad was amazing. Crab fried rice was tasty!! Curry chicken fettuccine was genius!! Ive been to plenty of thai restaurants and i was impressed!!

a8OTKB8hGeljSem5F_wwuQ.text: Ordered today and wasn't a big fan of what I got. The egg rolls were the highlight of the meal but the duck was very dry and didn't taste good at all. This was a carry out order so dining in could be much better but I probably won't try to find out.

yM9NhyUkuc9-NkeeKoUO_A.text: Will never go back to this place again.  My mother and I used to love this place. We would go all the time. We just went today for the first time in months and i don't know if they changed owners because it is not the same.  The waiters and waitresses are so slow!! The food is not as good as it used to be. The ice has a very bad taste to it.  We went with my 4, all under the age of 9, nieces. When they brought the bill we were all ready surprised because the bill was so high. We checked the bill and saw that they already charged us 20%tip!!!! We asked the waiter why and he said cause it's 4 people or more. That is so ridiculous I have never heard of that!!! Especially charging for children.  Which makes perfect sense why we had such bad service.  Will never go back.

OJVV3DvEElMKVZ5fiTABPw.text: Excellent food! Everything was delicious. The food was very light and had the right amount of spice.

MOuxNfSrK9yyYw5OL94PSA.text: Recently whenever I order delivery they don't cook the tofu. It used to be fried tofu and now it's just soft and has no flavor. I'm afraid to order delivery again since this has happened twice and it ruins the curry :(

9X3xTx5R1KDoDeNTxtgH1A.text: Found this place via Yelp because I was craving some spice.  I had ordered my food ahead of time for quick pick up.    I decided to order the garlic short ribs since this dish had been one of the recommended as I read through the reviews.  When I arrived they greeted me with big smiles and since my order was not quite ready, they pointed me to have a seat in the mean time.  The atmosphere is like your typical Thai restaurant, big furniture and large art.    When I got my order I quickly took it back to my office to enjoy.  I decided to order more salad then having rice.  I think I jipped myself because there was not that much salad.  However, there was plenty of garlic short ribs.  I give it an A-OK rating because there were some pieces that were rather dry.  I thought it was going to be full pieces of short rib, but it was cubes.  So I didn't quite have what I thought I would of gotten.  The taste is good, but warning that you will be burping that garlic all day long.  LOL.    I probably will return to try out some other dishes.  Seems to be a hit or miss and I'll be determined to find that special dish.  Every place has a special dish.

S0_Q9a6a-BCdN-Nj7t_LGQ.text: One of my fave Thai spots and super close too. Im always in for tom kha soup! Yummerz! Beef pad see ew is good, my husband's favorite. Crab rangoon and fried shrimp are not to be snobbed at. I love curry dish, i haven't tried the panang yet. Im not so impressed with massaman curry though. It lacks flavors maybe salt? Too souppy. I like my curry a little bit thick. And who can forget thai iced tea or coffee??? I love both. Plus its free refill!!! Free refill people! I usually get mango sweet rice. Too bad mango is not in season anymore.

uBDy5L_3kxngw7Eo6JQ-cg.text: This place always forget one item but they return in less than 15 min and with an extra something. So I love them and they still get 5 stars. We always get the sticky rice and beef jerky! Delicious!

qZqEKfF2DMYWiEDEfd5TmQ.text: The restaurant has a nice ambiance and you did not feel like you were too close to other diners. My party of 4 was quickly seated and our server promptly brought our drinks. I had a vanilla chai tea and it was amazing! I am a huge tea fan and I really could have knocked back 2 before my meal arrived. For my appetizer, I ordered the summer rolls and they were delicious. I absolutely love the taste of mint with the tangy peanut sauce. My main course consisted of the yellow curry with potatoes, coconut milk, and tofu. The curry had great flavor and even though I ordered it spicy, the peppers were not overbearing. If you are not really into spice, you can order no spice.   The only slight negative was our server appeared to be working a large amount of tables by herself, so she was rushing and some of the plates had a rough "landing" on our table. It was no big deal and other than that, it was a positive experience.

noLdonFjhfPqs_cXi-GK_w.text: Panna Thai is a cozy restaurant in the corner of a strip mall. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is above average for a restaurant of this size and popularity.  The wait staff was fairly attentive and friendly.  I had the beef salad, which they do a little differently than most Thai places... the beef is done barbeque style, so it has a smokey flavor. Overall I prefer the more traditional pan-seared marinaded steak for this dish.

gq3NDRqzBvDzG0OlfI1lLw.text: Great neighborhood Thai restaurant. Perfect for pick up or delivery. Dine in is ok ... wait staff is always friendly and we're never left waiting. Excellent coconut soup!!

Lkk28FbxG0oz9vMGjovAkg.text: Nice ambience! Location is convenient! Food is tasty! Very quiet and the prices are pretty fair! Definitely coming back

G0xM6G60viyzL7GNqoDldg.text: Whether you eat in or order take out, you can't go wrong here. Plentiful portions and well seasoned.  As a vegan, there are plenty of options for me. I've been here a couple of times and they are always consistent with food quality. You won't be disappointed. Heck, they even deliver! What could be better than that?

9s9dzQaAoH7GvIF9wiNwQg.text: This is me and my wife's go to place.  We love this place and order out all the time.  We get everything from the soups to the beef salads to Pad Thai, garlic short ribs.  The service for us is always great and the food is always good, we have never had an issue there and we've been going for at least the last 5 or 6 years since we discovered it.  Highly recommend.  They have great and affordable lunch special as well.

1d5nl8ER2CZL8bwTcSIMEA.text: 5 stars for the food.... Absolutely amazing..  I've only tried a few dishes but I can assure you the Pad Thai..  And BBQ spare ribs are worth every calorie in every bite..  The meat LITERALLY falls right off the bone..  Also really enjoy the summer spring rolls with peanut sauce without mint...  The only thing that is a turn off is the estimated wait time for delivery...  I was told over an hr but called back to cancel and they ended up delivering within 45 minutes... I popped my car tire and hadn't grocery shopped so I was seriously starving..  Overall love this place...  If I wasn't so hungry I'd wait the hr  with no problem!

iBMRAugk1mnHY8OmvdP6XQ.text: Food and service at this restaurant was excellent! I will definitely be returning here very soon!! One of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas!!! Hands down

1KdSppvzsXU_kr-MqluEnQ.text: So yummy.  this is my second time ordering from here on Eat 24. Everything is delicious. My favorites are the tom yum soup with shrimp and the sweet basil with tofu. Quick and friendly delivery girl.

_zcFieKYaOMiTpsxLu5LoQ.text: Horrible service. The food is good but with service like pana provide their paying costumers even the best food in the world will taste like s**t. To the grumpy waiter - carma ia a...

uAK7z2o2JW4XzlguFNRmKg.text: Did I seriously not write a review on this place yet?   I've frequented MANY thai places (all in LA except for Lotus of Siam), and this place is pretty dang good.   LArb- 5 star. THe best I've had. Maybe they had a good day, I dunno, but it had a great amount of lime and cilantro with a serious kick. DELICIOSO!  Drunken Noodle- 5 star. AKA Pad Kee Mao.  SOOOO GOOOOOOD. LOVE.   Panang curry- 2.5 star.  Meh, I'd skip this. It was heavy on the cream and tasted a bit too americanized for my taste.   In general the food here is a bit more americanized than authentic thai. I like the decor, and the prices are awesome.   My fave here so far is the THAI ICED TEA.   I can really taste the black tea in there instead of the one's that are just diluted with a bunch of cream in it. And free refills? Too good to be True. That's unheard of in L.A.    Def Try.

d7z-yXZr3iQl--No3SJ0hA.text: Been here a few times, the staff is friendly and the food is great! Nice decor overall & the free refills on Thai iced tea when dining in are a plus. The Papaya Salad and Pad See-ew are delicious.  Highly recommended!

4tjPC3ARuLLI3wtf03APXQ.text: First time here and the pics looked great but as one reviewer states the food was kinda bland. Wife and I had 3 items: panang (beef) garlic shrimp and diver scallops. Presentation was nice but I really don't go to restaurants for pretty food ... I wanna fill my belly!!! I decided that this is not my go to place for Thai food but I wanted to try bc the pics looked so appetizing.... like I always say ... try it ... you might like it!!!

MPvc-Lt2lcCLWspFV65a1w.text: I ordered the beef salad meet was chewy the crab in the crab fried rice was imitation and clearly not fresh also rice has chunks of something hard in it prob shell from the can crab, now let's rewind the ordering process was very hard the lady could barley understand me not from her lack of English but because of her talking in the background to other staff she said it was busy out when I came yo pick up my order it was only a small birthday party needless to say I'm NEVER going back

YyNDYDBPZ5dVGWOKgQ3g7Q.text: Service and speed are the reason why I give this a 2 star. Always a wait with plenty of tables available. Got a to go order. Salmon curry had approximately 8 cubes of salmon about 1/8 inch. Very small box and curry spilled all into salad that was about 5 pieces and egg roll was soggy   Much to be desired for take out.

bc99VkwYeLap4uJQfzXLYA.text: This is one of the very few Thai restaurants that is very consistent with flavor and quality. Out of all the times we have been there whether it's taking out or dining in they have always surpassed our expectations. Here in Vegas we're pretty spoiled with our food choices because of the amount of restaurants within a 10 minute drive but this one in particular has made its rounds consistently in our top 10.

aSHpU-lUsrpoiKrlek5A2g.text: Tried this place for the first time and I absolutely loved it!!! The food was super fresh and prices are reasonable! It's hard to find good Thai Restaurants and this one is on my favorites list!

8gVg-jz3RgOV4GpqvhzcsA.text: The pad thai was disappointing and steamed dumpling was not even hot.  The only saving grace was the mango sticky rice.  I won't be back.

5Tw_VvHmCimVCDeuGJ9i0A.text: As I am reading the reviews here I am a little ticked off. I spent $ 60.00 for two here last night..  We Ate plenty.. I ordered the Thai Ice Tea and according to the reviews on yelp they give free refills on the Thai Ice Tea as long as you dine in..  I did not receive one offer for a refill on my Thai Ice Tea from any of the 2 or three servers that were handling our table. The food was good though. I would have given them 4 stars if the service was better.  I went back to this restaurant again and it was perfect. Plenty of Thai tea refills and great food. Service was excellent as well. The restaurant is decorated beautifully too. I will be back to Panna Thai.

F3gxw3uXXBEt8bsnVPKb2w.text: Another great meal at our fav thai restaurant.  Had the mango chicken this time an it was awesome. It comes witj white rice an the flavor is great. Its sweet an just enough batter on the chicken is perfect. Great portions as well. They never disappoint.  Great food an great service.  Also had my favorites crab wanton an egg rolls. Thank for another great meal.

7tTvQLlDdUytj8RHKtDsIg.text: I ordered a red curry chicken, and chicken chow mein. Unfortunately curry was the worst I ever had. Bamboo shoots were under cooked, therefore each time I put one in my mouth after chewing a few times I had to take it out. And the chicken was extremely overcooked. with chow mein, it was only so so, bit bland. I have eaten here couple of times before, never had a problem. I am assuming a new  cook maybe? Extra star is for the service, guys who work here are always very polite and quick.

hw-bGoyvlkysbG84COp6Vg.text: Unfortunately it did not go well. The service was friendly but when I got my take out home I found there was hardly any sauce on the pad se ew so it had no flavor. I had to make my own sauce and add it. Then I was enjoying my fresh spring rolls when I found a bug smashed on the piece of lettuce that was under them. Not very appetizing to say the least. I probably won't be back since both dishes I received had issues.

Wf9kMHAU80Jw7RWv5TmdlQ.text: BEST THAI PLACE I HAVE TRIED SO FAR.... amazing service from are server apple just great food most difficultly I will come back

wia7z3eGdxYQ-v0ErCcT7Q.text: Came here for lunch 2 days, and was honestly thinking of giving it just 4 stars until the second day when I got the pink noodles.    This place has really good food, I really don't have anything to complain about, but it just wasn't blow my mind status...until I looked at the regular menu and saw the pink noodles.  SO GOOD!!!  It's a bit sweet but at the same time spicy and you can choose what types of noodles: thick flat, thin noodles, or egg noodles, and I got mine with the squid and shrimp, and they didn't skimp on that amount either which was spectacular. I was sooooo happy with my food!!  I also ordered the asparagus and mushrooms, smaller plate but definitely a good size, cooked well and the mushrooms tasted amazing!!  I will probably be back in the area again sometime for work and I am definitely planning on coming back here for some of that awesome food! :)
