ID-l5uJnhl8UIIx8QH2nBg.text: I have ordered pretty much everything on the menu and it has all been delicious!  I do get sad when they run out of the mango sticky rice though, it is my addiction.  The restaurant is clean and the staff is very polite and accommodating.  The presentation of their food is nicely plated, even when I order for delivery.  You can't go wrong with the spare ribs, larb, pad thai, and mango sticky rice!

TKZm1WQVjWxYWicqFnxhjA.text: Great food and service! Got Thai tea, coconut water, tom kha soup, duck roll, tuna tartar, and pad Thai. Everything was delicious, tasty, and fresh. I would definitely come here again and try different entrees!

za3EZG8FCfhlYKyojUkADQ.text: This place has amazing food but they literally mess up your order EVERY SINGLE TIME    Doesn't matter if you give your order in person or detailed instructions via online ordering, they can't figure it out.

-vL6vk2DP1Lj2QWBBYhW_Q.text: This is my most favorite restaurant in town. I would give this restaurant more than five stars if I could.   Every time I dine in here, I never get disappointed. The foods here are so awesome. Some items you cannot find at other places such as Yum-Eggplant, Spicy crab noodle, etc.   Also, don't skip the desserts here. The mango with sweet sticky rice here is amazing. The chef makes it into a cute heart shape, and its taste way better than its look. You must try it !!! While other thai restaurant cannot offer sweet mango during winter, I must applaud its management that they are so good at sourcing ingredients and keep its good quality of foods at high standard all year round.   On top of that, I like the service here. Servers are always attentive. I always get greeting every time I enter or leave the restaurant. My Thai Iced Tea drink always get refilled (for free.) They are very nice and friendly.   Lately, I've seen they have more varieties of wine to offer. If you are a wine lover who like to pair it with Thai foods, then this restaurant would be your top choice.

A69mGe6viXAQEZek_Fvl2A.text: Ordered phad thai (extra spicy)/shrimp & spider crab/coconut curry. It was soooo delicious n tasty.  Shrimps on phad thai were huge and spicy was perfect.  Wish give us little bit bigger portions.

H10001JplsgczBhmzvWkxQ.text: This is one of my go to Thai restaurant, me and my bf really enjoy the Larb here and bang bang shrimp. The restaurant has nice ambiance and overall every time I come it's an enjoyable experience.

cYHcmSiVmFzpX8zyp3vv3w.text: very good and very pretty layout. tasty food. my friends really like the larb. the quality is great

y_om6r3WdMNRidHmSdqp8g.text: I love this place so much. I am personally a vegetarian and one of my favorite things about it is that Thai restaurants offer so many options for me, this one specifically. Their lunch special is also amazing and super affordable. The staff here is also so kind I've never had such great service at a restaurant before. I would definitely come back here!!

RAMTFuUta6Fia5ab06ahWw.text: I'm not sure why I never tried Panna Thai until now but I'm glad I did. It was a rainy week this week in Vegas and after cooking something at home and it not turning out just right I called Panna.   I ordered the crab wontons and pork pad see ew. I have been on a pork kick lately so that was the reason instead of going traditional with the beef. I was really eager to try the crab wontons as I saw that it was made with real crab. Sure enough it was as delish as other Yelpers had said it was and I even told my husband he HAD to try it. The consensus in our household was that it was pretty great. The pork pad see ew was good but I'm a carbs person. The pork to noodle ratio was about 2:1 so I felt like I was eating a lot of meat. Overall the flavor was good I just didn't like the overbearing meat but if you are a meat eater than this is definitely for you. I have to say I felt like I did get my money's worth in regards to both items.   The next day I wanted to try the BBQ pork noodles. It's BBQ pork noodle soup and I really really really enjoyed the pork. It was tender and there was plenty (which in this case I appreciated). Yes, I know I'm picky but I felt that the pork to egg noodle ratio was just perfect. I also ordered the spicy basil pork. Now that dish was just ok...definitely not my favorite place to order it from as I missed the cucumbers that do come with it at other Thai places. Overall, I def enjoyed this place. They do get busy though because the second night even though we ordered it at 7:30 pm it still was a 20-30 minute pick up time. They deliver too if you really need some Thai food.

JqeywlIcQghLPUJjWdKH1A.text: Great food and Great service. My daughter loves their chicken saute. Great location down the street from my house.

js788LyA4vc3RpsIEWm1dw.text: Love LOVE love this place. I've never been to the actual restaurant but have ordered through doordash and this place is fantastic.   We have ordered a few things off the menu, but my favorite is the chicken satay with peanut sauce (it also comes with egg fried rice and cucumber salad) and of course the chicken pad Thai. It has some kick, but not a ton. I def will keep ordering from this place and wanna try out their Thai tea or coffee next.

xuGGW33BX7aDckkE1r-irg.text: Great place, friendly atmosphere.  Food was excellent !!  My friends and I were in town and had craving for Thai food, I found this place on Yelp, and we were not disappointed.  Pad Thai & Panang curry is the best I've ever had.  Food was served fresh, delicious and quickly.  Their Tom Kha soup is to die for.., so much flavors.  Service was great, friendly and attentive.  I will definitely go back and I would recommend this place !!

YULbyVU2hvbdKjvJw4HGzQ.text: So I am 6 1/2 months pregnant and have been craving Thai food. I was SO excited to try this place. I called and ordered A LOT of food. I ordered  Pepper steak Spicy pad Thai  Golden cups  Royal duck Bang bang shrimp Pad se ew beef Thai tea  When I called to order I had my husband there reading off that I wanted and he texted me what I told him I wanted because I wanted to make sure NOT to forget.  When I ordered the pad Thai the male and I discussed how hot I wanted it.  The food took an hour to come and it was cold, but I was STARVING so I didn't really care. My husband pointed out that there was food missing so we checked and it was the Spicy Pad Thai. I wasn't upset, shit happens so I just called and the guy I spoke to apologized and said they will make it and bring it right over.  Soon after I get another call and it was the guy that I originally spoke and who took my order and he said I didn't place the order. I reminded him that he and I spoke about the hotness of the pad Thai and he said yeah, but it wasn't ordered so I need your credit card number again. He said I will leave a note when you order again to give you something free and I said no thanks, I won't be ordering again.  The food is really good, but it took an hour to be delivered and then they accuse me of lying and won't fix what they messed up. I will have this resolved tomorrow during business hours... Guaranteed!!!!!!

d1uEb1gQSm_LEOdgZUC3HA.text: Must try this place.  Always have great service and amazing food.  Love their unlimited Thai Tea!!  Thank you for always taking care of us!!  Never leave this place hungry!!  I love this place!!

X2Y83PYOZH8Sqh75kkgf9Q.text: I love love love the Pad Thai  I highly recommend it. We ordered with pork and I like how they grilled the pork first to add more flavor to the Pad Thai. Services are so nice as well very nice people.

wu-uoullTmWRRIRrI-cxjg.text: food was cold and small  portions. some of the lettuce have turn brown already. don't think we will be back.

qQIPUtzjMH5gDpA4aiS0xA.text: Today was my first time at panna Thai. The staff was so quick to seat us and are all so quick with assisting us and serving us

AIkHhspSzImSy2_CITEHwQ.text: I'm visiting Vegas. I decided to give this restaurant a go based on 2 things the pictures and delivery.  I found what I wanted from the menu posted here online. Called and the person taking the order had a pretty thick accent. For, a second I thought, " this may not work..." however, the female on the other line was patient and kind she had no problem trying to help me. That was star number one! Be aware for delivery there is a $25 or $30 minimum, sorry can't remember & it was only last week Friday lol. Estimated delivery was 55 minutes and it came on time... star 2. I gave them a small request on how to deliver, I'm at a Airbnb and though it was a tad bit odd they had no problem with the request... star 3. The delivery person deserves a sky full of stars she was so polite and very thoughtful it bumped the resteraunt to 4 stars for me - seeing there's no button for  a "sky full." And last the food, oh em... it tasted so fresh. I don't know how in the world they packed it to look so presentable for delivery that was a pleasant surprise. 5 stars for the experience.   It is pricey but I was aware before ordering. There was more than enough food. I haven't tried a lot of Thai food so the taste is different for me but it was delicious. Definitely worth trying out.

Q7nc8ndiG8tOsVSKItg9FA.text: Love their free Thai ice tea deal. Food was good. Service is very good and the place is really nice and calm, great to sit and chat. We had the pad Thai and the pineapple rice. I liked the rice, it's very unique.

8R8j75P3BH_WwtDdGuhO7Q.text: I always like to try places to eat in my neighborhood and boy, did I get lucky. Panna Thai is great place with great service, and a good lunch menu. Good food at a good price AND good service.

s-nFEyE0Z7DlY0SNuhXZXw.text: Friendly staff, good service and good food. If you love Thai food you should definitely check it out. Finish off your meal with sticky rice on your mangos!

Fq2VkDmDVNtkv14hDGI6gA.text: Today I had the Duck Soup and Garlic Short Ribs. It was ahhhmazig to say the least!  Apple our waitress was great she's so friendly and nice!!   The soup was cooked to perfection with tender prices of duck shredded into the soup; while the Garlic Short Ribs were also tender.   Excellent service and even better food!

Fh2wKjrFigsjbNjjeAgBBA.text: Every time I go food is great!! The bbq spare ribs are my favorite. My team loves it!!

ieRsLCKD92978dmGZJoLAA.text: Excellent food and you have to try their bang bang shrimp. Good service friendly crew. One of the best Thai I've had in town

A09-IPctO4yf10DaOZD4HQ.text: Love this always amazing  Clean place ,. Servers, and bathrooms. I have been here several times and I am always pleased with everything.

iCbAo1Dqndxv4MkDuOGAAQ.text: I order postmates delivery from this place all the time. They give very generous portions, and the food always comes delicious. There's these shrimp dumplings that are really good. I could eat those all night. I also recommend getting the pad se ew with beef. It has a little bit of that char smokey flavor and the noodles are soft.   The prices seem pretty reasonable as well. Delivery is always more expensive and it was still under $80 to feed 6 adults.

McXppkX7hGS38nPcvvJi6g.text: I was so happy that The Original Thai BBQ (my favorite Thai restaurant) has a sister company closer to my place, so of course I had to try it out.  My family ordered: Tom Kha soup, combination Pad Thai, Beef Panang, & BBQ Spare Ribs, Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice, & Fried Banana (ala mode)  PROS: * Free refills on the Thai Tea... And they even refill it for you without asking them. That's a major plus! * Tom Kha soup, Pad Thai, and BBQ spare ribs tastes very similar (and even exactly) to the ones at Thai BBQ * Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice was delicious! * Serving size is reasonable & sufficient * Their lunch menu prices are awesome! $6.95 - $7.95, you can't beat that. Although the meat would be less than from the dinner menu, the lunch menu includes rice, soup, and an egg roll * The owners were super nice & friendly * Cute decor inside  [CONS]  * Unfortunately, their Panang was just okay. That was a major bummer since that's my favorite dish. It wasn't as creamy & sweet. However, the owner said that next time we order Panang, we can request for it to be more creamy & sweet (and even mention for it to taste like the one at Thai BBQ). So, I'll give it another shot the next time I eat here * Fried Banana had too much coconut on the outside. My sisters love coconut, but even they said the coconut pieces were overwhelming.. On the plus side, the vanilla bean ice cream it came with was yummy  Overall, it was good & convenient location.

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All for me ; )
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Panang... Wasn&#39;t as creamy or as sweet, but can ask to customize it next time (per the owner)
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Spare Ribs (from the dinner menu) Tastes just like S-2 from Thai BBQ! Yum

5xvSFa6vM0XNeJK4kY-lHg.text: Omg I don't know how to start my review but omg it's been a long time since the last time we had a pretty perfect meal. Thanks for PannaThai, we did enjoy our lunch in a best way. Delicious food, good service. I was impressed by the menu while I was looking for a new Thai place to try, a place that is far from center. If you're already tired of typical Thai foods, please come to this place please please please. They won't let you down. At first, I wanted to order Crab Rangoon, Chicken Satay, Crispy Tofu, Duck Roll but my bf wanted Golden Cup, Steamed Dumpling and Bang Bang Shrimp. I know it's a lot but sorry, they're too really unique to make me want to try all of them. But finally we just got Bang Bang Shrimp - omg a hidden gem, a star, it's like Coconut milk-Curry Shrimp. Must try must try, if you're not a fan of curry, you can skip it. The Shrimp wasn't over cooked so you can fell the freshness, and that's what I love. Another one we got was Panna Sampler - Chicken Satay yay, Tofu a Eggplant skewer - uhm no  and Crab Rangoon yasss. However, Tofu&Eggplant killed me softly, its sauce is..... sorry words are useless to express. Please try. Chicken satay was okay, a little bit salty, but not bad at all. We also order Tom Yum soup like usual but it's too sour. The last ones were Basil Noodle - flat noodle with meats, eggs, onions, basil and bell peppers for my bf and Crab Fried Rice for me. He loved the noodle, it's tasty i think. My Crab Fried Rice had a alot of crab meat and eggs, it's good too, I've been trying it at different places but That St Cafe has the best one. Thai Iced Tea was a little bit sweet for me. And we finished 2 appetizers, 1 soup, 2 main dishes, 1 drinks, total was just $52 no tax&tip, we had take out the leftovers. We will come back and tell everyone for sure.

haXmfqghaz_bT059yhwAEg.text: This is a regular for us for my son. We're near this location twice a week and he gets the same thing - Pad See Ew. I've also tried the tofu with garlic eggplant. Both of these we highly recommend. My son gets it medium spicy and it's good. The one time we ordered green beans, we were disappointed because it wasn't what we're used to. It tasted more like a soy gravy over green beans than a Thai green bean.  It's definitely good.

sgWy0e27-fKPwB08QjlbvA.text: Soo yummy. So glad I stumbled across this place. Vegan friendly!!!! Left full and happy:)

NWwYYpe_lnVzIQ5IuYoOTw.text: This is my favorite Thai place in the South Summerlin area! I have tried several Thai places since moving here and nothing compares to this place. The Thai food is authentic and delicious! My favorites are the Pad Thai Shrimp and Gai Ga Prow Thai style (dry-cooked with minced chicken with basil). I also loved the Seafood Tofu Eggplant dish. I have been eating Thai food for more than 20 years in places all over the US and in Thailand. The decor here is also very modern and servers are friendly and helpful. My favorite server is definitely Apple - she knows my favorite dishes and provides excellent customer service whenever I come in. You should definitely give this place a try if you love Thai food.

RnZ3TtlFB-dIpoeUMKeo6w.text: Panna Thai is one of my best Thai restaurants. We often take family and friends here. The restaurant is clean and spacious and servers are usually attentive and friendly. Our server today was Anna and she was friendly, attentive and patient and understanding with our messy toddler. They have great lunch specials and refillable Thai Ice Tea.  I would recommend this restaurant!

pXLrTOdy3AjAEaSEreZ74Q.text: Amazing food ! Great service! Great variety of food but you can't go wrong with BBQ Chicken and mango & sticky rice!

hw7s1_pyru0wSxSAueQLkQ.text: I had Tuna tata and golden cup for appetizer it was really good. And I had Pink noodle soup for main course. I told the server that I wanted spicy less sweet and I got exactly what I requested.  Also excellent service!!!

ItOw0yiGnrZwjolVJcr5uA.text: The food was good but they charged for every single dish couple dollars extra. So our total was 10$ more than it should. The manager explained that they increased the prices but didn't change the prices in the menu yet. For me it felt like they were lying . I just don't get it how you can charge your costumers more then it says in the menu without letting them know. So be careful when you go there.

APKk2esjnTd7DbSnt_cZdw.text: Always my go to spot when I crave Thai food! Delicious fresh food, the atmosphere is everything! Love the lounge vibe and they even gave us free dessert as a surprise! Recommend to locals and tourists, delivery is attentive and correct every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vZip8-y7FVBHtm21RfIXVQ.text: I came here for dinner with some friends and... I totally love this place! The ambiance has more of a business casual vibe... Could be great for a date night... Or a business lunch :)    The servers were all very sweet and on top of the table. They made great suggestions for food and beverages. Our waters were always full and I never had to ask for another glass of wine :) (They only offer beer and wine).   They offer a large menu with lots of different veggie dishes! I was really excited about that! I ordered a red curry with lots of veggies! The spice level ranges from mild to extra spicy. I ordered spicy and could of definitely used more heat... So if you like hot... Make sure you are very specific. My friend ordered a yellow medium beef curry and loved it!! My other friends orders BBQ chicken with veggies and fried rice. Both said the chicken was really really good.   Dessert consisted of a chocolate lava cake with ice cream and fried coconut bananas with ice cream, neither of which I could eat... But the lava cake got some raving reviews!!   They have some really amazing lunches specials that I plan on checking out. I am really excited to go back!

_s-Lk5W1l88FAqqLUgB8sg.text: Valentine is my fave and the BEST server!! This place has great food-ALL OF THE FOOD IS TASTY! I'm here for lunch... and dinner a lot!

icp8WkOqROJQMpwnqQGd1Q.text: The food is great the service was fast and friendly. I came at 11am no crowd, but what impressed me the most was seeing the entire staff sit together for a meal I'm assuming family ties. It's always nice to see the employees enjoying the food they serve speaks volumes

SY-Grx_V8yykFWaHcxjgLw.text: Nothing out of the ordinarily bad or good with this place. It tastes like what it supposed to taste like. My wife and I both got curries and we enjoyed them both, they also give a nice side helping of white rice with it as well, being that some restaurants will not offer free side of rice with curry. All in all, if we are feeling some thai, we will be back!

arOdelkiI5l0MlygNoi-1A.text: Two stars for decent Thai food. But tonight will be the last time I order from Panna Thai.  Let me recap. On 12/28/15 I placed an order and it took 2 hours and 13 minutes to arrive. Because of this inconvenience, I was told I would receive a free order of pad Thai.  Tonight I said to my wife, "Oh hey I have a free order of pad Thai babe!" so I placed another order with them. The woman who took my order was able to see the note on my account immediately which was great. She took my order, and gave me my total and reiterated I was receiving the pad Thai for free. -Not once did she read my order back to me-. (You will see why this detail is important later)  The delivery was prompt this time, about 40 minutes as opposed to the atrocious amount of time it took on Monday. I ordered the following:  -Thai iced coffee -Chicken pad Thai (the freebie) -Beef Sa-te (my wife's fave) -Chicken basil rice   I received all of the above as well as 3 free egg rolls, which was nice. However, they gave me chicken sa-te instead of beef. Mind you this is my wife's favorite, and if I order sa-te it's going to be beef.  So I call just to let the restaurant know, thinking maybe this is something that was miscommunicated due to an error in their order placement system. I wasn't asking for a handout or anything. But instead the woman on the phone tells me that she was the one who took my order, and I definitely ordered chicken sa-te because she read my order back to me. "This is part of the rules." she says, so I must be crazy. My wife doesn't love the beef sa-te, and I must have ordered chicken. I responded to her telling her that it's not a big deal, I just wanted to let them know, yet she tells me I'm wrong and hangs up.  Needless to say, my family and I will be ordering from a different place when we get the craving for Thai in the future.  Thank you for the free egg rolls though, that would have been a very nice touch if things turned out differently.

cCD_7cs6I7gLffxhv7wcCQ.text: I usually order and take the food home but today I decided to eat in the restaurant. The food has always been delicious but what made me write this review was the service I received. Everyone, from my waitress to the host was kind and attentive and made everything even more enjoyable. This is my favorite Thai food restaurant.

iCK0bWDCDjw_8KpJe__WAQ.text: So much better than Lotus! Bang Bang Shrimp and Spicy Crab Noodle are super yummy. Service was excellent and pretty quick too. Awesome lunch specials with good-size portions under $10.

mxgpyirfgIY1gPf72x3dFw.text: I ordered delivery on Saturday night.  I ordered around 7:15PM.  My order confirmation said 45-60 minutes.  2 hours and 20 minutes later, after 2 calls to the restaurant to confirm if my order was coming or not, it finally arrived.   The food was good, I felt the portions were small compared to other Thai places I've ordered from.  I probably won't be ordering delivery from them again.

_bTRxi6oNMezBy1GORADIA.text: I've ordered delivery and pick up and service is always polite and fast. Our go to is the ped see ew and curry dishes and they are always delicious! For pick up I was greeted by Apple who was really friendly:) The restaurant looks clean and nicely decorated. I want to try a dine in experience next time and I'm sure we won't be disappointed!

z_UTcCW9tXL0O61sVTVbug.text: Wow!  We drive out of our way to eat here when we are staying on the Strip. Best thai food that I've had in Nevada. Huge portions too.   The peanut sauce is made fresh to order and is the tastiest I have experienced.   The soup and fresh rolls are also good with evidence of  fresh cut veggies  Get the basil chicken medium spicy and you'll be good to go.  Service can be a pain during busy hours however.

PF4Bm2x2CfRgIJRjOa22cA.text: I order from this location occasionally. The food is OK, and the portion is usually generous. However, I give the restaurant only two stars based on my last two experiences with them. One time I ordered some lunch specials to go including a beef Pad Thai. When I started to eat I immediately noticed the beef was spoiled and tasted disgusting. It's not just not fresh it's literally spoiled. So I threw the entire box away. The second time I placed the order online for pickup at about 7:45 pm. When I arrived the restaurant at 8:10 they appeared to forget about my order. I waited in the lobby and expected my order to be ready in 10 mins as the restaurant was only 1/3 full. However, I waited until almost 9 PM! They gave me a free Thai tea for my wait and I guess that's why I hesitate to give them a 1 star.

IOpeXrqasjWOQLQT9L5hqw.text: A good Thai place that is open on Sundays! I ordered take out and my food was ready exactly when they said it would be. Although I did not dine in, i did check out the dining room and it seemed very clean. The staff was very friendly and quick. I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai lunch special it was about $8, this pad thai was made with a little bit of thicker noodle than I have normally had on Pad Thai. It could have had a little more flavor for my taste, but it was still really good. It comes with an egg roll, and a small salad. I had a thai iced tea as well which was PERFECT! I really liked this place! I will definitely come back again and try some of their curry.

qZ95TVdnf5cqa1AnmYfIsw.text: THE BEST THAI FOOD EVER......... Wife brought me here I never thought I would love it some much if it wasn't so far from home I would eat here every day. Their ribs are AMAZING and there spicy chicken chowmain is the BOMB.

RzmLwB7x0XvZvBG8XZeLVA.text: This is one of my absolute favorite neighborhood places for Thai food in Las Vegas. They have an amazing variety of spices in all of their dishes that really put them ahead of other options, and I am obsessed with their noodle based offerings including their massive ramen bowls, pad Thai and chow mien. (I know not on the adventurous side of Thai cuisine, but equally delicious!)   In addition to take away, the restaurant interior is modern and relaxed and makes for a great lunch or dinner spot. It's never super busy, which is great for a quick or long meal. The staff is friendly and have provided awesome service every time I drop in.  They also provide complimentary refills for their Thai iced tea AND Thai iced coffee. Have you ever had Thai iced tea or Thai iced coffee? They are the BOMB and rarely ever offered unlimited at restaurants. They also serve beer and wine, including Singha the greatest Thai beer to ever exist.   If you're in the area you absolutely must try this place.

kSREhUD8WdjgBL3i1DSP2Q.text: My boyfriend and his brother and I all ordered take out we waited a long time to get our food! The waitress was sooo rude she was getting impatient when we were ordering. Then we asked if she can bag in two bags and she gave us so much attitude. By the time we got our food we decided to eat there. We asked for water the guy ignored us then I asked and didn't even acknowledge us. Then he gave us our water finally they never checked up on us none of that. Then we wanted a refill and he told us to hold on with hella attitude. Then he goes to his coworkers and proceeds to talk shit and points at us. It was completely noticeable. And keep in mind there was no one else there we were the only ones. So it wasn't like it was super busy. When we were done eating the guy came up to us and said "are you going to get your fucking food?" And my boyfriend said "we're done eating thank you." Then the guy said "pick up your trash don't leave it here." Then I butted in and said "it's your fucking job to clean up the mess if you don't like your occupation then quit." Then we walk out and he started pacing the window like he was going to come out and get us. Overall the food was great. But the customer service was shit! I recommend not to go there.

a029S0UWPtXjE-dpG1wLjA.text: I thought this place was going to be amazing after seeing these reviews. I have ordered twice from here and both times it's super disappointing not good at all!! How is Thai food bland. Tom Ka soup tasted like sugar water w boiled chicken w raw button mushrooms (didn't know those were Thai) papaya salad is pretty hard to mess up but it's horrible. Waste of money so sick and was looking forward to this. Such a let down. Don't believe the hype!!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad

0lR0dYpnu7cVQJlNLr6dmA.text: Delivery took over 45 minutes but the online ordering was pretty easy and painless.  Beef Salad was the best item in my order.  As another reviewer mentioned, the beef was nicely smokey, and it was okay quality meat, not gristly.  The salad is mostly meat, with light lettuce and some tomatoes and cucumbers.  The dressing is mostly lime juice, which I like.  A good low calorie fairly-healthy choice.  I would have liked cucumber slices that were a bit larger.  Chicken Fried Rice was kind of weird, there were clumps that were really sweet (maybe it was sweetened eggs?), but mostly it was really bizarrely bland.  Tons of onions.  Not much chicken or tomatoes.  I would not get this again, myself.  Green Milk Boba was overpriced, the cup was small styrofoam (12-16oz if there wasn't any ice), 50% ice at least, and barely any boba ($1 upcharge).  The boba were super overcooked to the point they had melted down small.  For $4.50 I could have a monster-size boba somewhere else.  This place is not cheap, but still one of the better delivery options in this neighborhood.  Maybe I'll enjoy some of their other dishes more.

thTKh93HtzWHDsJq1Ln49w.text: Not impressed with their spice level at all. I got a 5 for extra spicy and it was nearly even a kick. The Pad Thai was soggy and not good flavor sadly. The chicken salad was great along with the Chai Tea. I was hoping to have another fave Thai place but I'll be sticking to my #1 fave.

iZBgIQBr4haX1JSDoIJ-uw.text: The food is delicious! Restaurant is clean. They have great dish presentations. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Their prices are reasonable as well. We have dined here twice and enjoyed it both occasions. Definitely a place to check out!

JpnVPKJqp1Q5XPtj_MQMIA.text: They have lunch specials here every single day, not just on weekdays. My go to here is the sate chicken skewers. Their peanut sauce is to die for! I wish they would sell it bottled so I could hoard it.   I went with a group and everyone was satisfied with their meals. The lunch specials were served with a good amount of food, not too much or too little. Sunday around noon was not busy and we got great service.   For dessert, I had the Thai sweet sticky rice topped with homemade coconut ice cream inside of a shaved coconut. Yes, you read that right. It sounds as good as it tastes too! Yummy!!!! It's not on the menu in the exact way I got it, but the waitress told us about it and we couldn't resist.   I need to go back here to try more items on the menu. I liked it a lot!

photos.caption: Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings of angel appetizer and spare ribs lunch special
Photo of Panna Thai Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sate chicken lunch special &amp; sticky sweet rice w/ coconut ice cream inside a coconut

w_0KmGem78j1EqBTo6hxTw.text: I am so glad I decided to try a new Thai place after going down the street for 2 years. I wanted to find something that was better than "just ok" and dare I hope for even friendly service? Well I found that at Panna Thai and I not only highly recommend it but will return. Most amazing Garlic Beef, which has been hard to find out here in Vegas. I used to live in Thai Town L/A for quite a few years so it's really hard to impress me when it comes to Thai Cuisine. This place not only has great food, but what really stood out was the friendly waitress/cashier. She was running around doing everything herself and never broke stride, all with a fantastic attitude. The place was clean, comfortable and you know it's a good sign when you walk in and the place is filled with patrons native to the food's country of origin :)

nQySuoPesLE9iZtkoeJvoA.text: Excellent service, attentive but not intrusive while while we enjoyed our evening.  We started with Thai ice teas which include free refills - unheard in Portland.  Next was two scrumptious appetizers - potstickers and I believe was called yum yum shrimp - shrimp/crab in a curry sauce - wow! Next, we ordered three entrees - BBQ chicken, eggplant with seafood, and chicken with broccoli.  All dishes were well prepared - eggplant was ordered with no spice, and all flavoring a were savored with each delectable bite - yummy!! BBQ was moist and tender, some so rare to find in Portland.  My friends patronize Panna Thai occasionally but this was my first visit, I will be back!

fWUsY-xSKBLRJPv65NjAug.text: Don't waste your money unless you like food like Panda Express. The satay chicken was hard and plastic like. You get what you pay for. Lesson learned

GD8Gn7TMk9E9qHJNcuqxZw.text: Nice neighborhood Thai place. Good serving size for the Pad See Eww. Worth the price. My new Thai place to go!

44u1g0Bj2oq2fjglDFwKjA.text: Delicious food; lovely, fast service; pretty decor; ice cold Singha!  I love Thai food and this is the best I've had in all my trips to Las Vegas. Will certainly return!

ax8N99jdFzJgQ7AhkDk8gw.text: Amazing Thai food and a great atmosphere!  Family owned and operated! The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is clean.

FDn1clUaDwCXUETjNv3vug.text: One of the better Thai places I have eaten.  I like going here for lunch because they are fast, cheap, and the food is good.  Service is polite and fast.  I have been here four times and have never had a problem.  Every time I tried a different dish and have liked them all.

lS5L3hqpA3qLJgBOCe5q4w.text: I dream about their Pad Woon Sen, that is their silver noodle dish with shrimp, pork, vermicelli, veges and sauce. Let me tell you about the sauce, it's a great balance of sweet, salty, sour and spicy which are the basis for most Thai dishes.   Their tea is also really good quality Jasmine tea bags. I liked it so much, I took a picture so I can look for the brand and but it for home.   Service is good because they kept filling out water and removed our dishes when needed.
